The best thing about it is the smell - while I do like the smell of regular coffee, the combination of vanilla and coffee smells make it incredibly pleasant.

While some flavored coffee can taste fake, or have virtually no taste (other than coffee) this one actually has a nice vanilla and coffee flavors mixed in - and they taste natural to boot.

If you like coffee, and enjoy vanilla, you can't go wrong with this coffee.

This coffee was something we approached tentatively, since we do not like strongly flavored coffee.  However, the quality was consistent with Starbucks' other roasts, and the flavor was not too strong.  A soft, morning coffee.  Very nice.

I must say that i'm not a fan of regular Starbucks coffee at the stores.  I'm a coffee lover and must have one every each day.  Anyways, i thought giving this coffee a try.  I must admit, i'm not sure what they mean by "natural fusion", but it sure does taste good. It's nice and smooth with sutble taste of vanilla. I personally like bolder taste of coffee and this coffee seems more bold.

Summary: I'm not really a coffee drinker, but it's good
Text: Well, let me start off, I'm not really a coffee drinker. I only drink it when I'm tired. So I thought this would be nice to try since it has a little bit of vanilla flavor in it to make it taste better. So I would have to say it taste pretty good for coffee, but if you're expecting it to take taste like vanilla Frapuccino, you will be disappointed :-) . It has a nice light flavor of vanilla in it to give your coffee a unique taste.

Summary: The first flavored coffee we really like! Will buy again.
Text:
I ordered this coffee at at good price, not for the name. But both my husband and I were surprised that we really did enjoy the flavor and aroma without noticing a bitter after-taste. We are by no means coffee experts, we just drink our morning cup to get us going. We've tried different brands and don't usually give much care either way, except for flavored coffees which we usually avoid due to bitterness. They always smell so nice, but the taste, yuck. So maybe there is something to the Starbucks brand, it was good coffee, and I'll have to try some other flavors to see if they stand up to our taste testing as well.

I should note that we make our coffee using an aero press which helps in taking much of the bitter taste out of coffee and we usually drink our coffee with just skim milk.

Summary: Good coffee with a small flavor boost
Text: The Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee, Vanilla Flavored is a very smooth tasting coffee.  There is a very small hint of vanilla flavor that did NOT have a chemical taste.  However, I would have preferred more of a vanilla flavoring as opposed to the minute amount in this coffee.  All in all, this is a good coffee that is not bitter.  I would recommend it to coffee drinkers but not to those who are looking for a burst of additional flavor.

While I do like Vanilla flavored coffee I really don't like it over powering. In fact I usually blend 1/2 regular with 1/2 flavored. Well much to my surprise I didn't have to blend this at all, in fact I really couldn't taste any vanilla at all. It is a great tasting coffee but I really wanted vanilla. Maybe that's why it was selling so cheaply.

Summary: Coffee is fabulous without cream & sugar
Text: I purchased this in hopes that I could drink black coffee to cut the cream & sugar from my diet. It's fabulous!

I like me some Starbucks coffee.

When it is on sale or I have a chance to pick it up when out with a friend, it is always a treat. I was excited when I saw a deal featuring their new Natural Fusions Ground Coffee on Amazon.

I placed my order and (because of Prime) got it in two days. The first thing I noticed was the intense vanilla smell. I could smell it through the bag. After opening the coffee and making a bit, I was expecting an almost over-powering vanilla taste, not the case.

I could only taste a hint of vanilla in the coffee. That was OK, but I was hoping for a bit more. Over-all, it is a good tasting coffee that has a decent boldness. While I prefer non-flavored coffee, I will admit, this coffee tastes pretty good and makes a strong consideration for future purchases. Especially if I can get it on sale.

It has a nice smell when you open the package, but not all that much like coffee. More like Vanilla extract,it really is very lightly flavored compared to regular Starbucks, it could be called Starbucks lite. It has a very pleasent taste but weak. I think if you use a bit more than the usual amount it has a more powerful kick but still not Starbucks par. You can taste a slight Vanilla flavor still not nearly as strong as other flavored coffee I have tried, still very pleasent and tasty though. Not sure I would buy this varity for myself. I like mine a little stronger. If you like a weaker flavored coffee, then you will like this.

I got this for my hubby, who is the real coffee drinker around here.  The smell when it's brewing is so delicious.  It smells sweet and kind of caramel-ish.  The coffee is smooth, and the flavor is subtle but definitely there.  We brew it in a Keurig machine using the filter attachment.  Definitely worth repurchasing.

We enjoyed this coffee and its hint of vanilla taste. It was a decent drink though certainly not the best coffee we have consumed.
it is ground fairly finely and has a coffee odor while it is brewing. It really is a satisfying cup of coffee but nothing to make me rush out and buy it!

Overall, a decent coffee, worth trying out!

ProfileName: Caonabo Javier Peguero "Long live and prosper"
Summary: A taste of starbuck at home
Text:
I was amazed to have the richness and aroma of starbucks cofee at home. If you follow the instructions you won't notice any difference from the coffe yu buy at the starbucks shops and this home made brew.
Highly recommended for people that don't have the time to wait in line, have harsh climate in their area or, like in my case, that live out of the continental US.
I also recommend this coffe for everyone that wants to enjoy life!

Starbucks coffee has a signature taste that my husband describes as "burnt beans".  This SB vanilla blend has the same subtle "burnt" aftertaste, with a hint of vanilla that is just right- not too faint and not too pronounced.  For those who don't usually care for flavored coffees, it might be a nice change.

I thought this was going to be garbage - I feared it would be harsh and watery and have that fake-vanilla flavor you get with these kinds of things.
Not at all. This was a nice mild vanilla flavored coffee. Starbucks tends to be harsh and watery when brewed at home. But this wasn't - I was impressed. Everyone else really liked it too - raved about it, actually.

I thought this coffee would taste a lot better than it did.  Maybe it would taste better with an expensive brewer.  Mine is not the most expensive but far from being the least expensive.  I wouldn't buy this coffee; the Yuban I buy has a lot better taste.

Summary: Nice product as flavored coffees go.
Text:
First off, I think it's fair I mention that I'm not a big flavored-coffee fan. That said, I did enjoy this product more than I thought I would. I chose it as a change of pace over my usual dark roasted plain coffees. The vanilla flavoring is subtle, natural-tasting, and doesn't leave much of an after taste as many flavored coffees do. It's a lot more affordable on Amazon now, but when I received it, it was way over priced. Starbucks coffee is always over-priced (in my opinion) but this stuff was crazy expensive at first.

Definitely recommended if you are a flavored coffee lover, and can get it at a fair price. I just ordered some of the cinnamon variety and can't wait to give it a taste, too.

When you first open the bag, the aroma is fantastic. I love vanilla more than chocolate so I thought this was going to be great, and I drink Starbucks all the time. I found however that the smell was better than the taste. Once I added sugar, it seemed to be better, but I normally don't add sugar in my coffee. It also seemed as though there was an odd aftertaste. The coffee was okay, but I think I'll stick with my regular Breakfast blend.

Yep, They've done it again.  Known for it's consistency, quality and boldness Starbucks company keeps pleasing me (and my taste buds) with every coffee variety.  Although I was a bit reluctant to try this "Flavored" coffee, it is done really well.  I was expecting sweet, but it is just coffee, bold, delightful coffee, infused with vanilla.  It produces a wonderful aroma when you wake up or works well when mixed with a liqueur for a dessert cocktail.

As coffee lovers know, it is sometimes hard to get the same flavor and consistency of brand names at home.  In the case of Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee this is NOT the case.  The coffee is just as good as what you'd get at their shop (though you do have to make it yourself) with a rich and fragrant vanilla taste. Following the recipe as listed, yields a great cup of coffee (which I have not always found to be the case when I purchase brand name coffee - I often have to "fiddle" with the guidelines to produce something close to what I get at their restaurant/shop).  The bag came very compressed and wrinkled and I was initially worried that this would impact its taste but we've made multiple cups since opening up the bag and each has been delicious and the bag itself does the usual job of keeping the product fresh (though I doubt we'll have it for long as good as it is).  If you like Starbucks and/or vanilla coffee, this is a product for you.

This ground coffee smells wonderful . The bag does keep it is fresh and it has a smell button and the vanilla scent is very nice, but the coffee itself isn't particularly vanilla. I wish the smell carried over to the flavor, but it didn't.

This coffee is just not for me; the vanilla gave the coffee an off-note I just didn't like.

I tried. I really did. I brewed it a cup at a time, a pot at a time, by drip, Chemex, and French press. Each and every time, it was a no go for me.

For the record, I like my coffee strong and black. I'm sure that if you add a lot of sugar and cream, this would be just fine.

But for coffee purists, pass this one by.

This is a very smooth blend with such a light hint of vanilla that you might miss it if you weren't paying attention. You know its different but you don't know why ... and then it hits you. It's GOOD! Not overpowering like some flavored coffees; this one has just a hint of flavor and I think it makes it better.

I brought this into work and shared it with colleagues; it quickly became one of our favorite blends. Not bitter at all, yet not weak at all either. A nice, smooth blend perfect for relaxing mornings as well as at work. I will be ordering more.

I'm not a huge fan of flavored coffees. I prefer to add vanilla syrup to regular (Verona) coffee. However, this was a nice change. The vanilla flavor wasn't overwhelming and it was a true vanilla-not perfumey or artificial. I still had to add a little sugar and a splash of cream to make it to my taste but I enjoyed it. The aroma when it was brewing was terrific.

I've tried lots of flavored coffees, and most taste artificial and eventually wear out their welcome. This one is great. It has just enough vanilla to be flavored, but not too much to overpower. This does brew up quite strong, almost as strong as espresso with one tablespoon coffee to one cup of water. However, it's great for my purposes. I've developed an addiction to adding it to warm milk and brown sugar for a vanilla and brown sugar latte (I froth my milk by shaking it up in a jar and microwaving it).  I bet I can't get it that way at Starbucks, but that's okay because I can make it at home just fine ... and cheaper.

I was really excited to try out this coffee since I thought it was going to be bursting with flavor, but unfortunately, I couldn't taste that it was flavored or at all, much less with vanilla.  Now, don't get me wrong, this is a really good-tasting coffee, but it just doesn't live up to its name, in my opinion.  Also, although one of the ingredients is a sweetener, I really didn't find that the coffee tasted significantly sweetened either.  Overall, it's still a pretty good coffee, but don't buy it expecting much vanilla flavor or sweetness because you will probably be disappointed.

Maybe the title above says it all. A cup of Folger's is a perfectly fine cup of coffee but it's the Little League compared to Starbucks. When we stop at a Starbucks' coffee shop, we know that we'll be paying a good deal more for the coffee -- but we're glad (?) to do so. It's really fine coffee. And so too with this 11-ounce package of ground coffee -- the price is more than a bit higher than the regular coffees. And the taste, especially this one with the strong hint of vanilla, is better too.

So treat yourself at home. Buy the packaged ground Starbucks coffee and get that same great taste.

Summary: Very good, but not quite great
Text: It's very difficult to review a product that is so strongly contingent upon personal taste. That being said, I rarely drink flavored coffees but do like them once in a while as a change of pace. When I drink these types of coffees, I prefer to flavoring to be light so that it does not overwhelm the natural coffee flavor. This product almost achieves that balance but the vanilla is just a bit too strong for my taste, hence only 4 stars. If you prefer the flavoring to be a little stronger than I do, then you will love this coffee. It's very robust and flavorful and it smells fantastic while brewing.

ProfileName: Agatha Kristy "•The secret of getting a...
Text:
I served this coffee to my guests on Thanksgiving and everyone LOVED it! It is not only a good flavor coffee but the accent notes of vanilla are just right. No bitterness to the coffee, light refreshing vanilla flavor all added up to a smooooth cup of coffee!
This coffee was good enough to serve to guests, yet feel like an indulgent treat for yourself!

Summary: so good i ordered more - subtle vanilla ground coffee
Text:
Let me say that I'm a big fan of Starbucks fresh-brewed coffee, so it's a nice treat to have it at home too. From a pure coffee perspective, I really enjoyed the rich, medium-strength taste of this finely-ground coffee. It's not quite your local fresh-brewed, but still very good for my average drip coffee maker.

Most flavored coffees just blow you over with aroma and flavor, so I find the subtlety Starbucks Natural Fusions refreshing. But, if you're really looking for a vanilla-flavored coffee, you might want to look elsewhere - it's that subtle.

Of course, the cost is more than your run-of-the-mill coffee in a plastic crate. But for me, the difference in taste and quality is worth it. I've ordered more!

Summary: Hit or Miss is up to you
Text:
Seems like many either love or hate this coffee. My Dad, GF and I have tried and and we all liked it.
I liked the smell of it and didn't find it to be bitter.

Summary: Very smooth.  Subtle is the key
Text: The nice thing about vanilla is that it is subtle.  Unlike other flavors often used in coffees (cinnamon, fall spices, etc.) vanilla is not meant to be a strong flavor.  It is truly their to compliment the coffee.  The vanilla flavor is very natural and takes the edge off the coffee.  The smoothness of the coffee does not overpower the vanilla, and the flavors do not seem to be competing for space on your palette.  I would recommend this coffee as an enjoyable break from your everyday blend.

Summary: Do you like coffee, or only flavored coffee?
Text:
I liked that this flavored coffee wasn't as synthetic tasting/smelling as what most flavored coffees would deliver. You could still taste the Starbucks coffee and I like that, but that's because I like regular coffee. If you're a flavored coffee drinker and you prefer the flavor over the coffee taste, this may not be the one for you.
Since I do not typically drink flavored coffee the ingredient list still left me a little uneasy..although "natural"(which really has such a loose, if any, definition when used in labeling food)the ingredients were just things I was not used to seeing listed on a coffee package.
They were, in order listed:
Ground Coffee, Natural Flavor (with Corn Maltodextrin, Vegetable Glycerin), Ground Vanilla Beans, Indidan Sarsaparilla Root
So, more "natural flavor" than actual vanilla beans. Also, glad I checked before serving this coffee to a close friend of mine who has corn allergies.
A plus I discovered while examining the bag, it says if you bring the empty bag in to one of the US Starbucks stores they'll exchange it for a free 12oz coffee (within 30days of the "best Before" date). :)

Summary: Smooth pleasant flavor- better than VIA vanilla
Text:
Generally I find that flavored coffees always seem to smell better than they taste. It seems like the special flavor disappears once they are brewed. And, I have to admit, I threw out the first pot I brewed of the Starbucks Natural Fusions Vanilla because it was too bland. So when I made the next pot, I added an extra tablespoon of coffee and that made all the difference. The vanilla scent is very natural and not perfume-y, and the vanilla flavor is nice, but not overpowering. Add a little milk and sugar and it's a special treat. I much prefer this to the VIA vanilla packets which, although more convenient, are too strong-flavored and too sweet for me.

Bottom line: if you like flavored coffee that is subtle, but well-balanced, this is a good one to purchase. Just be prepared to add an extra tablespoon or so when you make it.

This is a bit stronger than other vanilla coffees that I enjoy such as New England.  Depending upon your taste, you can enjoy a stronger brew or reduce the amount of coffee you use. I simply use a bit less coffee.  I was skeptical about this coffee as I find Starbucks coffee at the local stores has a burnt taste to it lately and I avoid their coffee in general.  This is a nice rich coffee and there is no hint of burnt coffee flavor.

Subtle vanilla flavor if you don't like your coffee too heavily flavored. My husband, who usually doesn't care for "regular" Starbucks (unlike me) did like this coffee. I actually switched his out (Duncan Donuts) and he noticed it was different but said he really enjoyed it. As for me, I really prefer this to the VIA style with the sugar added, this is much more robust and stands well in an expresso. Nice product, I may give it as a gift for my coffee buddies!

I hope I don't offend but I am not a regular visitor to Starbucks.  It is not because I don't like them but it is because I usually have my coffee at home.  Their product is actually pretty good from the few times I have been to one of their stores.  This product ranks high on my list of prepackaged coffees.  Light as I like it, but very flavorful, it is a nice way to start the day.  Don't shy away from it because it has a "chain restaurant" brand, it is actually pretty good.

Summary: Vanilla? or Hazelnut? Good coffee, either way.
Text: I admit, I'm not a huge Starbucks coffee fan (yes, there are those of out there who aren't), but I do enjoy flavored coffees, so looked forward to trying this Natural Fusions Vanilla-Flavored Ground Coffee from Starbucks. I thoroughly enjoyed the coffee, but I do question whether it is actually "vanilla" flavored or hazelnut. It tasted no different from the Hazelnut coffees I buy, and I didn't get a sense of vanilla from it at all. That aside, the coffee was robust and had a natural taste to it. Measurements for my coffee maker were the same as regular coffee, which is a positive since I often have flavored coffees that require extra coffee to get a deep coffee flavor. I did not rate this coffee 5 star because the flavoring was so deep that it actually flavored my thermal carafe, and that flavor stayed for 5 or 6 more pots of "regular" coffee, despite being washed out thoroughly after each use. Overall, I think hazelnut coffee lovers will love this coffee, though vanilla coffee lovers might be surprised at the hazelnut flavor! Good coffee and I will buy more for those nights when a special cup of coffee is just right.

Ok, so I think this is a great coffee for people who like strong coffee. Me, I'm more of a "McDonalds" type coffee drinker because I have found it to be a weak coffee, which is perfect for me. I wanted to try this Starbucks vanilla because I like the smell of vanilla. So I brewed it at home, and drank a bit. Personally, it was too strong for me, though the vanilla flavor was subtle and a nice touch. I added more milk than usual, and that seemed to help.

Am I giving up my McDonalds coffee? No, but that's no fault of the Starbucks vanilla. I prefer my coffee less strong, that's just me!

I often will add a teaspoon of sugar-free vanilla syrup to my coffee so I was excited to try this vanilla flavored coffee from Starbucks.  Like most Starbucks coffees this one is very strong and robust, but the hint of vanilla actually helps to cut some of the bitterness.  The vanilla isn't overwhelming and does not leave that unpleasant toothpaste-like aftertaste that some flavored coffees do.  I found that I didn't need to add as much sugar or cream. Overall I was pleasantly surprised and found this more drinkable than Starbucks' traditional or non-flavored blends.

This coffee opens up with a vanilla cookie odor and brews up the same. If you like your coffee to taste like coffee this is probably not for you. If you tend to use vanilla creamer that is what it tastes like but for me to drink it I have to add sugar because the vanilla has a bitter flavor, same as when you use vanilla in cooking.
So in the end for me I doubt I would get it again because I don't like adding sweeteners to my coffee, it really is going to be personal choice so maybe go to a Starbuck's and ask them to brew you a cup before buying. One nice touch is you can take the empty bag into a Starbuck's and get a free coffee.

With a lot of flavored coffee I find that the smell is better than the taste and that after a few sips I'm very tired of the flavor.  Not so with this coffee.  The vanilla is perfect.  The coffee isn't like most Starbucks coffees (where it is strong and a bit burnt).  I would recommend this coffee for people who aren't really into flavored coffee but want to take a walk on the wild side of coffees.  Perfect for the holidays as well.

Summary: Did Starbucks forget a Key Ingredient?
Text:
I was never a coffee drinker in the past. The bitter and often foul flavor of ordinary coffee was not to my liking and, other than the often-needed boost from the caffeine, I could see no reason to indulge in something with such a nasty flavor.

My opinion changed with the invention of flavored and higher quality coffees and as a result of this change, coffee is part of my regular drinking routine. Starbucks is one of the pioneers in leading these changes and when I heard about this, Starbucks Natural Fushions ground coffee with vanilla flavor, I was anxious to sample. Starbucks makes this product using natural vanilla which, combined with quality coffee, sounded like a successful culinary marriage.

So, how does this coffee measure up? Well, it certainly has a very pleasant aroma that whets the appetite and I doubt anyone would dislike this aspect of the product. The problem is, unfortunately, the taste itself. I was expecting something much more vanilla- like in flavor but the flavor is instead a little harsh, roasty, and contains only a touch of vanilla. How Starbucks managed to produce such an aromatic product that tastes so different, I am not sure.

However, this isn't to say the product is bad. I find it decent as a general coffee for everyday consumption. I also like that Starbucks encourages recycling by offering a free cup of coffee if consumers bring the empty bag to a nearby Starbucks location. The coffee is responsibly grown and ethically traded, too, as indicated by the Starbucks Shared Planet symbol. However, the bottom- line is taste and based on the lack of real vanilla flavor, like I was expecting, I can give this product only an average rating overall.

I love Starbucks, but had never tried their ground coffee so I thought I'd give their Vanilla coffee a try. It wasn't quite the same as grabbing a latte at one of their stores, but it was pretty darn good overall. There wasn't as much of a strong vanilla taste as I was expecting, in fact the vanilla was very subtle.

It was smooth and rich. Very good coffee and worth the splurge - especially on a cold winters day.

This is a medium roast coffee with a lovely vanilla flavor.  I don't like strong flavors and this one isn't too bad, had the vanilla been a tad lighter I would have gone 5 stars.  However, the coffee does come through and I would buy it again.  My husband who does not like flavored coffees at all (but does love Starbucks)gave it a try and said it wasn't too bad (which is about as good as anything gets from him).  I do recommend it.

Summary: a bag of coffee doesn't need 300 reviews....
Text: This one is pretty good and a good deal especially with the Amazon promotion going on right now.  I use it with my Keurig coffee maker and it's so much nicer than some of the expensive k-cups I purchased.  I can taste the vanilla just fine and it's enough vanilla for me.  Not artificial tasting, just a nice hint of flavor, very smooth.  That's how I like my coffee so this is a good buy for me.  A warning to those who are single...this is ground coffee so buying a lot at a time may not be a good idea.  My 2-pack both expire in May 2011 and at only one cup a day, I may not finish it by then.  So I'm storing the extra bag in the freezer.

Summary: "Understated" is, in fact, what the vanilla is.  Good description, Starbucks!
Text:
From a coffee standpoint, I thought this wasn't bad. If you drink Starbucks coffee regularly, it'll taste just fine. (For those with more refined tastes, I imagine this won't go over quite as well.) It's definitely a step up from the Folger's and Maxwell's provided at my work.

That said, where's the vanilla? I could barely taste it! When I tried using more coffee to increase the flavor, the resulting brew was too bitter. Milk and sugar did nothing to enhance the vanilla flavor.

Summary: Great coffee underneath vanilla alcohol aftertaste
Text: The title of this review says it all. There is a great depth of flavor and full robust coffee under a somewhat annoying aftertaste of cheap vanilla extract. I brewed it according to package directions, measuring everything exactly. I figured I could adjust and go from there. The coffee itself is deep, dark, and very robust - just the way I like it. I simply cannot stand what many people like, the common watered-down breakfast or house blends - yuk. I do like an occasional flavored coffee if done right. This time, however, Starbucks simply ruined the concept with that hideous alcohol after bite. If I brew with less coffee, I lose the delicious robustness of the star - the coffee. I wish I knew which bean blend they used as a base. I would buy that on it's own. I won't be purchasing this vanilla fusion any time soon. I may try the cinnamon one next.

I anticipated the arrival of this product, but was quite disappointed when I tried it.  Althought a milder version of most of the Starbucks coffees, I couldn't taste a vanilla flavor in it.  There is barely a vanilla scent when you put your nose in the bag.  I wouldn't try another bag.

Summary: Good but could be more vanilla-y
Text: The coffee is smooth and very good, but I would expect more vanilla flavor from coffee that is labeled as such. It's a very light vanilla taste that I think should be amped up a little bit more! Regardless, it's still good coffee.

Though I prefer my coffee plain, bold and with cream (My Starbuck's favorites are Pike's Place and Verona.) I was intrigued by Starbucks new offerings...naturally infused flavored coffee.

Starbucks vanilla infusion is a flavorful marriage of both decent coffee and fresh vanilla flavor. Not as bold as Pike's but still bold enough to deliver the coffee flavor I need in the morning to jumpstart my day. The vanilla is strong enough that I didn't wonder what the flavor was supposed to be. It is definitely vanilla but without a cloying fake taste. It makes for a perfect companion to dessert or as a mid-afternoon pick-me-up.

I think those who love flavored coffees and especially those who want those flavored coffees to be natural should find much to like in the new Starbuck's fusions.

I love this coffee!  Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee, Vanilla, is just perfect for either a morning cup of joe or when I want a dessert coffee with dinner.  The blend of Arabica beans and natural vanilla is strong without being overpowering, and it tastes good with either sugar or Splenda.  In fact, I highly re3commend this coffee to anyone who likes something that is strong without tasting like a quart of motor oil.

Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee has become a favorite in my household!!! Almost immediately after receiving this package, the bag was opened. No more than three days later and it was gone! Rest assured, this is a good blend! The star of this Starbucks blend is the vanilla. The coffee grounds smelled fantastic and once brewed, it tasted wonderful. I would say its taste was a happy medium- not too over powering nor too light!

I can't complain about this product. It is quite tasty and definitely something I'll be picking up again! Starbucks did well by this flavored blend!

Summary: Not as good as I hoped
Text: I drink about two cups of coffee a day and love flavored coffee.  I was excited to get this free to try and I love Starbucks.  This coffee fell short for me.  I made numerous cups trying to perfect the flavor and could never get it to appeal to me.  The cofee is VERY robust.  Had I followed the directions of two tablespoons per cup I might have had a heart attack!  I used less than that and it was way too strong (bitter to me), and yet the vanilla flavor was barely evident. I tried reducing it more and it was still bitter with no vanilla flavor.  The scent is mild.  I will just stick with my Dunkin Donuts brand and add vanilla creamer.  If you like very robust coffee (knock your socks off robust) with only a hint of flavor you will probably like this, it just wasn't for me.

This is actually a pretty good vanilla coffee, but the coffee base is much milder than what I prefer - I like my coffee strong. This, however, is so you can taste the vanilla better. When compared to the Melitta vanilla coffee (which was also offered on Vine), this one wins hands down. The vanilla in the starbucks coffee is much milder than the melitta version which allows you to enjoy the coffee itself rather than being overpowered by the vanilla. Overall, if you are looking for a mild, yet well flavored, vanilla coffee, this is a very good choice.

Summary: Robost and Sweet! Odd Yet Delicious Combination
Text:
I knew I was in for a taste pleasure roller coaster and I was not disappointed when I was just brewing.

My tastebuds began to water.

What I liked most about this flavored coffee was that I didn't get the back taste I often get from other coffee and even when the coffee cooled it was still delicious. (Because sometimes I do like to chill my coffee)

Hubby is the coffee drinker around here.  He likes Starbucks in general but he said this Vanilla coffee just isn't "that vanilly".  Not really a word, I know, but that was what he said.  He likes his regular coffee strong so that could be the issue here but he said there's not a chance he'd buy it.  He really likes another brand, I believe it's "Melitta"? Vanilla coffee.  If you're a coffee drinker you probably know what brand I'm talking about there.  He said this Starbucks doesn't even come close to that.

This review is for Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee, Vanilla Flavored, 11-Ounce Packages (Pack of 2). The packaging for this shipment was appropriate, as was the actual bag containing the ground coffee, which included a way for re-sealing to maintain freshness.

As for the taste of the coffee, which is really the most important factor, I was not that fond of the vanilla aspect of the flavor. I'm not certain why, but vanilla in Coffeemate tastes fine to me, but the vanilla 'infusion' into this coffee simply tasted too artificial for my palate, even when adding a non-flavored creamer. My advice is to add flavor to your coffee, if desired, only after the brewing process.

I love coffee - even some "flavored" brews, particularly vanilla (the recent try out of Melitta's Vanilla was a total delight).  That said, I was not favorably impressed with Starbuck's "Vanilla infused" coffee.  While it smelled decent enough, the brew itself had a burnt taste that I have found in most of Starbuck's products which many seem to enjoy, but I do not.  It wasn't "undrinkable" - but I wouldn't ask for a second cup!

I'm not a huge coffee fan but I do love both vanilla and most Starbucks products.  This coffee smells fantastic while brewing and tastes delicious especially with a vanilla (or cinnamon!) flavored creamer.

Well, this wasn't too bad. I've never tried any of Starbucks' "flavored" coffees before, preferring the tar-like taste and consistency of their Pike Place and seasonal coffees. But this vanilla-flavored "Natural Fusions" ground coffee...man, that's something special. The vanilla bean flavor isn't overpowering, but it's not too subtle. It's the right median, just want I look for in a flavored blend. Just give me a hint of that flavor, don't hit me over the head with it. And did I mention how aromatic it is? Brew this, and it doubles as a Glade plug-in for your kitchen. Smells wonderful!

Normally, we love Starbucks' coffee, and so we were inclined to like this version of it. However, both me and my Significant Other found the vanilla flavor too strong. For some reason, this is not a pleasant vanilla flavor; I want to say that the aftertaste is a bit on the medicinal side. I wouldn't say the unpleasantness had anything to do with the vanilla flavor being sweet - it wasn't, although to me, not being sweet was a good idea. An added flavor, especially in a coffee labeled "natural fusions", ~should~ be just a taste and not mixed up with sugars or syrup.

Unfortunately, this flavor didn't work for two people. The coffee was otherwise full-bodied, but I can't say it was smooth because of the vanilla attack in the flavoring.

Normally I despise flavored coffees -- I'm a coffee purist. I do have to admit that I'm quite fond of this Vanilla coffee however. It's not so strongly flavored as others and the flavor is smooth and pleasing. The aroma of the vanilla is nice too. I'd purchase this coffee again.

Summary: Warm, real vanilla flavor with a touch of chocolatey undertones
Text:
My husband makes the coffee, and he does his own little blends, so I'm never really sure what I'll be sipping on any given day.

One morning I was especially pleased with what my "Coffee Artiste" had come up with and called him at work to tell him I really loved the chocolate vanilla blend. He laughed and said he'd done a straight pot of the Starbucks Natural Fusions.

I was surprised since I'm usually not a fan of vanilla, especially if it's strong. This blend does the flavor with such a light hand that unless you're really focused on what you're sipping, you can miss its subtleties.

Even if you're a distracted drinker, you'll never miss the richness and overall smooth flavor of this coffee. A giant leap forward from some of the bitter and burnt-tasting brews I've had from Starbucks!

This coffee is quite simply yummy and I am not a coffee fan, however do like to drink one every now and then or put as part of my smoothie.  The aroma will have your taste buds yearning and nostrils open wide.  I like my coffee strong and Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee Vanilla does not disappoint.  The coffee packs a good punch and perfect for morning time or any other time of the day for that matter.  I even have added the brewed coffee to my smoothies for an extra kick pre-gym workout.  Taste good, smells good, and gives you that jolt.

This is good coffee, although not as flavorful as I'd hoped. I used it in my Mr. Coffee, if that makes a difference - that's the only coffemaker I have. This is good coffee, as I said, but probably not significantly better than Folgers vanilla or other brands.

Summary: Coffee, yes. Vanilla, not so much.
Text:
There's not a lot to say about this coffee other than that the "natural fusion" of vanilla is so subtle that no one in my family could even say for sure that it was in there.

"I don't taste any vanilla," said my wife.
"Neither do I," said I.
"It's a good vanilla coffee," said my daughter, "for people who don't like vanilla."

I think she pretty well summed it up right there.

This stuff is awesome!

Great Taste
Rich Roast
Perfect Vanilla after-bite
Smooth and Silky

All in all this would make an excellent replacement to your everyday cup of coffee on a cold winters morning/evening!

I've been drinking coffee every morning of my adult life and in recent years have developed a fondness for flavored coffees. My favorites are mocha, cinnamon, and hazelnut. Thus I welcomed the opportunity to try a Starbucks flavored coffee, Natural Fusions no less.

I love opening a fresh container of coffee to experience that heavenly burst of fresh, intense coffee aroma. When my bag of Starbucks Vanilla had its grand opening, I must say I was disappointed by the lack of a distinct vanilla aroma or anything resembling aroma. I figured I'd just have to wait for the actual brew to experience the promised vanilla flavor.

So how is the coffee's vanilla flavor? Does it make up for the lack of that heavenly coffee scent that eluded me? Let's put it this way. If I were given a blind taste test,I'd be hard pressed to identfy this coffee as vanilla flavored. In fact, I'm not sure I could match any specific flavor to this coffee. It's obviously flavored to this taster, but I can only recognize that distant, nebulous vanilla taste because of the flavor's word printed on the bag.

Overall this is a pleasant coffee. It's smooth, not bitter, and has a pleasant aftertaste. But if you are looking for a readily identifiable vanilla accent, you will have to be satisfied with vageuely vanilla.

Summary: Not A Fan But Would Drink It In a Pinch
Text:
3 Tries, 3 people and an average rating of 3 Stars.

The unanimous conclusion: It's okay.

Getting ready to brew our first sample, we agreed that the coffee in the bag smelled spectacular. The process of brewing significantly stripped much of the flavor noted when the bag was opened, but the final product, prepared according to directions, was smooth with a nice flavor.

Liking our brew stronger, we made our second sample using more grind than called for in the directions. That time around we all detected a slight bitterness. One person called the aftertaste "chemically," despite Starbucks' assertion of all natural flavorings.

The next day, we brewed a third batch in our preferred coffee maker, a french press. The vanilla flavor was more pronounced, but so was the bitterness. None of us finished our individual cups of the french press brewed batch. In Starbucks defense, using a press ignores their directions which specifically say to use a "machine," so we did not weigh this batch heavily in our rating.

Overall, we agreed that it is drinkable, but not worth the premium price. Occasional drinkers of not very strong coffee would probably rate this product one star higher.

I enjoy my coffee, and have become rather picky about the coffee I drink. Normally I avoid Starbucks coffees as I find them too dry. Starbucks tends to roast coffee beans longer than most companies which reduces the oil content of the product.

With the coming of the holiday season I decided to try this starbucks coffee. I read that instead of using artificial flavoring they make the blend using actual vanilla beans. Commercial coffee is usually flavored with artificial flavorings. The ingredients in flavored coffees sometimes are associated with allergic reactions - especially when propylene glycol is added. Natural vanilla beans should not have an unhealthy reaction.

I tried this coffee for several days. When it was brewing I detected a slight vanilla aroma. The coffee provided a pleasant taste, but I did not notice the vanilla. Overall I rate this coffee above average but intend to return to coffee that is not flavored.

I like vanilla flavored coffee and expected to like this.  I figured Starbucks would deliver premium quality for a premium price.  But, this coffee didn't pass the taste test.  It was a pretty mild vanilla flavor and a pretty weak coffee flavor, neither of which appealed to me.  Yet the worst aspect of this coffee was the kind of artificial flavor aftertaste.  I'm not sure if that's worth buying unless they figure out a better formula.

Starbucks' Vanilla Flavored Ground Coffee sounded so good, I decided to order it when it was offered through the Vine program. And I'm so glad I did! It has a full, rich flavor, which is surprising considering that it is definitely less aromatic than similar vanilla products. In fact, one has to lean in close even to a just opened bag to get a whiff of the vanilla (which for those of us who enjoy the smell of coffee, and particularly flavored coffee, is a disappointment). However, once brewed, the vanilla flavoring comes across in just the right amount. On the second brewing, we (my husband and I) did decide to make it a bit stronger just for personal tastes, but this coffee is smooth and full even without the extra boost. Definitely a coffee we'd both recommend to lovers of flavored coffees!

Summary: It's coffee and vanilla, how bad can it be?
Text:
I'm not sure exactly why I thought I'd like this Starbucks Natural Fusions Vanilla Flavored Ground Coffee, since I usually find Starbucks coffee not to my taste. The ground coffee has a nice vanilla smell while it's still in the bag but my first sip was a huge disappointment--it tasted decidedly harsh. I tried brewing it stronger and weaker; still harsh, almost acidic. The only thing that made it drinkable was adding quite a bit of sugar, and I really don't care for my coffee that way.

The ingredient list claims "ground vanilla beans," which I wouldn't expect to have a harsh acidic taste. Vanilla is the second most expensive spice in the world (after saffron) and grinding the beans is known to be a good way of dispersing the flavor through hot liquids. How can it have gone so wrong in this product? Is it the coffee itself that's so unappetizing, or the combination? I just don't know.

From now on I'll look for vanilla in baked goods and body lotion, and keep it out of my coffee. Sorry, Starbucks, I'm not a fan of this brew.

Two stars, not really for the coffee but to encourage Starbucks to do better with recycling and other green issues, and to increase fair trade initiatives.

Linda Bulger, 2010
The product was expired by about 7 months. I didn't see it anywhere on the product information. I was not impressed.

I really thought I would love this coffee. I triple love anything Starbucks, and I usually like vanilla flavored coffee, so seemed like a no-brainer to me. But I really do feel that they made this way too strong a vanilla flavor. Reminds me of the times I've added vanilla extract to my coffee pot and I overdid it and it (the vanilla) tasted too strong.

If you like a strongly vanilla flavored coffee, I'd say you'll like this.

You know, I have to say I wasn't impressed much by this stuff.  I'd like to say otherwise, but I'd might as well be honest.  Taste wise it was so-so, but the real zinger was a nasty aftertaste.  I'm not crazy, my wife experienced this too.  Sure, individual coffee makers can alter taste, but since everything else is fine going through ours, my money's on the coffee itself.  Sorry.

On the plus side, it seems to be all natural ingredients, no fake stuff, such as it using real vanilla beans instead of flavoring. Having said that, I still feel like the vanilla flavor is too strong, and instead of being a nice accompaniment to the coffee, it almost overpowers the coffee itself. Beyond that, it is pre-ground and the beans, vacuum sealed, seemed to be as fresh as they could possibly be (couldn't smell it before opening it, therefore nice packaging).

For those who knows what it is, we use an Aeropress coffee maker.

The taste definitely has that "starbucks" flavor, which is a little more roasted than I would prefer, but if you like starbucks coffee, this does have that taste you'll recognize.

Honestly, even though it wasn't horrible, I'm not a huge starbucks fan and it is pre-ground coffee (I am spoiled by freshly ground coffee). However, it is better than your every day instant coffee... it may sound a little negative, but it's not what I'm intending. It's not bad coffee; just not my cup of coffee.

I smelled the vanilla when I initially opened the bag but upon brewing it I really couldn't say I detected any vanilla flavoring.  We've made the entire bag and I had no impression that I was drinking anything other than just black coffee, no vanilla undertones.  I asked my husband what he thought about the vanilla coffee and he said, "what vanilla coffee?"  He couldn't even tell.  Nevertheless, it's starbucks and still a good cup of joe.

Summary: My favorite vanilla coffee, but its still vanilla coffee
Text:
As a die-hard Starbucks fanatic, I feel like its wrong to add flavorings to coffee. This is the 3rd (and final) vanilla coffee I've tried over the last several months. Ready for something new and different, vanilla seems a natural addition to coffee so it sounded worth trying. This is definitely the best of the 3, (see my other reviews) for 2 primary reasons: the coffee is better, and the vanilla is more subtle.
Made in a French press, according to the proportions advised on the side of the bag, Starbucks Natural Fusions produces a medium bold brew with a subtle, but not too sweet vanilla undertone. The smell of vanilla is most pronounced upon opening the sealed foil bag. After brewing, it is fairly subtle. The coffee is smooth and not as acidic as some bolder brews I know and love. The vanilla is enjoyable due to its lack of sweetness.
Overall, a fine cup of coffee, most suitable for drinking with dessert after dinner. It has been my morning brew for a couple weeks, and I'm ready to return to Sumatra blend. But for those who enjoy a flavored coffee, this one is highly recommended.

I drink a lot of coffee. I like Starbucks coffee. Given the opportunity to review Starbucks Natural Fusions Vanilla with other natural flavors, I was looking forward to giving it a try. Full disclosure, I like dark roast and am not generally fond of flavored coffees. However, I really like vanilla and wondered if a Starbucks flavored coffee would be superior to other brands I've tried. I brewed up a pot a work and everyone who liked flavored coffees, really liked Starbucks Natural Fusions Vanilla flavored ground coffee. It is a light flavor and the aroma is pleasant. For me, it still had that slightly chemically taste that I associate with flavored coffees and it wasn't a dark enough roast for me. I do think that this is a superior product to other flavored coffees I've tried. I recommend it for people who like vanilla flavored coffee.

The ingredients are Ground Coffee, Natural Flavor (with Corn Maltodextrin, Vegetable Glycerin), Ground Vanilla Beans, Indian sarsaparilla Root. The package says 100% Responsibly grown. Ethically traded.

Summary: Singed Phoenix's Review: Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee, Vanilla Flavored, 11-Ounce Packages
Text:
Taste: The taste was mild, not bitter. I enjoyed the infusion of vanilla flavoring, which wasn't too strong. All around good coffee.

Serving sizes: I really didn't use a full suggested size of the grounds. I just don't like that strong of coffee. So each bag for me will produce around 100 cups.

Cost: If you do the math, 100 cups of Starbucks barista prepared coffee is about $275 dollars compared to the $7.50 you paid for make it yourself option. I think it's self-evident what is the greater value in this matter.

Summation: If you want a little variety in your daily coffee dose, and enjoy a moderately strong coffee, then this should be a given choice for you to make.

Summary: Vanilla Flavored COFFEE, not Coffee Flavored Vanilla
Text:
A very nice flavored coffee. Too many coffees that are flavored suffer from the flavor overwhelming the taste of the coffee. This coffee has the hint of vanilla but does not block out the flavor of the coffee itself.
It is kind of like when you use the flavored creamers at a restaurant or coffee shop. Put in two or three of them and the flavoring of the creamer almost totally blocks out any coffee taste,
So if you want to achieve that hint of vanilla, I use a half of one container of the vanilla creamer and then a full container of plain creamer.
Same result, only the Starbuck's vanilla is a richer tasting vanilla that that used in creamers.
It is like the same difference between using Irish Cream flavored creamer versus using actual Bailey's in your coffee. One is very artificial and superficial while the other is rich and enhances the taste of the coffee.

By the way, I rarely drink Starbuck's coffee because I don't like it. In fact I have never been in a Starbuck's but my Daughter and Granddaughter like their coffee and I have drunk coffee they have brought home from Starbuck's so I do know what their various flavors of coffee do taste like. So for me, this tastes like is a major improvement in their product.

I do drink coffee and have probably drank thousands of gallons of it in my life, though I prefer tea, usually Tetley which I drink about four cups a day of. In fact I have my next 3 month supply of 400 bags being shipped by Amazon today because nobody sells it for less than they do.

Summary: Delicious, strong without tasting like candy
Text: The thing I hate most about flavored coffee is that most of it ends up tasting like candy. The vanilla in this doesn't overpower the taste of the coffee. Vanilla meet Starbucks, Starbucks win! Good stuff, no after-taste - cream makes it smoother along with a little touch of sugar. Cafe International this is not.

I received this coffee through the Vine program, and now that I've calibrated the amount needed for the perfect pot (for my taste), I really like it.  I'll say right away that if you use as much coffee as they suggest, you'll probably end up using it to clean your counters.  Starbucks' suggestion of two tablespoons of ground coffee per 6 oz cup is more than twice what I settled on....... and I do like my coffee on the strong side.  The vanilla is very pleasing.. just enough flavor without overpowering the coffee.  This makes for a very nice mid-afternoon treat.

I find most "flavored" coffee to be sub-par coffee doused with some kind of perfumey scent so that hopefully you'll focus on how great it smells and won't notice how awful it tastes. This vanilla-infused coffee from Starbucks, however, is delicious. It's a good coffee with actual chunks of ground-up vanilla bean mixed in, so that when the hot water runs through your grounds, it brings a touch of vanilla with it. I've tried different combinations (1 part this coffee to 2 parts of my normal coffee) with good results.

The best, however, was a cup of this coffee mixed with Bailey's Irish Cream. Divine, and highly recommended.

First I will admit I do not regularly drink Starbucks coffee, but I do feel this a very fair representation of a Starbucks taste.
I find it has the little bit more of a bitter bite to it's taste, so if yo are a fan of starbucks you will enjoy this subtle vanilla blend.

This is a pleasant coffee, just be aware that it only very mildly infused in my opinion.

Coffee is a very personal thing, some like strong bold flavors, deep roasts and powerful flavor notes. Others prefer a more delicate palate. This coffee very definitely fits that second description.

The vanilla aroma, was noticeable when we opened the bag at home and the freshly brewed pot defintely gave off a pleasant vanilla scent. That said, both experiences were mild, much milder than I have experienced with other vanilla coffees and light years away from what a vanilla flavored creamer would do to your cup of coffee. In fact I found that the vanilla notes were mild enough that they could be overpowered by sugar and cream. If you like your coffee this way, this is something to note.

The coffee was also of a medium roast and milder than what Starbucks would call "bold" in their stores, and additionally milder than what I would call medium in their stores. Not harsh or acidic as others have said, though bolder than what I normally drink in the morning.

In summary, this is a pleasant coffee with medium roast character very very mild vanilla notes. Recommended for those prefer a delicately flavored coffee with these characteristics. For those searching for bolder notes, I would recommend looking elsewhere.

this is exactly what you would expect from starbucks store bought coffe..

package came in perfect condition, vaccuumed sealed of course.
opening the package just exploded the room with that awesome vanilla coffee flavor.

im not a vanilla coffee fan, but i rated this based on what i would assume a van. coffee fan would.

nice smooth flavor and left a great after taste.
i tried with and with out creamer, flavored creamer.

i would go UNFLAVORED creamer for this coffee. flavored coffee with flavored creamer is just too much flavor for me.

cheers

Not many Starbucks lovers who would say anything bad about Starbucks coffees, huh?  That's especially true of me.  This coffee smells wonderful when brewing in the kitchen.  The vanilla aroma spreads throughout the kitchen and makes everything smell good.  As its just before Christmas, I imagine the vanilla smelling a little Christmas-y.  The vanilla flavor comes out best, to my taste buds, with no flavored creamer, no plain creamer, and maybe 1/2 a teaspoon of sugar.  I tried a cup of it with Hazelnut flavored creamer and while I love that flavored creamer, it, of course, drowned out the subtle flavor of the vanilla coffee.  I recommend that drinkers of flavored coffee and those who like Starbucks try this coffee.  I give everything a grade and this vanilla flavored coffee from Starbucks is a solid "A".

Summary: It's good, but not not exceptional
Text:
It has a very good smell and a decent taste, but I wouldn't go out of my way to buy some again, any time soon.

I like to add it to my regular coffee to give it a littel different smell (which is a large portion of the taste, anyway). It is also very powdery, so it can leave little water holes in the grounds (which may make the coffee less strong).

Summary: A good coffee for the price
Text: I'm not much of a coffee fan, much less a flavored coffee fan, but this is quite good. Not exactly a revelation, but definitely pleasant, with a subtle flavoring that complements rather than overwhelms the coffee.

Summary: A Good Prelude to the Real Thing
Text:
If you are an avid Starbuck's coffee drinker, the Natural Fusions coffee is not for you. Plain and simple. Now, if you are a Starbuck's drinker and looking for a good 'out the door' coffee that will hold you until you get to your local Starbuck's store, then this coffee is a good choice. I liken the Starbuck's bagged coffees versus the chain offerings to bottled Coca Cola versus fountain Coca Cola. The former is fantastic and the latter is just okay.

I actually found myself using a few more scoops of the bagged Natural Fusions coffee in an attempt to make it taste more like the original. I guess if I didn't know how good the real thing was, I would have given this coffee at least 4 stars. It's good, but not nearly as good as the real thing. Is it better than other bagged choices out there? Not as good as the best offerings, in my opinion, but better than most.

Preparation: I drink my coffee black. I experimented with various strengths around the recommended measure. Most of my preps were done in a French Press Pot, hoping that this would hold more of the volatile vanilla until it was served (vs a drip preparation).

There was at most a very faint taste or smell of vanilla when drinking. In stronger preps, there was none. However, there is a persistent after-taste, part of which was the smell of vanilla and the other parts being coffee and something I couldn't characterize. At a normal strength brew, I didn't find the after-taste itself to be the problem, but rather its persistence (for hours). In stronger brews, the drink and the after-taste had a prominent burnt and acidic taste (a characterization often used by non-fans of Starbucks).

My _awareness_ of the after-taste declined significantly in subsequent days. However, since a major use of flavored coffees is when entertaining, many of the drinkers won't be desensitized.

The most pleasant part of the experience with this coffee was the smell while scooping it from the bag and disposing of the grounds--both had a pleasant vanilla smell.

If it weren't for the persistent after-taste, I would have rated this 4-stars, being what you should expect relative to other coffees from Starbucks. Since how one views the good-ness of Starbucks-style coffee is a matter of personal taste and hence should be factored in by the reader, not by this reviewer.

I have sampled various types of Starbucks flavored coffee over the years, and I have found that Starbucks coffee, no matter what the flavor, is usually very consistent. Upon opening the bag and brewing my first cup, I knew that Starbucks had a winner here.
I like my coffee strong; perhaps this comes from drinking it daily. In any event I found that the vanilla flavored Natural Fusions coffee produced a strong (but not bitter) cup of coffee. The vanilla is a nice balance to the bold Starbucks coffee and makes this a good coffee to drink both iced and hot. One thing I did notice, which I did not like, was a sweet aftertaste. The vanilla flavoring is not overwhelming, so I was surprised with the aftertaste. Of course taste is totally subjective, and others who drink this coffee may not notice, or be bothered, by the aftertaste.
Bottom line, I would certainly recommend this, especially if you like vanilla ground coffee.

You cut open the bag and are drenched with the pleasing aroma of rich coffee and a hint of Vanilla Bean. As the concoction brews you are carried to a Tropical Paradise even as you watch snowflakes falling outside the frost covered window of the house. You pour the dark elegant liquid in your cup and watch the steam rise off the surface. Your nose tells your taste buds that this is going to be a feast for the senses. You look at the sugar bowl but turn away as you want to savor the full flavor of this noble brew tinted with vanilla. You finally succumb to temptation and each sip warms your body and excites your palate as you enjoy the perfect cup of morning bliss.

Enjoy it I and my family did. This is a full flavored coffee and the vanilla only adds an accent to it and is not overpowering at all. I believe I saw some vanilla bean shavings among the grounds too so this is the real thing, not just an artificial flavoring. While I don't purchased gourmet coffees like this for everyday use we do enjoy them on special occasions and the Starbucks Natural Fusions Vanilla will be at the top of my list for Christmas and New Years Mornings.

I'm a Starbucks addict, but have never tried the ground coffee at home. I used less coffee than was indicated on the package since I'm not a fan of strong coffee, and was satisfied with the results. I cannot say it was the best coffee I've ever had, but the vanilla flavor was pleasant without being overpowering, and it had a smooth taste.

I must begin by saying I love flavored coffee. However, in my opinion, many flavored coffees tend to be terribly overpowering to the point where I typically brew my flavored coffee with a 50/50 mix of flavored coffee to regular coffee. Normally I brew my coffee with 1 tablespoon of ground coffee per 6 ounces of water and use 1 packet of sugar per cup.

I must admit that traditionally I am not a huge fan of Starbucks. While they put out an excellent quality product, I think their beans tend to be over roasted. However, I am the first to say it is still a decent cup of coffee. So when I had the opportunity to try the Starbucks Natural Fusions line, I jumped on the chance. When I received my bag of Starbucks Vanilla flavored coffee, I pulled out the coffee maker and brewed up a cup.

The bouquet of the coffee grounds was a bit unusual. There was a definite aroma of fine coffee beans, but there was an underlying odor that I can not place. The ground coffee did not have a distinct vanilla aroma that I could detect. The same was true with a brewed cup. While there was a distinctive coffee scent, I still could detect the mystery scent which still did not smell like vanilla to me.

The first sip resulted in an overpowering bitter flavor. Having spent significant time in the Caribbean and South America, I am no stranger to the strong brewed coffees that are prevalent in some countries I have been to. I am unsure of the source of the bitterness in the coffee (maybe the sarsaparilla root listed in the ingredients), but the bitter flavor was very significant. The bitter flavor did become less noticeable with the more coffee I drank. While I became accustomed to the bitterness, it never really went completely away.

I really did not detect any vanilla flavor in the coffee, even when used at full strength. In my opinion, the bitterness really detracts from any flavor of the coffee. I am sure some people might love this aspect of the coffee, but for me it did not work.

Overall, this did not seem to be a bad cup of coffee, but I just could not get past the overwhelming bitter flavor. I would recommend this blend to people who like an intense, bitter flavor to their coffee. If you prefer a milder cup of joe, then I would pass on this coffee. I think this will be a wonderful product for the right person; however, that person just is not me.

J. E. Nelson

Summary: Personally, I would never buy it or recommend it to a friend...
Text: Yes, I did smell the vanilla (and even saw it) when I opened the bag and pour the contents out. However, once the coffee was made, the taste was a disappointment to myself. Perhaps I got used to another coffee which was much more to my liking. In any case, not only did this coffee taste bitter to me, but the vanilla taste was weaker than I expected (again, this is in comparison to another vanilla-flavored coffee I've had, which gave me a stronger vanilla "experience"). This Starbucks product is pretty strong coffee (the instructions tell you to use 2 TBS of ground coffee for 6 ounces of water) and to my taste - seems quite bitter if I follow their instructions. However, once I add some milk to it, the bitterness is masked somewhat - but I would not drink this black if I have a choice. Personally, I would not buy it myself or recommend this product to a friend.

Summary: Tasty, Fairly Bold Coffee w/ Wonderful Aroma & Not Too Sweet!
Text: I was pleasantly surprised by this coffee.  What I expected was an overly sweet coffee with a light roast whose natural coffee flavor was overwhelmed by vanilla.  (As a disclaimer, I normally DO NOT like flavored coffees, nor do I like sweeteners in my coffee).  Instead, what I found was a relatively bold roast (but not overly so!), nuanced with a wonderful vanilla aroma & flavor.  I enjoyed it both black & with a little bit of milk, depending on my mood.  The aroma was perhaps the best attribute of this coffee, filling the kitchen with its wonderful scent.  Highly recommended for coffee & vanilla lovers!

We've long been fans of Starbucks coffees, but this is undoubtedly now our top favorite.

The coffee, of course, is the usual Starbucks quality - tops. You know you're having a cup of coffee. The vanilla is a subtle added flavor, giving just a hint of that delicious taste. It never overpowers as some flavored coffees do, but simply makes you want to come back for more.

We're enjoying this coffee, and will be back for more.

One slight caveat the description said "Pack of 2" - we received just one.

ProfileName: Tom D. "Opportunity is limited only by imagin...
Summary: Subtle, not over-powering vanilla flavored coffee that's smooth and delicious
Text:
I'm usually not a fan of flavored coffees but I do have a weakness for all things vanilla. So I decided to try out a bag of Starbucks Natural Fusions Vanilla flavored coffee. I brew all of my coffee in a vintage early 1960s Revere Ware Vintage Percolator. When I brew up a pot of this coffee, the aroma that fills the kitchen isn't overpowering like some other vanilla-flavored coffees I have tried in the past are. Very subtle but still distinct.

This coffee is very strong, however (which I like) and so may not be for everyone. I tend to add a generous amount of half-and-half and sugar, which in my opinion makes this coffee one of my favorites. I particularly enjoy a cup after a big dinner, with pie and ice cream. Heaven!

I really thought this would be delicious.  Starbucks coffee usually tastes great and I love vanilla flavored anything.  First off, when opening the bag I didn't smell vanilla.  At all.  The coffee grounds were large and uneven looking.  Sort of odd to me.  I brewed a pot, still no vanilla smell, and there was no vanilla taste at all.  There was some sort of odd, bitter taste, almost as if the coffee was old or something.  Hard to describe, but it was kind of musty tasting! I tried two more pots just to be sure before I gave up on this.  I even gave my coffee maker a good cleaning, but it was the coffee itself, not the maker.  I ended up throwing the rest of the bag away.  Very disappointing.

Glad to see that Starbucks is finally offering flavored coffee for home.  I found that the vanilla flavor mellowed the slightly charred flavor of regular Starbucks blend.  Would like an even more pronounced vanilla flavor, though.
This is a delicious blend of flavors that's surprisingly subtle. For us, this coffee is fairly smooth and not bitter. The vanilla flavor is not at all over-powering. Makes a great breakfast blend.

The vanilla in this coffee is a prominent flavor.
It's a bold tasting coffee sweetened by the natural, ground vanilla beans.
I am really not a coffee drinker, but I do like a cup now and then in the cold weather especially and I lie that this coffee is an organic and naturally flavored coffee.
It tastes very good and I think anyone who likes vanilla will really enjoy the flavor of this coffee.
It is a treat.

Excellent true vanilla coffee. Pretty much has D&D beat as well as other brands. Nice smooth consistant flavor. Had to add a tad more to the coffee pot to achieve the flavor but overall a great product.

Summary: Great taste, a tad sweet, amazing smell
Text: This Starbucks coffee is delicious. For pre-ground coffee, the beans are very fresh compared to other brands. This coffee has a very aromatic vanilla flavor with a hint of sweetness. It has that familiar Starbucks kick to get you going in the morning. Goes perfect with a croissant or delicate morning pastry.  Now if Starbucks offered this is certified organic coffee, I'd be in coffee-lovers Heaven.

I have to say at the outset that I'm generally not partial to flavored coffees. I prefer my coffee without added tastes.

I prepared the Starbucks Vanilla Flavored in a Cuisinart drip-machine per the instructions on the package - 10 grams of coffee to each 6 ounces of water. I used a Melitta brown paper filter. I found the brewed coffee extremely bitter and not very flavorful. I experimented with varying the coffee/water ratio to try to get a better result, but was unsuccessful.

I'm convinced that brewing coffee is one of the "dark arts" and that's why I give this Starbucks 3 stars rather than 1 or 2. My experience may be the result of the way I made the coffee, my machine, my water, my filter, my tastebuds or some combination of these.

ProfileName: Glenda Boozer "Live, live, live! Life is a ba...
Summary: It's vanilla, but it still tastes like Starbucks
Text: If you like Starbucks coffee, you will probably like the vanilla flavored version quite well; the vanilla is quite noticeable, but not too strong, and very fragrant and pleasant. If, like me, you find Starbucks coffee to have a burned flavor, then this is better than some Starbucks blends, but it still has the signature burnt-popcorn undertone. To each his own, I say!

I'm usually one to try new coffee flavors, though vanilla is definitely one of my favorites. So, I was more than happy to see what Starbucks meant by "Natural Fusions".

As it turns out, the branding is pretty accurate.

Rather than an overpowering candy-like vanilla that you'd get by using a flavored creamer, or most store-brand flavored coffees, Starbucks Natural Fusions tastes almost like they package a couple of vanilla beans in with plain coffee. The flavor and aroma are definitely present, but it's really much more like their House Blend with a touch of something extra.

Overall, it's a nice "anytime" brew that doesn't fight cream and sugar, and doesn't have the harsh aftertaste that's often present in Starbucks blends.

Nice packaging. Makes one imagine rich vanilla flavor -- upon opening, this just smells rather thin, a sense reinforced when actually brewed. VERY thin vanilla flavor. I'd say delicate, but a more appropriate term would be weak.

But the coffee isn't weak: if you're into Starbucks' fare, this won't disappoint. Since I'm not into Starbucks' fare (I subscribe to the narrative that they've hoodwinked the country into blithely accepting the fallacy that strong, acidic/bitter coffee is Primo, which it isn't), I wasn't surprised by the rather nasty aftertaste that not even 3-4 sugars per cup can mask.

I love strong coffee, but good coffee can be strong and not offensively acidic with a bite at the end of the quaff that can peel taste-buds off. It's all in the beans and the roast. I don't know why Starbucks foists off fare like this on the public; oh, yes I do -- because it sells to those who don't know better.

And, I see we're down to 11 (yes, ELEVEN) oz. "pounds" of coffee. Why send 2 packages of 11 oz. (2 x 11 = 22), when one could just put it all into a true "pound and a half" 24 oz. bag? It just makes no sense, the packaging costs are higher, and it's hardly more environmentally friendly this way.

When I tell people I used to live in Seattle, they frequently say, "OH, you must have gone to Starbucks all of the time." "Only when I had no other choice," is my response. If one is willing to pay boutique prices for coffee, one can do FAR better. In fact, even if one is NOT willing to pay boutique prices for coffee....

I am so happy with this coffee! I really enjoy vanilla flavored coffee, but so many of them have an artificial flavor and have a "fake" aftertaste. The whole concept of the Natural Fusions is definitely accurate. Great taste, nothing artificial, and the flavor is really subtle, so you're not bombarded with a sweet taste.

I am really impressed with this one and will be trying out other Natural Fusion flavors.

Summary: Starbucks Natural Fusions Not for me........
Text:
I am a HUGH Coffee Fan. I also drink teas but coffees are my favorite....and I have had coffees from all over at one time or another.

This particular coffee--Starbucks Natural Fusion Vanilla Coffee was right up my alley or at least I thought.

Starbucks in known around the world.....and I know many people flock to the stores in enjoy it. Thus my desire to try this form out.

The packaging of this coffee and the coffees' form itself is excellent. Packaging is airtight yet rather easy to handle open and close---having both the "tape " closure and the side tabs.

My issue here was the taste of the coffee itself.

When one thinks Vanilla Flavored Coffee it is a gentle feeling...a tasteful feeling....and instead with this you get the feeling of being beaten with a baseball bat. Hughly over caffeinated heavily dark , dense almost bitter tasting coffee infused with a minisclue amount of Vanilla and other flavorings .

The Vanilla flavor barely makes it through the first cup of coffee---and certainly not to the end of the brewed pot.

They do not mention the actual beans used here though on the package they mention a "accent" of vanilla.

Well , what ever they are using for me is just NOT enough. Furthermore...the taste of the base coffee used in this mix is simply way too strong for a delicate flavor as is Vanilla.

The caffeine level is enough to give you a headache.

Now as usual I must say that another person that enjoys those heavy , dark , dense coffees may very well enjoy this one...but for me..................well.......its just not my cup of coffee.

This is OK coffee, but nothing great.  The vanilla taste isn't that strong, and I had to use kind of a lot of it to get the right strength coffee.  It wasn't bad tasting coffee, but it wasn't as good as other brands I've tried.

I'll preface this by pointing out I've always found Starbucks a little overrated.

I think this coffee is ok. Just ok. I found it a little weak and while I could SMELL the vanilla, I definately couldn't taste it. I brewed this up in a french press and in a regular coffee maker. Same results both times.

I'm not a big coffee person to begin with, so caffine hits me pretty hard. Zero caffine buzz. That wouldn't be a big deal if this had more flavor, but it just doesn't.

Skip it and go for the cheap stuff.

This coffee has a strong vanilla aroma, but the flavor in the cup is not strong at all; in fact, it's barely noticeable, just kind of a highlight.  This is a fairly smooth, mellow cup of coffee, if you're careful to use the right amount in the brewing.  However, I always find that Starbucks coffees have a sort of burnt edge to the flavor, as if the beans were over-roasted, and this one is no exception.  I also have a commitment to purchasing fair trade, sustainably grown, bird-friendly coffee, and Starbucks does not qualify on any of those counts.  I'm not downgrading the coffee for this -- the 3-star rating is based just on the flavor -- but since Starbucks does not meet these expectations, it's not a brand I will choose in the future for a regular coffee.

Summary: Kind of Nice, with Just a Hint of Vanilla
Text: It's kind of nice this coffee. I'm drinking it now as I'm writing this review. It's not too strong, not bitter and with just a hint of vanilla. I like this coffee and I'll be buying more of it. I like the way it smells in the morning, I like the way it tastes and my husband likes it too. I wish I could go on, but I can't think of anything more to say, other than this coffee works for me and I'm a pretty average person. If I like it, I'm betting you will too.

Loved the depth of flavor in the vanilla flavored starbucks coffee.  I really loved that the rich coffee could still be tasted through the flavoring, the vanilla complimenting rather than overpowering.  Tastes like a true vanilla bean, not just sugary syrup.  I only wish that starbucks, and everyone else who has flavored coffee, would include nutrition facts on the side.  Not sure why coffee doesn't see to have to, but I wish they would.

My wife is the coffee drinker in the family and was delighted when I surprised her with this product for her to test.  She hasn't stopped making yummy noises yet.  As I type this she's enjoying the last cup and is now asking me to buy some for her, pointing out that its natural sweetness precludes adding any sweetener of her own, and the vanilla flavor provides as much lightening as she would want from any creamer.  Well, Christmas is coming up!

Summary: Gets an "mediocre" from a non-coffee person
Text:
First a warning - I'm not a coffee person. I generally don't drink coffee and I definitely don't pay $5 for a grande tall whatever the heck. Every once and a while though, I do like my coffee flavored desserts. For someone like me, you won't like this coffee. For me all you can really taste is the Starbucks "burnt" flavor with a bit of vanilla flavoring. When I asked my friend to try this stuff, he said "Yeah, tastes like old Starbucks." This particular Starbucks flavor comes pre-ground, which immediately starts the decay of the coffee's various oils and flavor notes. There's even a warning on the bag which recommends using the grounds within a week of opening the bag. This may not be an issue for most die-hard coffee drinkers, but for me, much of this bag will probably go to waste.

Generally speaking, this Starbucks bagged coffee tasted like that flavor of beans at the local Starbucks that no one likes, so it's been sitting there for weeks. It's still very "coffee" in flavor, but slightly off, slightly milder, slightly weaker. While absolutely drinkable, it's not going to be like visiting a Starbucks.

Summary: A bit too much of a dark roast for my taste
Text: The Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee Vanilla Flavor tastes bitter to me. I believe it's because this is a darker roast than what I prefer. The first pot I made, I made like I would my normal every day coffee. It came out way too strong and way too bitter. The next pot I made I put in less coffee and it came out better, but still a little on the bitter side. I finally got so that I added 1/3 the amount of this coffee than I would my normal brand and it finally came out decent. Coffee is one of those things that is very individual to each person and their taste. What one person may not like, another might. If you like darker roasted coffee then this would be perfect for you. If you prefer a lighter roast, you may want to pass on this or do what I did and make it much weaker than you would your normal brand. The Vanilla flavor is ok, but I prefer another brand of Vanilla coffee (DD are the initials). Overall, not horrible, but not great and if given a choice between this and DD vanilla coffee I would pick DD. Again, this is just my personal preference and taste.

Summary: Good vanilla flavor  in a a relatively mild coffee
Text: I usually like strong , dark roast coffee and find most flavored coffees to be strong on the (often phony) flavor and weak on the coffee taste.  This coffee was better than I thought it would be, in that it had a distinct but not overpowering vanilla taste that nicely complemented coffee that was milder than most Starbuck's coffee.  I am not likely to switch to this coffee on a regular basis but do think it is good for someone who likes flavored coffees and might think that most Starbuck's blends are too strong. The vanilla flavor is pleasant and not overpowering (e.g., doesn't taste like a milkshake).

Summary: My wife is a big fan!
Text: I'm not a big fan of flavored coffees but my wife most definitely is. The challenge is to find flavored coffees that actually taste like coffee, rather than some bizarre chemical flavoring, so that we can both enjoy it. Starbucks Vanilla Flavored Coffee manages to walk that fine line. And my wife LOVES it.
