Fog Chaser is my new favorite single-cup coffee. Love it. The fact that it's less expensive per cup than any other brand/variety I've tried (especially from this vendor) is a huge bonus.

I have become a "Coffee Snob". I love San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser. I will probably never buy any thing else. The subscribe and save option on Amazon is fantastic. I never have to worry about running out ever again.

Summary: An inexpensive alternative to the K-cup
Text:
As the other reviewers have said, this is not a K-cup! Having said that, in my experience it is a great inexpensive alternative to use in your Keurig brewer. I received an order of three 36 count boxes. The 36 count boxes were unmarked brown cardboard boxes, not the colorful retail packaging shown on amazon. See the customer image I uploaded. Inside each cardboard box, there are three clear heavy duty plastic bags, each of which holds 12 of the pods. I also have uploaded an image of a pod next to a K-cup for comparison. The bags are not resealable! You will have to seal them with a clip or put them in an airtight bag or tupperware to prevent the rest of the pods from loosing freshness. I have found the pods work just as well as a normal K-cup. I have no complaints about their function.

About the coffee: It is a very strong bold blend. I think it tastes great, but it is too strong for my wife's taste! If you like making a bigger cup (running water through the pod twice) it does a great job. I definitely recommend this if you like strong coffee!

I received my package today, "FOG CHASER" and was the first cup really good. Full body and full taste just like it came ground fresh....and no, i don't know or work for the company, just thought you would like an honest review from someone that buys 6-8 boxes of K-cup coffee a month.
I noticed NO sediment in my cup and yes they cut the corner by leaving off the pastic cup to avoid the copyright that says they would then owe Kuerig a percentage....which drives up the price of all coffe in K-cups. IT'S NOT A K-CUP, BUT WILL FIT A K CUP MAKER, and that is what they advertise.

I can live with putting the filter cups in a baggie. I don't need to show off my coffee in a carousel, so this is just great to get a "subscription discount" for this good of a coffee that will fit my k-cup brewer.

Just received my 3 pack of the San Fransisco Bay one cup for k-cup. It was delivered as promised, arrived a little crushed, but with no damage to product. I prefer a strong brew of coffee, so it tasted a bit weak for my preference. I really didn't think there was anything special about the small bit of flavor it did have. I will try it again with a smaller brew setting... Keep in mind I love espresso so I'm a hard core coffee drinker.
I loved the non-plastic design, and it actually fit in my Cuisinart k-cup brewer even better than the regular k-cup! I think the design is the biggest plus because it also makes the price more reasonable. I might try this brand again, but will definitely see if they have a bolder brew.

When you open the sealed inner bag and this amazing aroma of coffee grabs you and you just can't wait to brew a cup and try it. This coffee definitely had me at hello... and I knew it was a keeper when I served to guests and they exclaimed that it was the best cup of coffee that they have ever had. I just wish that it was available on subscribe and save like the other San Francisco Bay coffees. I also really like the environmentally friendly pod. I think the new packaging works even better than the all plastic cups.

***Modified February 2012
Yeah! This coffee is now available on subscribe and save!

Received this yesterday and was quite surprised how good the taste was. I have bought this brand before in the bean version at costco and it was good.  The coffee was bold and smooth. Had less waste than a regular k-cup. Since the pod  below doesnt have a shell, I suggest once the plastic is opened, place them in an airtight container until used. I'd recommend consuming the 12 pack with a few days to a week.  Can't wait to try the other versions of this coffee. I will buy again.

I am recently new to the Keurig world.  I've tried a handful of flavors since I've gotten my machine, and have been just ok with most of the flavors tried.  Fog Chaser has restored my faith in my investment!  Try this!  Coffee shop taste and at a better price than Keurig K Cups!
I like the product and the price point, but for me, the flavor was very strong and overpowering.  Perhaps I should have figured this out from the "fog chaser" name?

Summary: San Francisco Bay Coffee Fog Chaser One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers
Text: San Francisco Bay Coffee Fog Chaser One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers is a very nice complement to the Keurig Green Mountain selections.  I am now on my computer with a nice hot cup of the Fog Chaser at my side. I like the fact that there are eight cups to an air tight bag, and that there is an external plastic container for storage after you open one of these bags. A very nice option which I will again use for future purchases.
This coffee has a full body and a rich taste. The price is far below the "other" coffee in the K cup and does not use as much plastic.
This coffee is delicious. No issues with the packaging. No grounds in brewed cup. Great value! I'll buy other blends in the future. I consider myself a coffee snob and this exceeded my expectations.
Not for the timid. Great flavor with a bit of a bitter bite. Longer it sits the better the taste. My number one choice.

I was a little skeptical about the lack of plastic cup around the base of the "K-Cup". It fits perfectly in the Keurig brewer and makes the FRESHEST!!!! K-Cup Coffee I have ever had! The individual packs are sealed nicely and upon opening make you entire house smell like a coffee shop! I have put these on auto delivery now!!! yay! Thanks Amazon for offering such great products!!!!!!!
This coffee is exceptional and always consistent. I say to myself daily "Wow, this is an amazing cup of coffee" I will purchase this product many times over.

Was buying the Kona Blend until it dried up and then the price went through the roof. Tried several different K-Cup coffees until I found the Fog Chaser. Now I have it on my subscribe and save list. I have it sent to my office, my home, my son's home every month. It ain't Kona but it is almost as bold, the aroma fills the kitchen in the morning and that first sip is great every time.
And at 1/2 the price of the Kona, it is the "best bang for the buck". I'll never go back.

I really enjoy the San Francisco Bay Coffee Company stuff.  The Fog Chaser is what I need to get going.  The strong full-bodied flavor will get you up and going.  It is smooth and not bitter.  You also can't beat the price on this Kcup.. I will be buying this again!!!!

Summary: fantastic coffee at an outstanding price
Text:
The k-cup coffee pods arrived right on time, even a little early. They are shaped differently on the bottom which other reviews had mentioned. They fit perfectly into my coffee maker and it looks as though there is less plastic waste than the other k-cups I have seen.

I like strong, full bodied flavor- so does my husband- and we were both extremely happy with this find.
I am going to see if there is a way to get set up for monthly auto delivery.

I will order from this merchant again...and again...and again.

I recently had the opportunity to try the Fog Chaser blend and loved it. Bought this based on that positive experience. The K-cups are quite novel - the base is a filter instead of plastic and they work GREAT.The Rainforest expresso blend is also quite nice. Try the breakfast blend for a little lighter roast.

The San Francisco Bay coffee in the 36 count is a very cost effective way to get coffee for a Keurig machine.  I am serving in Afghanistan and it was in my hands 5 days after ordering!  I could not be more pleased with the coffee package value and the Fog Chaser blend is a bold, yet low acidic flavor.  I highly recommend it!
Really like the price and the package of the Kcup filter vs plastic.  We really like the flavor also.  We will continue to purchase.

As many other reviews have mentioned, these are not the normal K-Cups, but they work much the same. I generally drink the stronger K-cups (Emeril's, Jet Fuel, Kona, etc), and I find that these Fog Chaser pods compare very favorably. There is no bitter aftertaste, just smooth flavor. I have not had any sediment at the bottom of my cup (I've had sediment from other K-Cups). I think people are a bit thrown by the smell of the coffee bag when they get it, as it is a much stronger smell than you'll get from a box of K-Cups. It does smell like when you open a fresh bag/can of ground coffee, which is sort of refreshing after using K-Cups for 3 years. We've just finished the first bag of 12 (6 days), which we kept in a ziplock bag, and the last cup tasted as good as the first. I already placed a subscribe and save order for the French Roast to try out. I will be keeping my subscription for the Fog Chaser, as it is quite good.

Fog Chaser is my favorite coffee and I buy it in whole beans for when I brew a full pot. I have used it for years and would not think of changing. When I saw Amazon had Fog Chaser for the Keurig I was thrilled. The flavor is full bodied and rich with a very smooth finish.

Because I was familiar with Fog Chaser, I never even looked at the reviews before I made my purchase. Therefore, I was rather surprised when I opened the box and saw the different type of pod. With a filter bottom the pod seems much more environmentally friendly. There was no residue at the bottom of my mug so the filter did a good job. I agree with other reviewers of the need to keep these pods in a vacuum sealed container (or zip lock bag) but I think the use of less platics is a good thing.

I have a B60 and these fit perfectly in the machine. I used the large cup setting and the strength of the coffee was perfect for my taste (I prefer stronger coffee). Before purchasing Fog Chaser I was buying Jet Fuel.

Summary: Great morning wakeup cup of coffee
Text:
These Keurig compatible onecups are a cross breed design resembling a Kcup top with a pod body.
They come 12 servings sealed in a vacuum bag with freshness seal. This is then placed in a attractive retail type box
that would look right at home on the shelf next to kcups at your favorite retail store.
The front of the Box has a drawing of a kcup machine and a blow up of the 1 cup inserted in it.
It also lists a few of the compatible keurig type brewers it will work in.
The top and back of the box has some photos of environmental projects that the Rogers Family has been involved in.
one side has a photo of the rodgers family and their mission statement. The other side has a description of the coffee contained in the box.
I can see how these should sell well in the retail setting and also appeal to environment conscious individual and those who are just curious about a new alternative to the standard kcup.
I have a Box of Fog Chaser described on the box as a blend with the body of our regular roast and the smokiness of our French roast. A heavy full bodied with hints of cedar,vanilla and toasted almonds
balanced with a delicate finish with honey and milk chocolate flavors. Sure sounds appealing to me.
When I cut the seal on bag I'm hit with a very strong dark roast scent right away and something poignant but can't place the smell. Maybe it's the ceder they describe on the box and I'm intrigued to brew and try it.
Fits in my B70 perfectly and I use the 7.25 oz drop as I normally do. Smells good during brewing just like the extra bold dark roast Kcups I normally drink.
Brewed perfectly with no issues. Smells and tastes great in the Cup. Strong full bodied french roast with a smooth finish and I like it as does the wife.
I'm not one to name flavors and stuff like that so you will have to try it yourself for a more specific taste profile. Suffice it to say I give Fog Chaser a Big thumbs.

Summary: Less plastic and better taste? Yes please!
Text: These do not look like regular K-cups. And perhaps they won't keep as long because the bottom looks like it's made of rounded cloth, kind of like a tea bag. But they fit Keurig machines just fine, are less expensive, and most importantly I think this coffee tastes better than the coffee in plastic K-cups. I actually prefer the fact that the bottom is not made of plastic. I never liked the idea that my hot coffee was being strained through a plastic cup. In fact, I just ordered more.

Summary: Not Really K-Cups But They Do Fit in Your Keurig
Text:
Don't be alarmed when you receive these and they don't look like a standard K-cup. These are not K-cups, but dowill fit in your machine. I thought I had ordered the wrong product at first. These simply have a plastic ring at the top so that they'll fit in your K-cup holder and the rest of it is like a standard coffee filter. I've only tried Fog Chaser (ordered all 3 flavors) and was surprised that I liked the coffee. However, because it's using a filter rather than the K-cup technology, it does leave a sediment in the bottom of your cup. I find this also happens when using the My K-Cup filter with whatever brand of coffee I use.

You will need to store the "k-cups" in a ziploc to keep them fresh. The 36-count come packaged in 3 plastic bags of 12 each. This is nice so that you only have to open up one 12 pack at a time so the others can stay fresh.

I'm mostly neutral, but lean more toward "would buy again".

Summary: Wow...fantastic coffee at a great price
Text: This coffee is great in my Keurig and alot more reasonably priced here at Amazon. Shipping was fast and worry free. I really like the fact that this comes packed in 10 individual packs of 8 k-cups each. The reason for this is that these k-cups are different in their construction. Each one is plastic at the top but filter for the lower 3/4 of the k-cup. At first I thought..oh no..I see a big mess coming, but to my great surprise, everything went perfectly. I like this design for two reasons, one..they are made with green practices in every way possible, and..two..they brew alot faster than the regular k-cups. The taste is great, bold and deep mellow flavor, this is my new coffee for sure.

Summary: If You Like a Stong Brew
Text:
I am the buyer for a 20-person department. The folks who like a bold strong coffee love this one. I like it as well, but I use the 10-oz setting when I make it instead of my typical 8-oz.
"Fogchaser" sums it up pretty well. This will clear your head and get you ready to roll.
I also love that there is less packaging. I must admit to a bit of guilt over the whole K-Cup disposal situation. (I make people use china coffee cups and am happy to wash them!) These do not have the plastic outer cup. I keep them in a plastic container with a sealed lid instead of in the K-Cup carousel to keep them fresher. But I gotta tell you--opening that lid yields the most wonderful coffee aroma.

Finally, a robust, bold coffee from a Keurig coffee pot.  I had trouble finding one that wasn't wimpy, but this is it!  And it is cheaper than any other.  As an added benefit, the k-cups are constructed in a much more earth-friendly way, no plastic cup.  Why don't other brands go this route?

I was really lured in by the price and eco-friendly "pod" cup. I had read the good and bad reviews and decided it was worth trying the Fog Chaser. Well, I loved it! My cup was as bold and rich as traditional plastic K-cups and better than the reuseable cups (My K-cup, Ekobrew). This will be a mainstay in my coffee selection due to the flavor and affordability. I highly recommend trying it.

Hopefully, someone can comment on whether these will work for the new Keurig Vue machine.

Summary: Fast became one of my favorite K-Cups
Text:
Yes, it's hard to get used to the different design of these (paper-filter bottom), but they work fine in my Keurig Platinum B-70 and have enough coffee to make a bold, 10-oz cup.

The flavor of "Fog Chaser" is strong and complex -- it took me a few days to get used to it, but now it is one of my favorites (tied with Timothy's Midnight Magic).

I'm so glad that the patent on K-cups has expired so we can have some new companies making them, producing great products at lower price. Hooray for the free market! (smile)
Very tasty coffee well worth the price. Comes with a container to put open coffee in. I will definently buy this coffee again.
I have bought this coffee on a few different occasions.I love the full bodied taste and also the price.I'm always looking for a good deal and this is a great one !
We threw this away. It is the very worse coffee I have ever bought. Undrinkable. Their french roast is much better.
Fog chaser was the best both in flavor and body.  So far this is the only product that the body is compatible to the richer flavor of blew coffee that uses k-cup system.

Summary: Something is not right with this coffee
Text: When I first got the pods I loved them but after a couple of weeks in opened or unopened packages these pods must have lost their freshness because the coffee does is just not the same and it's pretty much awful at this point, I am sorry I went ahead and purchased 160 more pods after the first 36 because now I'm stuck with them and I can't stomach them nor can anyone in my family.
If you like bold coffee, Fog chaser and French roast is for you. It has a filter only. No plastic shell. That leaves more richness in the coffee and no plastic taste.
Its about time some one came up with a viable alternative to the more expensive coffee single cup brewers. this is a great product, its not Star bucks, but it works.
It takes trying a few other brands of coffee, to find one that is very tasteful and smooth to the taste. My opinion is: San Francisco Bay Coffee, Fog Chaser is the best.
Love Fog Chaser:  Strong, smooth and, I believe,  like all San Francisco coffee k-cups,  no plastic to toss into the garbage.

The San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser's provide a pretty decent bold coffee at a phenomenal price.  It's about HALF THE PRICE of common competitors.  Well worth ordering.  If you don't like it, you can spend 2X the $$$ on something else the next time. I bet you'll be satisfied with the Fog Chaser.
The San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser coffee is one of my favorites.  Full bodied but not bitter - very flavorful.  I really like the design of this product instead of the regular K-cups.

Summary: San Francisco Bay for K-Cup Brewers
Text: With my Keurig brewer I try to keep the per-cup costs down by shopping around. When I saw the San Francisco Bay products I was intrigued, mostly because of price, but also concerned, as they are not sealed in a container (the bottom portion is a mesh). While I do need to keep the product in a sealed container for freshness, the coffee is good and the cost is right.

I never thought I would get decently-strong coffee with my Keurig on the largest brewing size.  I was wrong -- this coffee rocks!  It's nice to know that I'm saving some plastic from the landfills too -- it's a small price to pay for keeping the opened cups in a zip-loc bag.  I can't wait to try some of their other flavors!

For the price, this is one great cup of coffee! I love the fact that the San Francisco Bay coffee cups for Keurig brewers do not have the typical plastic containers. I hate throwing away all that plastic. I tried washing out those little containers but that was such a pain! So these coffee containers make much more sense. The coffee tastes great and the aroma is even better than the original Keurig cups. This is a good alternative and a fantastic price.

We really like this product. It came in a number of smaller packs, and there was a plastic tub for open bags. I did not have any trouble keeping the coffee fresh. The taste and quality were very good. Similar to s-bux Verona, at a lot lower price! I would purchase this again, any time!

These K-Cups from San Francisco Bay Coffee have great flavor and they are certainly competively priced, but they do not fit properly in my Keurig Coffee Maker.  It is an effort to close the top of the coffee maker to a point where the water begins to filter through the cup.  I noticed this when I first bought them, but thought it was just a fluke.  Subsequent shipments were the same.  I don't think I will purchase this product again.

Summary: San Francisco Bay Coffee Fog Chaser One Cup for Keurig K-Cup
Text: My husband is a coffee drinker and has bought the Starbucks k-cups and loved them.  He was a bit skeptical at these Fog Chaser, because the k-cups looked different.  The k-cups were fine, but he thought the strength of the coffee was not as strong as the Starbucks.  He would prefer the Fog Chaser to be more robust.  I find them fine, but then they are not for me.

This is very good coffee. The one thing that bothered me about the Keurig Coffee maker is when you made a full cup of coffee it was very weak. With this coffee I can make a full cup and it is very strong. I think it has something to do with the filter pod. I would recommend this if you like good strong coffee.

Really, really good coffee!  A bold flavor with that touch of nuttiness that I prefer.  We compost and was hoping for something totally compostable that could simply be thrown in the bin. This is much preferable to the old K-cups but still the plastic top remains for the trash.  I see no reason why a fully compostable product could not be developed.

Since kcups are becoming more and more expensive, we've tried some alternative coffees for our Keurig. These "soft bottom cups" allow easier brewing and I think they make a stronger coffee. I like the decaf brew, and my husband loves the Fog Chaser. The only down side is they are not sealed, they have a soft filter bottom and they need to be stored in an airtight container, but who cares if it's cheaper and tastes good? We will continue to buy from San Francisco.

If you like strong coffee or need a jolt to get started, this is the drink for you.  Innovative mesh cup may be an enhancement to the brew flow through, but probably limits shelf life if you let it set in the cabinet too long.  I drink a bit more coffee than one should so shelf life isn't an issue.  Worth the try, great aroma and full caffeine feel.  Gets a thumbs up from me.

Summary: Good price and good coffee for Keurig!
Text:
I am very much enjoying FogChaser. The flavor is great!

As other posts have mentioned, it does not look like a traditional K cup (which is, incidentally, why the price is so great! No "k-cup" royalties, right?) but works just like a Kcup. The coffee is packaged in bags freshness, and the company thoughtfully included a plastic food storage container for storing the open package. Sure, it's a cheap-o container, but it works and I think it was a really nice touch by the company to ensure that my opened package of coffee stays fresh.

The price is HALF of what I've been paying for my K-Cups from the supermarket, so I am VERY very pleased. My household goes through 8-10 cups a day, so the savings is significant for us. 5 stars!

Happy. :-)

Summary: Love this coffee for my Keurig
Text: Tried something new with these paper pods. The coffee is great, smells really good and tastes even better. Every once in awhile the pod gets stuck, but is easy to remove. Makes me feel a bit better about throwing away so much plastic as in other Keurig pods.

great bargain great coffee all that I needed in a very easy to use pod.(smaller than a k-cup, same
amount of coffee)

I am a helpless coffeeholic and a devoted Keurig User. I was so dissapointed in the k-cups after the Green Mountain takeover, almost to the point of looking for another brewing method. Then my brother in law suggested I try this coffee. WOW! One of the best cups I have ever had from my Keurig.  Not so thrilled with the Rain Forest blend but the Fog Chaser is the bomb! Don't confuse this with Fog Litter. Don't let the difference in the pod scare you, works great in my brewer. I just ordered a pack of the French Roast. Can't wait to try it.
Got these for my husband who loves a bold coffee flavor, he said they were terrific and he really enjoyed them, the pods look a little strange but they work perfect.
I love this coffee. I love getting a value on it. I use it everyday in my Keurig coffee maker. Thanks for a great product.

ProfileName: James B. Kirk "James Bond in the House"
Summary: In a pinch, this is a good product.
Text: Not as good as the Starbucks or Newman's brand, if I can afford to buy the better stuff on Amazon I will.  The Coffee has a great aroma, but the coffee is nor memorable after drinking it - it's the Kmart of the K-cups.
I like the strong yet mellow taste of this coffee. It's a good way to start a dreary morning.San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, Fog Chaser, 36-Count
It has good flavor. I use it on the 8 ounce cup size & it is not watery or weak

We were skeptical when we ordered, and received, this product.  It doesn't look like it would fit a Keurig, and is not our top brand coffee.  We both ended up liking it very much, and end up rooting around for the last FOGCHASER, since it is now OUR favorite.  It's nice it has less plastic/packaging than other brands as well....

I've had many other k-cups and none were ever strong enough for me.  This one still isn't quite as strong as I'd make myself, but it's close.  Very enjoyable.  One great thing that I noticed in the packaging (80-count) was that they included a plastic container which fit 1 bag of the cups very easily.  This will serve me well in keeping the unused but open-bag cups fresh.

I was a little hesitant to try these, but eventually decided why not try & see for yourself. Im so glad I did. These are by far my favorite coffee pods. Once I open the bag, I just put them in an airtight container.
I pay 41 cents a piece for them which is a deal against other brands.
The coffee is full bodied & tastes great.
Great coffee.  I use these Keurig-compatible sengle serve units both a home and in the office.  I am just about to place a follow-up order.

I love this coffee.  It works great with K-cup type brewer even though it is not a k-cup.  Since it is not a full plastic cup, I do store the units in a covered canister.  Using a canister instead of the rack is a small price to pay for the difference in price to regular K-cups.  The coffee has wonderful flavor.  I like a bold cup of coffee in the morning.  If I dont have this, I drink Donut Shop.  I like the San Francisco Bay so much, I get two boxes on auto ship every month.

Summary: San Francisco Bay Keurig K-cup Fog Chaser
Text: this is the best K-cup flavor so far.  Chases my fog away. Has a nice finish. not to bitter....just smoooth.
Have been getting this coffee for several months and very much like their bold flavor in comparison to others I've tried. Keep it air tight after opening is not a big deal. great coffee!
This brew seems to light a bit more of a fire under me than previous k-cups I've tried. Perhaps that's why they call it "Fog Chaser." Enjoy
This coffee is a great deal!  All the coffee drinkers in the house enjoy it - will purchase again.  Compared to many others we have tried this is in the top 5.

I ordered and recieved my box of 40 pods of coffee from San Francisco Bay.  When I opened the box I was alarmed that the pods were not K cups. Well, I popped the first pod into my Kuerig coffee machine and what came out was the aptly named foggy coffee.  Dark coffee that had a nice bite to it.  I will be ordering more products from this company as their coffee rocks the house. The price was better than the K cups and it is because, I suspect, the pods that they make are a plastic ring with the coffee encased in coffee filter paper.  I dont konow if they created these new pods but the are ingenious and they work perfectly, well done!

The 1-cup pods work fine in my Keurig brewer - slightly more sediment at the bottom of my cup. I would like to see more variety in the blends available. I find the fog chaser to be a bit bitter for my tastes, I'll just add more sugar! I like that I'm not wasting so much plastic on every cup.
Excellent morning coffee to jumpstart the day, robust , but  not too strong. I have tried many brands over time; Chase that fog away!!

I have been ordering Coffee People's Jet Fuel K-cups for years.  I never really liked wasting all the plastic so I was happy to give these a try.  The coffee is very comparable in strength and tastes great!  But most of all, the design of these k-cups eliminates a large portion of the plastic and work great!  You do need to store them in an air-tight container, but they came packaged in separate 12-pack sealed bags which will keep the coffee fresh until I'm ready to use it.  I'm willing to change my storage container in order to help the environment just a little.  So willing that I just cancelled my Coffee People Subscribe & Save order and replaced with SFBay's Fog Chaser!

I will definitely buy the San Francisco Bay Coffee again. After I try the other flavors, I will use the subsription plan.

After meeting my husband, I started drinking darker roast coffees, and this Fog Chaser was bold and delicious. But the biggest reason why I tried this brand was because of the lack of the extra plastic. I've felt bad about the excess plastic that was being discarded with K-cups. I've bought a wide variety of gadgets that are compatible with Keurig, all in attempts to reduce waste. Some had a re-usable cup with small inner paper filter, (which I still use when I acquire my own ground coffee) others were caps that went over re-used K-cups after they were emptied and rinsed. But that all takes time that I don't always have. I feel better that these have less waste PLUS they're less expensive than regular K-cups. A subscription will make it that much cheaper.

The box has separate bags of 8 coffee pods each. I don't think maintaining freshness is an issue for me, since once I open up a bag, I simply put them in a sealed plastic container. There is one plastic container included in the box, but it's a little on the flimsy side, certainly not Tupperware tough, but it's still enough to store these. I drink one to two cups a day, so the opened bag doesn't have a chance to sit around long anyways.

This fit perfectly in my Keurig machine, too.

I'd definitely recommend this to others.

This quickly became my favorite coffee I make every morning.  Strong enough to make on larger setting without losing it's coffee goodness.  I make it on smaller setting sometimes when I want even stronger. There is never a bitter after taste.  The only negative thing I can say is I can't use my carosel to store these pods. I keep in a Ziplock type bag that keeps them quite fresh.

Tried this pod coffee with a bit of trepidation, first it was a new style pod and 2nd it had several bad reviews. Tried it anyway and I'm glad I did.

1. New pod style worked great. No issues what so ever. They pack the pods in small bags so the air does not oxidize the remaining pods. I use a clip to seal the bag back up after opening. Maybe they could add a self seal bag type but then they would raise the price on me. Leave it as is.

2. Coffee was great. Very bold just like I like it. In fact it was better than the other bolds on my Amazon Subscribe and Save list. This coffee pod just made the list.

All I can say about the reviewers that did not like the bold taste is that perhaps they are only "wanna be" bold coffee drinkers. Maybe they should practice more and then try this blend again.
I was a little worried due to a few bad rewiews, but this coffe was great, smelled good, tasted great and the price was right!so glad I tried it.

Summary: Best K-Cup I've tried!  Excellent taste and quality.
Text:
I love coffee.

I drink it in the morning, in the afternoon, and right before bed. However I had yet to find a k-cup that gave me the full bodied taste that brewing a nice strong 1:1 ratio pot ever gave me. I tried all the usual suspects.. green mountain, starbucks, caribou, donut, etc. While I normally love their whole bean, ground, and coffee shop stuff.. I just could never find a full taste in any of them. So, I gave up on k-cups and went back to my trusty home drip brewer.

Then one day our company bought kuerig machines for the office. So, I decided that I'd go out and try to find a decently priced k-cup, as anything tastes better than the sludge that they make in their industrial drip machines. These are what I found, and whether it's the coffee, the lack of plastic on the bottom, or some combination, I'd have to say these K-Cups are the absolute closest thing I've found to a regular cup of coffee. It bold, but not hit you over the head bold. It isn't watered down. It's perfect.

Anyway, give them a try if you want a great cup of coffee for a great price. Don't let their look scare you off. It's perfect.

Summary: Good Coffee ! It will lift your morning fog!
Text: First off if you are wondering, they are not K-cups.  The coffee is in an innovative filter pouch with a ring that fits K-cup type coffee makers.  The packaging is thoughtful, 8x 10 packs with a resealable cup for the open pack of coffee your working on. As far as taste its very good coffee, but strong ( fyi I drink coffee black like God intended). I typically make a 16 oz cup of coffee with one 'pouch' of coffee.  So for me it good tasting coffee at a  screaming deal as compared to traditional K-cups.
Coffee is outstanding, concept is wonderful but in each order I have been shorted 3-5 kcups, it adds up. Very disappointed.  Otherwise I would have rated five stars.

Summary: Great coffee at a great price!
Text: If you are looking for a consistent cup of coffee with a nice flavor and one thats more robust then this one may be for you. My wife and i subscribed to this coffee after reviewing others opinions and for the price, its a great coffee. Works well in a Keurig machine. Id recommend it.

I first tried San Francisco Bay Rainforest blend, and loved it, but then decided to try their Fog Chaser, and wow, what a great taste. It's a little stronger, but yet not too strong. A great blend, and it offers a nice change in taste. Love it, and again, a great bargain.

I was really surprised to like this coffee this much. Some of the lesser-priced coffees claiming to work in a Keurig have not been so good. This coffee is excellent - and less expensive to boot! I'm picky about my coffee. I like a dark, bold roast, but find many to be bitter. This roast is smooth and flavorful.

While I've not been really good about going out of my way to use "greener" products, I'm happy to buy a product that I really like and also happens to be more environmentally friendly.

A couple of potential downsides with this new style of k-cup:

1) since the filter part containing the coffee is more exposed than a traditional kcup that is encased completely in plastic, I suspect these SFB kcups may not stay fresh for very long. HOWEVER, in the 36-cup pack that I purchsed through Amazon, the company has seen fit to package the cups in 3 heavy, sealed plastic bags, so you only have to open, and expose to the air, 12 kcups at a time. Sidenote: the bag emits a WONDERFUL aroma when you open it!

2) Also due to less plastic packaging over the filter, I notice more coffee "sludge" at the bottom of my cup than I see with traditional style kcups. This doesn't bother me. I just don't drink that last little bit in my cup. The coffee I DO drink is so rich and flavorful that this just isn't an issue for me.

3) I take my new SFB kcups to work and use in the heavy-duty machine used there. Due to the smaller length of these kcups, some Keurig brewers don't recognize the cup as actually being there when you insert it in the basket. However, you can easily override this. When the machine says "no kcup detected," it will usu. also say, "continue? yes or no" and you simply press yes. The machine will still function, as it would if you were using it simply to brew a cup of hot water.

I will definitely order more of these kcups and am interested in trying other blends in addition to the Fog Chaser. Taste-wise, cost and ease of ordering: an all around "win" for me!

Went out on a limb and purchased this based solely on the reviews.  Wisconsin resident so not much ability to get to CA to try things out!  So happy with this purchase.  I love the flavor, I love the reduced packaging.  Perfect cup of coffee.

This is one of the best coffees in a K-cup I have had. It doesn't have that after bite that some full flavored coffees have. Love the mesh container as apposed to the plastic cups. The value is great works out to about 41 cents per cup. I am on my second box & it will probably be the only K-cup coffee I will order from now on. Love it!

Summary: San Francisco Bay coffee for Keurig
Text: This coffee is really delicious and the pods are so convenient and less wasteful, plus cost less.  I would recommend this product to anyone that is a coffee lover.  Its always fresh and convenient.  If you are wanting to try it you won't be disappointed.

Initially I had read several bad reviews about this product and would not consider it.  I tried another brand of bold coffee after I was notified Timothy's Midnight Magic would no longer be available on Subscribe and Save.  I was searching for another K-Cup and found the more recent reviews for this brand of coffee were more positive.  With the first cup I was hooked.  Good strong coffee and no bitter after taste. Fog Chaser by San Francisco Bay is the best K-Cup coffee I've had and am now signed up for regular deliveries.

Don't hesitate to buy this fantastic coffee. And, don't let the price fool you! I was elated to see Fog Chaser packaged for the Keurig system. Having bought this blend before I knew what to expect, and it didn't let me down. It delivers a full-bodied cup of coffee, with a fantastic nutty, sweet kinda spicy-chocolaty finish. On the technical side, I like that they've figured out a way to work around using all the plastic. These "K-Cups" are an ingenious design using a filter instead. Absolutely a splendid cup of coffee all around. This product has been added to my Subscription orders with Amazon.
This is great coffee for the Keurig Coffee Maker.  It is not the strongest coffee around, but everyone in our family likes the flavor and it's always fresh.

I am a rather late comer to the K-cup world. I have always loved my the flavorful and bold 'one cup at a time' coffee faithfully brewed by my cherished Gaggia 90501 Titanium SS Super Automatic Espresso and Cappuccino Machine, Stainless Steel. After six years of faithful service my Gaggia developed an issue requiring it to be sent off for repair, so I purchased a Breville BKC700XL Gourmet Single-Serve Coffeemaker with Iced-Beverage Function. The Breville is intended to be an interim coffee maker while my beloved Italian Gaggia is sent off for repairs (a 3 month endeavor).

I don't think of myself as a coffee snob, but I will admit to being particular about the coffee I drink. I was now faced with the challenge of finding some of my favorite coffees in the new to me K-Cup containers. As I came to the realization that my old favorite beans were not readily available in this medium I turned to Amazon buyer ratings as my guide in this java quest. I placed orders for both Emeril's Big Easy Bold 48 K-Cups and San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, Breakfast Blend, 80-Count as a starting point. The SFB Breakfast Blend arrived first. I read all about the Rogers SF Bay family coffee business philosophy and their social give back and thought it was pretty cool. I then looked at their K-cups (OneCups) and thought to myself, "is that how these things are supposed to look?" Their OneCups take a more Eco-friendly construction approach so that you see a rounded filter bottom rather than the standard shaped plastic cup bottom. It all seemed interesting, but how would it taste? I thought the Breakfast Blend was really a lovely cup of coffee. The smooth medium-dark roast Central and South American beans are very tasty indeed! I would venture to say that it is on par with any of the very best medium-dark roast coffees available. I would never turn my nose up at it, that is certain. However my personal pallet preference is for something a bit more dark and bold. Three days later I received the Emeril's Big Easy Bold order and immediately tried it. It certainly delivered on all aspects of a robust dark roast with full flavor. It is a bold, dark, classic Parisian roast, in your face brew, just the way I like it. However I find it to have an ever so slight unpleasant aftertaste and a not too far away from, but not quite there bitter finish. Again this is just according to my palette, you may not think so. All in all it is a very good coffee.

The SFB Fog Chaser arrived and I couldn't wait to try it out. I cut the seal on bag and was hit with the scent of a strong dark roast. I placed the now familiar OneCup container in the machine and hit brew. Immediately the aromas hit my nose and let me know that I was in for a treat. Fog Chaser is a strong full bodied French Roast with an extremely smooth finish. It is certainly bolder than Breakfast Blend, but is not as bold as Emeril's Big Easy Bold. The taste is full, smooth and well rounded without any unpleasant bitterness or aftertaste at all. I wouldn't have minded if the yield had been slightly stronger though. My next order will be San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, French Roast, 36-Count to see how it compares to these three. Until that time, I give SFB Fog Chaser two big thumbs up!! It is currently at the top of my K-cup coffee taste experience.

The subscribe & save service is good, product was delivered as required and actually did save me money! The coffee is great and has a good full bodied taste, just what I need to wake me in the mornings.
A grat tasting cup of coffee at  a great price. I also like the design of this Kcup. Les plastic. I get this item on subscription which brings the price down even more

this is my third purchase of the fogchaser kcups and i will keep buying it!  The taste is on the darker side, kind of like a SBUX french roast, but much tastier.  The smell from the bag when I open it is just heavenly!  I also like that the cup isn't all plastic, just the plastic top with mesh bottom.  I have had no occurence of the mesh bottom ripping open after about 200 of these.

This is a great tasting coffee. But not as strong as I was hoping for. I expected it to be stronger then the french and on the lines of Black Tiger and Jet. In my opinion, it's not as strong. I was disappointed. But still a nice flavor.
Pretty good coffee a little bitter for me but most strong coffees are. The price is great though and its worth it and will order it again.

Fog Chaser was great. I ordered it twice and will continue to order it. It comes nicely boxed and packaged beauifully. I bought the 80 count box and the price was the best I found, Under 50 cents a cup.

This is my new favorite coffee!  And the price is a great value too.  I first tried this coffee from a local grocery store and was thrilled that I can purchase it through Amazon in 80 ct package at a great price.

The only coffee that actually gets me going in the morning. I love the rich aroma and deep coffee taste. The is no funky aftertaste, just a good kick of caffeine energy. This coffee rocks!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Very rich and flavorful coffee.  I like the pods without the plastic case.  Requires storage in a sealed container.  This is a very good everyday smooth coffee.  The story on the side of box is compelling.

Summary: Fog Chaser Coffee + Morning = Great Start to the Day!
Text: This coffee has wonderful flavor and brews very well.  Works perfectly in our Keurig coffee maker.  Really like the pod style, actually easier to use than the cups.  Great product!

I lover this coffee and will keep buying it.  I never drink Decalf but since getting a Keurig I can have a cup when I get home without brewing a whole pot and just love this decalf as it has the flavor of a full roast coffee.
Tastes excellent and is great for the price. Shipped quickly and the pods came in batches in plastic packages so the pods don't expire.

San Franciso Bay is an nice, inexpensive alternative to the K-cup.  I like a bold cup of coffee and this one comes through.For the money, this brand is well worth trying.  I paln to purchase again. It works well in my Keurig.

This coffee smells really good.  Even the non-coffee drinkers in my office comment on how rich it smells.  Coffee lovers have been just breathing deeply!  LOL!  This was a test and it passed.  Took some getting used to but I have come to really like it.

I ordered San Francisco Bay Coffee Fog Chaser because of the title "fog chaser" and the price was good. We were pleasantly surprised with the make up of the k-cup.  It is not all plastic, it is made up of a fiber which means, to me, less plastic for my hot coffee to run through.  I am pleased with the product and even signed up for the automatic delivery option so we don't have to be without good coffee when we get up in the morning.

This is very good coffee.  Despite a number of previous reviews to the contrary this style K-Cup works very well.  The price is also lower than the competition.  I would recommend you try a package and make up your own mind.

I just received this product.  I was a little hesitant with the product not being enclosed in the cup fully, having an exposed filter.  I was pleased with the brewing and taste of the coffee, it was no different than other kcups I have used.  I have a Cuisinart K-cup brewer and it works great with this coffee.  I recommend this product and plan on ordering more.
I was very happy with my purchase of the fog chaser coffee. I will definately buy more of it in the future.
Nice product for the price. All you have to use is a zip lock bag because they use a screen for the bottom of the cup. Good medium cup of coffee.

I had been purchasing Coffee People Jet Fuel Dark Roast K-Cup from Amazon. I was pleased with the taste of the brew. The price of the product was moderate, which appealed to my senior income. One day my sister told me about the San Francisco Bay K-Cups which she had just purchased from Amazon.  She indicated that the medium blend of coffee she ordered was very good and suggested that I try it. I prefer dark roast so I ordered the Fog Chaser One Cup.  I am thoroughly pleased with the coffee and economically it suits my budget.  I highly recommend it.
I am so happy to have found this product.  The different type of cup was no problem at all, is more environmentally friendly, and the coffee is wonderful.  The price is another advantage.

Summary: Fog Chaser is a great coffee
Text: I've been using the SF Bay Coffee - Fog Chaser - for several months now and it has become my coffee of choice.  I will select others as a change of pace but use Fog Chaser as my everyday selection.  I highly recommend it!

Summary: Doesn't really fit the Keurig Brewer
Text: I ordered the coffee and was surprised  to see the different packaging. When I closed the lid on my machine it would not.stay closed  so I have to hold  it down to brew the cup. The coffee is delicious but having to stand there to hold the lid  down is  counter intuitive to the purpose of the Keurig convenience. Why won' t the lid close?. I didn't see anyone else mention this. I will not order again even though I liked the coffee a lot.

Summary: My favorite k-cup, hand down, no question
Text: I am a coffee lover. Drink it all the time, prefer dark roasts with full flavor and typically drink it black unless i crave a drop of honey. I used to buy the very expensive dark roast K-cups but i saw these on sale and decided to try them based on the good reviews. First, the cup itself is awesome.  Far less plastic than 'regular' K-cups, so there's less waste. The flavor is awesome-- dark brew but no bitterness or sourness.  Nice bite, clean aftertaste.  This, in my opinion, tastes more like my local coffee house brew than any other K-cup on the market.  and Amazon has great prices on these, especially with subscribe & save.
I was leary to order this coffee but after reading other reviews I decided to give it a try. Very good taste if you like the taste of coffee,

Summary: This stuff is strooong!!! Does what it says!
Text: I thought I would like this because I like to think I like bold coffee.  Wow, this isn't bold.  It is stand up and knock your socks off it is soooo bold even at the biggest setting.  So if you enjoy a powerful cup of coffee this is for you.  By the way the filters work great in my machine and all else is perfect; if only I liked the coffee.  So after being knocked to the floor by my coffee this morning I am going to crawl over and try the breakfast blend. Four stars for the filters and minus one star for my personal preference on the coffee.

in error the review I just submitted attched to emeril's big easy (also excellent)
now down to business.
just recieved my first order of s.f. bay / fog chaser immediatly made a cup.
was unsure as I just purchesed a cusinart k-cup mach. worked perfectly regardless.
the strength / flavor is all it was touted. & the price is resonable
I'll be back often!!!!

billw......

I was having trouble finding a good everyday coffee for my new Keurig. I like a strong flavor, but all the "bold" ones I tried were too bitter, some even tasted burned. The "not-bold" ones were too weak. I decided to give the San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser a try because of the reviews, recommendations from friends, and I like their minimal packaging. This coffee is great! Exactly what I was looking for, a strong rich coffee flavor with no bitterness. Perfect for me!
Overall, great price, nice medium to bold taste!  I also like the "less plastic" container as it helps cut down on oil consumption and helps the environment.
I have purchased 3 flavors of SanFrancisco Bay Coffees and have been pleased with all of them.  The pod is a bit different than the typical K-cup but the flavor of the coffee is GREAT.

I have used a K-cups for years. Found San Francisco Bay Coffee cups and decided to give a try. As soon as I opened the first bag I knew it was going to be amazing.
The smell of the coffee grounds was awesome. I did not know until then how I missed the smell of fresh grounds. That woke me up immediately. Love the Fog Chaser coffee! Can not wait to try other flavors! Highly recommend.

This coffee is just what I wanted - not too bitter and not as strong as some coffees. The aftertaste is easy and smooth. I appreciate the packaging into smaller groups of cups, in order to keep the coffee fresh.
I used to drink Newman's Special Blend or Starbucks Sumatra but this is at least as good and cheaper. I'll spring for the 80-cup box this time.
I've been looking for a good quality coffe for my Keurig, and have tried many options (Starbucks, Mountain Green, and others).  I now found my coffe, good robust flavor, no bitterness.
I found this coffee very weak - I had to lower the cup size to get some flavor.  I would not order this again.

Found these by accident on amazon. If you like strong coffee, you'll.like fog chaser. Some days I find it a bit too strong, hence the 4 stars. But, I do love the price, what you get for the price, and the fact that it works wit my machine. I like the French roast too, maybe a bit more. It is strong as well.

Summary: Now the standard in our household
Text: I like a bolder cup of coffee - not "Starbucks-bold" but full bodied and flavorful.  The SF Bay Fog Chaser really fits that bill.  Not over the top strong but very flavorful.  Its great that this product offers competition to the traditional K-cups.  Price is lower but quality is very high.  We've never had an issue fitting this into our Keurig brewer.  The only issue mentioned by many others is the small "sediment" in the bottom of each cup.

Summary: Very strong , flavorful coffee at a great price
Text:
They come in bags, I think nitrogen sealed. It is enough to last a week each bag.

Flavor: Very bold, very strong but not bitter or acidic. Very much like costco coffee
but far more flavorful and complex.

Can do a full 10 oz and it is still strong with milk.

Less plastic to waste
Right amount of caffeine to wake you up.  Flavor and strength are fine too.  I will buy these again as soon as I run out.

Summary: San Francisco Bay coffee K cups
Text: The coffee tastes okay, strong but doesn't have great flavor. The cups fit in my Keurig but not in my dispenser. For these reasons, I wouldn't buy them again

Summary: Absolutely delicious, best cup of coffee around!
Text:
I rarely rate things 5 stars, this coffee deserves the top rating. It is incredibly good, I don't think I want a cup of coffee and then I remember these are in the carousel for my Keurig machine, I change my mind in a heartbeat. It's like having a box of your favorite snack in the cupboard and trying to resist eating it, but you know it's there and you keep thinking about it.

The flavor of this San Fransisco Bay coffee is rich, complex, and delicious. I can't think of a cup of coffee that I've bought anywhere that can beat the bold, rich flavor of this brand. It's like drinking a glass of fine wine. My favorite k-cup previous to this was Tulley's Kona Blend.

The packaging of the individual coffee pod threw me off because when I opened the plastic bag with the pods in it, a very strong aroma of coffee filled the air. I wondered if the paper filter bottoms of the pods wouldn't let the coffee get stale, so I put them in a ziplock baggie. Time will tell I guess if the paper filter will allow the coffee to get stale or not. On the other hand I liked that there was a more green solution to the regular plastic coffee pod holder. I'm torn on this, I 'think' I'd rather have the pods be the more usual plastic in order to preserve freshness, but time will tell. I doubt any of the pods I have will have time to ever get stale however, because I'm drinking them all the time.

Summary: Excellent Taste and More Robust Brewing with These Type of Pods
Text:
I previously purchased a smaller quantity package of this coffee and, liking it as much as I did, I purchased this 80 count package as the price per cup is about 18% less per cup. This coffee is strong, but not too strong, and good-tasting that not only tastes great but has a nice aroma.

The pods are a little different than your traditional plastic K-cup portion as, instead of any plastic around the sides or bottom you have basically a mesh coffee filter holding the coffee grounds. This appears to make a more complete brew, and allows more of the flavor to come into the actual coffee. You will see a dirty residue at the bottom of your cup due to this filtration system vs. a "clean" look from a normal K-cup pod. This seems to make sense as the normal K-cup pod has all of the brewed coffee escaping through the pinprick hole vs. the full brewing experience of these pods.

As the pods are in this filtration medium the coffee is not air-tight sealed after you open the package of pods. I have put the unused ones in a sealed Ziploc bag to keep them fresh.

I also shared this with some folks in the office, who liked it so much they ordered their own so it's not just me who likes this stuff. I believe I have found a new favorite coffee!

I was so excited to get my box of Fog Chaser. I had been paying nearly $40 for Starbucks at a wholesale club and only for 40 cups. I had cut myself to one cup per day! Then my friend shared this link and I thought "Why not!" It arrived quickly, and smelled heavenly. I like dark, strong coffee, and I could tell by the smell it would fit the bill. The real test is in making it. I brewed it this morning--no grounds in my coffee, and no residue left in my cup. Wondered if the soft filter cup at the bottom would work, and it does. How great is that???? It doesn't taste like instant coffee either, which some imitations do. 80 cups for $33 is an awesome deal...that is around $0.42 a cup. If you buy the little boxes at WalMart you only get 18 for $10..which is around $0.61 per cup...you save $0.19 per cup, which doesn't sound like a lot, but you would spend $50 buying as much at WalMart to get 80 K cups. So you are saving $17. I love it!!! Order yours today, you won't be disappointed.

Summary: Better than every real K-Cup there is
Text:
Thanks to Green Mountain (Keurig) buying up all the K-Cup makers, traditional K-Cups keep getting more and more expensive while getting less and less good.

Bad combination.

I was almost resigned to buying my own coffee and using the Ekobrew refillable filter until my Keurig gave out but then I came across San Francisco Bay Coffee's Fog Chaser non-K-cups.

WOW, I can actually use the large cup setting again!

These deceptively little pods pack a punch and while I'm no coffee expert, they are consistent and taste great.

Now I'm just hoping that Green Mountain doesn't take them over...

I am one of those guys that dont like the rising price of k cups. This works great and makes a pretty good
cup of coffee. It is very easy to clean up.. just throw away. At the current price of 16.99 it is about .47
per cup or .40 with subscribe and safe. I also like saving money using the EKOBREW the refillable k cup filter, when you use that you can put in your own grinds and it costs about .25 for starbucks. This is a little easier when you are finished though and is a Good Value.
These K-Cups arrived promptly after ordering; the are convenient to use, and the coffee tastes great. Highly recommend the product. Have had no problems.

Summary: No Fog involved here, clearly a yummy winner
Text:
I was at first hesitant due to the 'weird' lack of a normal kcup but other reviewers take on this flavor tempted me. THANK U for tempting me, this flavor is crisp, delicious and downright 'good stuff'.
I will definitely reorder over and over, now one of my favs.

I was a bit leary when I ordered this, as it wasn't the traditional K-cup but no need to worry.  It worked just fine.  Only problem is, they don't fit in my K-cup carousel all that well and tend to fall out if I turn it too fast.  Beyond that, the coffee tastes just fine and I LOVE the aroma in the kitchen.  Since they have a kind of mesh/fabric back, the aroma of the coffee comes through.  I HAD to have a cup as soon as they arrived just 'cauze it smelled so good!

I'm pretty much a coffee snob and don't care for most of the choices offered for K-cups.  After trying the San Fracisco Bay French Roast I don't think I'll be able to go back to any of the other K-cups!  It tastes so much fresher than the others and has a rich flavor that beats most gourmet coffee at the high-end shops.  Try it if you like real coffee.

Summary: Strong, But Not Acidic or Bitter
Text: I like more full bodied, strong coffee, but usually find they are too bitter, acidic or taste like burnt grounds. The SF Bay Fogchaser was none of the above. I like the "cup" it's a lot less packaging than the normal k-cup (which isn't accepted in our recycling can). With these, I recycle the top and plastic ring and throw the rest into the compost pile. Yes, they look funny, and yes you need to put them into some sort of airtight container to keep them fresh, but a small change for a pretty good cup o' joe.

This product makes a great cup of cofee, bold but not bitter, no bad after taste. The smell starts the experience  and the satisfied full flavor follows. I will buy this product as long as it is available !!

I am not familiar with other San Francisco Bay Products, but, Fog Chaser will get you moving in the morning.  Definately a dark roast for those of you, like me, who want a quick pick me up in the morning. Yes, I have more than one before going to work. I have tried several different dark roasts & this is in my top 4.

Summary: Would not purchase this product again
Text: I prefer a stronger bold cup of coffee, which other review promised this brand/type of coffee was, but I found that I had to use the smallest size brew size cup on my keurig to get any flavor at all, therefore using double the pods ( smaller than regular refills)  don't recommend. Too bad because the price is right.

This coffee is outstanding, nice strong flavor without bitterness.
I am wondering if these k-cups can be used in a Kreurig Vue?

THIS COFFEE IS SUCH A GOOD FRAGRANCE AND SOOOO GOOOOOOOOD TASTING! THIS IS WHAT I CALL A CUP A JO! AND SMELLS SO WONDERFUL FROM OPENING THE BAG, TO BREWING IT AND DRINKING IT. GOOD JOB ROGERS FAMILY! THANKS! I WILL BE ORDERING MORE FOR SURE. ANY OF THE K CUPS CAN'T TOUCH THIS! BELIEVE ME BECAUSE WE HAVE TRIED THEM ALL!
This is definately a fog chaser!  Love this coffee...will continue to purchase.  Of course, I love to visit San Francisco...so this reminds me of that wonderful city!
when your coffee maker motor starts to weaken and sound like a mack truck . Use these the paper filter makes it easy than those plastic ones and the coffee taste great!

I love strong coffee - not bitter - but strong and flavorful.  I grew up in New Orleans and loved the coffee.  I have tried several "bold" coffees and find that they are not flavorful at all - just strong (and bitter).  I bought the fog chaser from the local grocery out of pure frustration of not being able to find anything in a K cup to my liking.  Low and behold I LOVE THIS COFFEE.  It is good, strong coffee with a ton of flavor - very smooth.  Those nay-sayers - stick with the mild/medium stuff.  If you want good strong coffee - this is it.

Very good coffee, have had them for a while, like each amount in small bages. this keeps the other frish.
I will be buying more, the tast was better than other k-cups. amazon is great.

It's a good Coffee but I think it was a little to strong for me.
But It does have a nice taste

Summary: Good Coffee and great price plus better for environment
Text:
Tastes great and cheaper.. Looks a little different but it is a nice clean design. Pods work very well and fit well also. Have several friends and relatives on the product now and they are very pleased also...
Love it

Summary: Finally, Less Plastic and Really Bold  Coffee!
Text:
I just poured my first cup of San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-cup Brewers, and it is great! First of all, the Fog Chaser Coffee will do it's job to chase the Fog away: It is REALLY BOLD! I brewed a medium cup because I like bold coffee and was not sure if this brand would deliver. Next time I will not be afraid to brew a large cup. The coffee is rich, flavorful, and did I say Bold?

Secondly, I love my Keurig, but hated feeling guilty about all the plastic I was adding to the landfills using the Keurig K-Cups. This pod uses at least 1/3 of the plastic of the standard K-Cup: There is a plastic ring holding the mesh coffee filter pod to the foil cap. Environmentally, this is a step in the right direction. I also feel the design of the pod is what allows the coffee to brew stronger, smoother and with more flavor!

My husband does not like his coffee as bold as I do, so I look forward to trying out the other flavors of San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup.

Ordered this on Sunday and recieved it on Wednesday. So the shipping was very fast. The cups aren't the usual cups you get from your local store. Looks more like a k pouch. That being said it is good coffee. As soon as I got them I had to try it out. Tasted fresh and brewed very well. I am glad that I have a subscription as this will be a morning regular.

I tried the San Francisco Bay Coffee Fog Chaser since they have reduced the cost & plastic waste by reducing the packaging. I love a good strong cup of coffee and I love my Keurig brewer. But I am a cheapskate at heart and hated paying the price for the regular K-cups. This is a great compromise.
Since it does not have the plastic cup base and is just a round filter hanging from the top ring, you have to keep them sealed in a zip-lock or similar air tight container or they will not stay fresh. That is a small inconvenience I can live with. They also reduce our use of plastic and the trash we generate and I suspect that there may be health benefits from not brewing the coffee in the little plastic cup.
This product is fabulous! Delicious coffee, great price, and the packaging uses only a fraction of the plastic used in traditional Kcups.

This coffee is not what I expected.  I thought it would be a bold coffee similiar to Starbucks, but it is not, and it leaves a sediment in my cup, which other don't .  very disappointed and will not re order this brand again.

My husband and I are always trying new k-cups to see what's new. We were both pleasantly surprised by this coffee. It was bold but really smooth. It's a great morning and just the right kick for the afternoon pick me up.

I use these in my Keurig B130, they fit well and save plastic. I brew fog chaser over ice- its got a nice medium flavor.
The frustration free packaging works fine. I put the opened pods in a ziplock in the freezer- stay fresh for a week.

Summary: So happy I found this coffee!  No plastic aftertaste!
Text: I have been using a Keurig for about 18 months.  I love the convenience, but feel guilty about wasting the plastic and my husband doesn't like the k-cups cause he says the coffee tastes like plastic.  This brew cup is great...less plastic to waste and the coffee taste fresh!  5 Stars!

Summary: Great coffee, works fine in old-style B30 mini machine
Text: My 5-star rating is in comparison to other K-Cups I've had, not compared to beans just ground and brewed in my Technivorm Moccamaster. Having said that, this is still a satisfying cup of coffee. My wife was drinking Coffee People Donut Shop as her everyday cup, has switched to this. For me the DS was OK, but I favor the darker brews like Paul Newman Extra Bold and the Van Houtte Eclipse. I like this Fog Chaser quite a bit better, and it's a great bonus how much less plastic waste the cups create. On top of that, they're cheaper, so extra bonus. If you like strong, but not bitter, coffee, this is definitely worth trying.

This is great coffee! I can not say enough about how bold and rich this is. I was pleasantly surprised at the richness in the coffee, because I feel like most of the k-cups are kind of weak. This coffee is so good that my husband has declared we will ever buy another brand again. I love the packaging on it as well. I'm not sure if the filters at the bottom instead of the plastic are what help the coffee to taste so good, but it's a great idea! So much less waste and coffee wasn't meant to be streamed through plastic anyway. I wish more k-cups were made this way. We have no problems with the coffee going stale before we get  through the 10 in each package. I store them in the k-cup holder I have and they are still perfect. LOVE LOVE LOVE this stuff. Highly recommended!

This has been running much less than other K cups so I gave it a try.

Lower cost than K-cups but more than using an Ekobrew cup with your favorite coffee.

Much stronger smell when you open a plastic package. Not a pleasant coffee smell but some people like that dark a roasting, look at Starbucks.

Cons: not very complex, darker almost burnt roasting, some bitterness.

If your preferences are more to the Nantucket Blend on the roasting scale this is not for you.

Added, I see they have a Breakfast Blend which according to reviews is milder and more complex. However they helpfully point out it is still roasted more than other brands and I believe the amount of roasting is part of my objection to the flavor.

Because of the minimal packaging I didn't expect much or even for the cups to work as well as the usual ones.  I pleasantly surprised at the excellent flavor of the coffee and the way the cups stood up to brewing. This is a very dark roast, not for the timid coffee drinker. It would do well as an iced coffee due to it's rich, bold flavor - hmmmm, not a bad idea, I think I'll try it right now!

My wife is the coffee drinker in our house. Pete's, Starbucks and a whole host of local coffee spots come under her purview. And then there are all the coffees at the grocery store. She has now deemed Fog Chaser for her Keurig coffee maker the best!

Summary: You get what you pay for
Text: This was an extremely affordable item, but the old adage you get what you pay for applies here.  The coffee was nothing special and tasted like discount coffee.  One of the best aspects of the single-cup coffee maker is that you get a cup of coffee that is strong (depending upon your preference), fresh and, tastes like a cup of coffee from one of the chain reatil locations, without the retail price. This coffee tasted like weak, old coffee - coffee that was made in a drip maker.  In my opinion, not a "Fog Chaser" at all.

I love this coffee.  Great flavor, great price.  I wish I'd found it sooner.  I haven't had the experience with "stale coffee" as some of the other reviews state, but I have left the coffee in a ziploc bag instead of in a holder.

Great stuff! Tastes fresher than all of the other types of k-cups; and I've tried all the major ones including Starbucks.
It looks like you save ten cents over everyone else as well. The only negative; because of the way they are packed and manufactured, my 30 cup k-cup carousel is now useless.

Coffee People Kona Blend Island Style has been my favorite (prepackaged) coffee for my Keurig. Fog Chaser may come in a close second. I started on this one as the Kona hasn't been available for awhile now. The Fog Chaser is a medium-bodied blend that does well any time of the day. I like it iced also. It's smooth with earth and cedar notes. Not sweet, but not bitter. A nice balance.

Don't be fooled by the plastic bags with the air seals on them. No coffee, no matter if it's whole bean, refrigerated, or in fancy packaging will retain the same flavor profile it had in the first weeks after it's roasted. Coffee should be drunk in about 2-3 days after it's roasted and for about another 2-4 weeks. The majority of flavor in coffee comes from it's aromatics, and they are gone in a relatively short period of time. When I have time I buy green coffee beans, roast them in my air pop popcorn poppers, wait 2-3 days, grind as needed, and drink it all in the next 2-4 weeks. TMALST These won't go bad if you leave the bag open on a counter.

This coffee is delicious but very strong. Not for the faint of heart...it will wake you up!!!It has a wonderfully rich aroma while brewing and a deep yet not bitter taste. This is a great deal for K-cups and supports an environmentally friendly company. I would wholehearted recommend.

I've really enjoyed this K-cup. The coffee is strong and flavorful and I love that the Cups are recyclable. After I open the package, I put the remaining K-cups in a container in the refrigerator to help keep them fresh.
I thought this product would be amazing, based on the way it smelled when I opened the bag, but it was just average. Not great, but not awful.

After reading the reviews we jumped in with both feet and ordered this and the French Roast. Here's my take on the Fog Chaser after drinking all 36 cups:
* I prefer the French Roast, but I like a darker roast. This has a fruity undertone, similar to a Breakfast Blend, that I personally don't care for. But, my husband likes it and I find it drinkable.
* Don't be scared by the look, it's just a K-Cup without the plastic case. I love that this seems more eco-friendly.
* Okay, it's true, they smell a little funny. Not quite sure why they don't just smell like coffee, but who knows what other K-cups smell like without the plastic cover, right? Our solution was just not to smell them before brewing.
* The taste is pretty strong, and my first cup tasted bitter and not so great. We don't use sugar or sweeteners so there was nothing to mask the taste! But, like most new things, after a couple of cups over a couple of mornings I found the taste was fine, especially for the price. I don't know if I would serve this to company though, I like darker roasts but most people don't, and this is a little more bold than mild. There is a not-totally-pleasant aftertaste, but not enough to not drink it.
* I read a tip that said to prevent grounds in your cup, close the brewer lid slowly and gently. Works for us, we've had NO grounds in our cups.
So there we go, I'm ordering them again to take advantage of the Subscribe & Save option. I'm not going to say that this is the best coffee I've ever had, but for that 1st cup in the morning it's just fine.

Summary: Just to net it out, good coffee.
Text: I almost didn't bother writing this since everything i have to say is covered by others.  Stated simply, it's good coffee, excellent price, with less plastic to go into the trash.  I often run two cycles (one large and one small) using the same "k-cup" (not really a k-cup but functions as one) and mix them together. To calibrate my opinion, I'll mention that I am a huge fan of Dunkin Doughnut coffee and I tolerate Starbucks.

Summary: Finally a K-Cup that makes a bigger cup of coffee
Text:
Because this Fog Chaser K-Cup makes a very strong regular (a.k.a. SMALL) cup of coffee, it is a great pod for making a larger (travel-sized) cup of coffee that is the perfect strength. This is absolutely the best deal I've found anywhere online for any K-Cups, and this brand has proven to be of excellent quality as well (I've also ordered French Roast Decaf and was happy with those too!).

Because these have a filter-type bottom, you will have to keep them in a sealed bag or container once the individual bag has been opened to keep them at optimal freshness, but this is easy to do and, in my opinion, not a big deal.

Great price + great taste = great value. You can't go wrong with these.
This is great stuff.  One of my all time favorites.  If you like strong coffee then you will like this.
First time user and found this coffee is very good.  Not too acidy or overly strong.  Good stuff!  I would order again and definately recommend this to others

PLEASE READ!!!!! Do not let the bad reviewers drive you away, I almost didn't order these because of them. If you like REAL coffee not fluffed up flavored coffee but real coffee this is for you. I have tried pretty much every K-cup on the market and the only ones I enjoy are midnight magic and jet fuel. If you like either of these two you will enjoy this cup of coffee. A little about my coffee preference, I mainly enjoy french pressed strong coffees because the flavors are out of this world. I do have a Keurig (Christmas gift) for about 5 years now, sad part is I only use this if I ran out of time in the morning. With all of that said do realize this is not even remotely close to a french press but is now being added to my very small k-cup approval list.

What I really like about this K-Cup is that it is not a normal K-Cup encased in plastic. The coffee is enclosed in a filter, which results in less plastic in the landfills. In addition, the coffee itself is a nice strong cup worthy of it's name, Fog Chaser. It is my favorite cup of coffee in the morning. I have made it a point to subscribe and have it delivered every month.

Though it may not be the BEST coffee I've ever tasted, it's pretty up there, and for a price that's a fraction of the other K-cups, it's 5-stars in my book.  I get an 80-pack box from my local BJ's for $28, so it works out to be $.35/k-cup.  It's much more rich and flavorful than other k-cups I've tried (donut shop, green mountain, gloria jean's).

I first bought this at a local grocery and liked it so much I went to amazon to purchase it on an automatic delivery.  It has a different packaging than most, but it works the same.  The pricing is much better than purchasing either in the store or online individually.  This is my first auto delivery from amazon.  I am very pleased with the coffee and the shipping process.

This is a great coffee, very strong and tasty, not just bitter and bold.

The lack of a plastic cup at the bottom is neat, reduces waste significantly.

Count me among the fans. I love the lower-waste design of these k-cup compatible pods. It is a mild inconvenience keeping them in an airtight container, but the investment in a tight-sealing jar paid for itself with the first case. It was smart to package them in bags of 12, so each bag is only open for about a week.  The coffee is good. Not astonishingly strong, but pretty rich and balanced. They don't advertise it here, but the company's coffee is fair trade/direct trade as well!

Summary: Great Tasting Coffee, Great K-Cups Too!
Text:
A friend offered me a cup of this about a week ago. Wonderful stuff! Disappointing when he told me, it's not in stores. (At least not around here, so I have to order on Amazon...) It's great tasting coffee! And more importantly, even though it brews in the Keurig, it's NOT in little plastic cups.
More than two years ago I switched to the oh-so-convenient K-Cups, despite reservations about brewing coffee in little plastic cups. (1)Very hot water steeps in Plastic cups. (2)Lots of little plastic cups go into landfills or incinerators. Now, finally, there's a product with all the convenience of the K-cup brewers, but none of the drawbacks! Why didn't someone think of this sooner?

I really like this coffee. It's bold, yet smooth as well. I especially appreciate the simpler packaging with much less plastic waste. Additionally, I don't think the coffee grounds touch plastic at all, just the foil top and filter. They work impeccably in my Keurig.

Summary: Less waste, great taste, go for it!
Text: Our family really likes this brand of coffee.  The package the coffee by the dozen in plastic bags to ensure freshness and the taste is a mild to medium flavor.  The subscribe and save is a great way to save money (around fourteen dollars for thirty six cups) and ensure you're never without coffee.  Although it's still wasteful, each cup has less plastic than the regular k-cup coffees out there.  I actually like that you can see the coffee and the little filter pouch it sits in.  We recently found out that costco is selling this brand of coffee (french roast - which is much more bold) for a more economical price (eighty cups for around thirty six cents a piece).  We will continue to purchase and suggest you try it out at least once.
I like a bolder coffee than my husband does and this one is good enough for me. It leaves a pleasant after-flavor. I am impressed also with the design of the cups. I'd certainly order it again.
It was much too "sharp/harsh" for me.  Had to add cinnamon and half-and-half just to get it down.  Really sorry I purchased two boxes of it!

Summary: Only decent coffee. Poorly filtered and goes stale
Text:
I purchased this because another reviewer likened it to Coffee People's Jet Fuel. Unfortunately it is not even close.
The first cup seemed fine. The flavor immediately after brewing is good, but as soon as it cools down some it turns harsh fast.
The open-filter is a poor design. It can and absolutely will go stale. I compared the scent of the final coffee pouch(cup?) from a previously opened bag to a newly opened, and the scent is completely different. Think old coffee can vs. freshly opened.
The other gripe on the filter is the poor filtration. There is always sediment at the bottom of the cup.
