A friend of mine recommended this.  I use it on my daughters hair as a scalp moisturizer.  The oil makes its way down the shaft of her hair leaving it shiny but not heavy.  I live in south florida and because of the temperature the oil is rarely solid so I keep it in an applicator bottle.  I will be a customer for life.  Oh yeah, I keep a little bit in the kitchen for cooking.  Great Flavor.

I have been using coconut oil as a substitute for cooking oils and skin/ hair products for years. This is a stellar brand- it is organic, cold pressed, and made for safe storing. There is a lot fo good info on the web about how coconut oil is saving our health. Jump on the band wagon. It is not too late.

Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil has a great taste and has many beneficial uses.  You can use it to cook, bake, and as skin care.  You can also use it for oil pulling!!  This is def. one of the best tasting coconut oils on the market.  I def. recommend Nutiva =)!

This oil is not as opaque as pictured. I made delicious coconut ice cream first. Then I tried it on toast and it didn't really taste like anything. I will use this item when coconut flavor is required in baking.

This item really shone when it was used for frying Indian spices. The spices for once did not burn and the fragrance was amazing. It is a true flavor enhancer.

gme

Summary: Product was bad but customer service was excellent
Text:
On 9/9/2011 I order the above product. My daughter and I recently started the Atkins diet, heard wonderful things about it and decided to give it a try. The first jar was wonderful! Creamy, aromatic, flavorful...absolutely devine. I opened the second jar at the beginning of this week and what a disappointment. I'm not sure if the ingredients are cooked but the oil has a burnt horrid taste to it. Before we realized it, we had made a batch of carb-free chocolate candy with cream cheese and coconut frosting, a huge batch of chicken fried in the oil and a huge batch of faux-potatoes using the oil. We had to throw everything away. The taste was atrocious. Everything had a burnt and bitter taste to it. I'm extremely disappointed and according to my 15 year old daughter, they need to hire better quality control employees.

I have to post an update to this review because I've been working with a customer service rep today and he has provided fantastic service. He is shipping me, for free, a replacement product as well as some additional free products. I am also sending the remaining jar back to the company, at no cost to me, for additional research.

I used to cook with coconut oil years ago, but gave it up when the "experts" said it was bad for your health. I started cooking with "healthier" alternatives--like artificial sweeteners and chemical-loaded, aerosol-powered, partially hydrogenated cooking sprays--also on the advice of the experts.  My food tasted like a tin can, my skin was an oily mess, I felt sluggish all the time, and my jeans hugged me ever more tightly. Thankfully, the conventional wisdom has come full circle, and I've spent the last few years making the grateful journey back to a more natural--and genuinely healthy--way of living. I looked for a good, organic coconut oil at our regular grocer with no luck, so I was glad to find this brand here on Amazon.  I'll agree with some of the other reviewers that say this oil has a "toasty" scent.  It does, and that's why I like it.  Its warm, toasty aroma actually smells a little buttery--which is perfect if you're using this as a substitute for butter or margarine.  I've tried other oils that have a more coconut-y aroma, and they also had a sweeter, pronounced fruit-oil flavor that's great for desserts and dressings--but clashed with meats and savory dishes. This coconut oil and EVOO now get nearly equal time in my day-to-day cooking, and the warm "toastiness" of this oil adds a richness that enhances other flavors. I can't see it working in place of butter on something like toast or popcorn, but cooking with it gives a noticeably buttery taste to foods. This came in a pack of two tubs, which is convenient since this oil has so many uses. I can have one in the fridge to keep it solid for cosmetic/medicinal use, and the other in the cabinet as an ever-ready liquid for cooking. I'm once again enjoying all the benefits of virgin coconut oil--health, nutrition, beauty, and flavor all in one jar. These containers are fairly small, so if you use this as one of your staple oils, you may want to get a bigger size.

Summary: Yummy for skin, and your palate!
Text:
(I thought I had reviewed this product already, but perhaps it was under a different size? Oh, well)

With apologies for possible redundancy, I will simply say that this stuff is fantastic.

Other reviewers have written about the "clean" taste, and I can say that after tasting this product, I wholeheartedly agree. It just tastes fresh.

And it melts in your hand. And tastes terrific in food.

It DOES have a delicious fresh scent, but make no mistake, it does NOT smell like suntan oil. If you wear it on your skin, you will not smell like the stuff that comes in a brown bottle. It actually fades relatively quickly, but no one will accuse you of rolling around in coconuts.

Same goes for putting in food. I think it adds a nice depth and nuttiness, and is yummy in popcorn, as some have stated. But it is absolute HEAVEN in your fried brekkie potatoes.

Think it is also worth mentioning that to the lower ratings reviewers, I think that ordering this product in the cooler months has merit. If it becomes liquid at 75-ish degrees, I can see that it would be easy for this stuff to leak, despite what appears to be the best efforts on the part of the manufacturer when it comes to the packaging.

Finally, I think that the 15 oz size is fine if you are going to be using this product for topical use only, but if you plan on cooking with it as well, I would recommend getting a larger size-

Can't wait to use this during the summer, and show off my glowing skin!

Hope this helps!

This is the first time I have ever used coconut oil and I love it!

I first tried cooking with it--I used one tablespoon in the pan, added onion, garlic, mushrooms and peppers. I usually use EVOO so I was a bit worried about the taste difference. It defininely smells like coconut, but surprisingly, it is not overly strong. The taste was pleasant with my veggies. First try: delicious and easy.

Next, I put some on my face as a moisturizer. Again, the smell was pleasant and mild. In the past I have also used EVOO on my skin because it is a milder moisturizer than a store bought facial moisturizer. EVOO takes hours and hours to soak in, so I only use it at night before bed. I thought the coconut oil would be similar. I put in on in the evening and sat down to watch a movie. It was completely absorbed before I even hit the sheets! And by the time it was absorbed, the smell was gone (not that the smell of coconut on the skin would be a bad thing!) So it is lovely as a facial moisturizer.

Then I read on the label that it could be used in place of butter, so I spread some on a cracker and tried it that way. It was delicious! I love the oily texture--similar to butter, with the coconut taste. So it is a wonderful substitute for butter.

I am sure I will find more uses for this incredible product and I can't wait to try it again.

Summary: Delicious and good for you, it can't get any better than this!
Text:
I bought this coconut oil based solely on other great customer reviews and believe me when I tell you how happy I am that I did! I am 39 years old and at the age where health is something that is starting to become very important to me, as I am starting to see more and more friends and school mates with various health issues.. I have never had any health complaints and have decided to be proactive about health matters, instead of trying to "fix" them as they come along (as long as I'm able, of course). So, in my hours and hours of reading, I came across so many articles, websites and books devoted to coconut oil. I was shocked, that I have never heard of it and I have still not met anyone who uses it.

So, I decided I had to try it! The main reason was I read that eating 2-4 teaspoons a day had health benefits, but I have also came across my fair share of home spa recipes for moisturizers using coconut oil as one of there main ingredients. I figured, I couldn't go wrong buying it, because if it didn't taste nice, I could still use it. I'm very happy to report that I was blown away by the taste of this coconut oil! It is not sweet at all but the coconut oil was so reminiscent of a Almond Joy candy bar to me, that I find myself going back for another spoon just to enjoy the delicious flavor.. I'm afraid I'm going to have to reorder more to use in my moisturizer recipes, as I intend to use these two containers to cook with now that I am hooked on this fantastic product.! I would recommend this coconut oil to everyone because of it's many health benefits and versatility of use (You can spread it on your toast it tastes so great or cook with it as you would any cooking oil, as well as use it on your skin. Google Coconut oil moisturizer recipes, cooking recipes and also health benefits for yourself as well as the health benefits for your dogs if you have pets. You will be amazed at all the interesting information on the web about coconut oil))! Unless you truly dislike coconuts I think you will find, like me, that you now have a new favorite oil!

I have to admit I'm floored by this product.  I'm originally from the West Indies so needless to say I love coconut.  I've tried other extra virgin coconut oils and wasn't impressed, they tasted and smelled more like vegetable oil than anything, and forget about trying them straight.  I was very skeptical about Nutiva but reading some good reviews and being hounded by my vegetarian friend who swears by it, I said what the hell.  It arrived from Amazon and it was in liquid form, which was to be expected as it's 96' in the shade here in Florida.  I removed the lid off the jar and before I even took the seal off, I was entranced by this wondeful coconut fragrance.  I stuck my finger in and even in liquid form, I was tasting nothing but melted coconut.  Later, when it turned into solid form I tried it again, a dap on a teaspoon, once again, nothing but coconut.  Definitely will buy this coconut oil again.  Nutiva did a great job of impressing an Islander ;)
We love this coconut oil.  We use it for cooking and for body care.  It smells like coconut unlike some other brands.  The only change I would love is for it to come in a glass bottle.

I love the smell of coconut! However, I must say, I assumed that coconuts were naturally sugary. Well....i was WRONG! There is no sugar taste to this stuff at all! It does have a very strong smell of coconut though, and not much flavor to it.

I bought this stuff because of some Candida overgrowth issues I've had recently been dealing with (which was caused by too many antibiotics given to me by my doctor) and also for a new found minor eczema problem (probably caused by the Candida overgrowth).

So basically I eat and rub this stuff on me all day. Lol.

I love the added taste it gives to coffee or tea. It says it can be used as a 'buttery spread on bread' but I can't imagine actually substituting butter for this stuff.

I have yet to cook with it, but I'm sure it will work fine.

My stomach problems I've been having have seemed to have cleared up.

As far as the eczema, it seems to be helping a bit, but not as quickly as Dermarest Eczema lotion did.

Dermarest Eczema Medicated Lotion 4 fl oz (118 ml)

I still find myself scratching a bit, but not nearly as much as before and redness or bumps are gone. However, I am still going to keep using this for my eczema because it is more natural way of clearing it up. After using the Dermarest lotion a few days my heart started pumping slow and hard.

One more thing I should mention (why I gave this product 4 stars instead of 5) is because I keep forgetting that this stuff melts once it reaches 76 degrees. I inadvertently opened the jar on an angle one day thinking the coconut was still solid and the oil spilled out everywhere!! Definately my own fault, but the jar itself doesn't seem to be the best thing for containing such an oily liquid when it melts. This still would not stop me from purchasing this specific brand though, just don't be an idiot like me and you will be fine.

I would definitely recommend this brand as I've seen others in stores and they cost about 12 for 1 jar. Amazon had 2 jars for 12. Can't beat that! +++

This is my first time experimenting with coconut oil and I am very pleased. I've used it in cookies and brownies and they have turned out amazing. I would that that when I make cookies, I melt the oil instead of creaming it with the sugar like you would butter.

I've used it on my hand when they dry and crack and it works very well and smells wonderful.

I've also used the oil for a stir-fry and in some basmati rice and both turned out wonderfully.

0 Cholesterol is an added bonus to the wonderful taste it adds to dishes.
Great coconut oil to use in cooking, baking, and even as a snack (grab a spoon and go!). Will definitely order it again!

I love, love, love this coconut oil! I haven't used it much to sauté or anything like that, but I use it in my breads, muffins, pancakes, etc.

But that's not all, this stuff has so many wonderful uses!!!! I use it as a hot oil treatment for my hair and I use it topically to treat blemishes. I've heard of many other uses, from lotion to deodorant. As I continue my journey of a healthier lifestyle, I look forward to further investigating it's many uses.

The only thing I would change is the packaging.....a glass jar would be really nice!

As far as shipping goes, I live in Hawaii and have not had any problems with leakage or spilling during transport.

My daughter-in-law told me about this coconut oil. I was pleased with the quality of the product and the speed of its arrival. The price is much better than in the health food stores. Automatic shipping cuts down extra trips to the store, as well.

I've been buying this two-pack of unrefined coconut oil for my family the last couple of years. Great quality, taste and value. If I were to purchase at a local natural food store, I'd pay at least $3 more for the same amount of the same product.

We use coconut oil for all of our cooking due to the MFAs and high heat point. It takes the place of butter as a sandwich spread and in most our baking. I also use it (just a touch!) as a hair product for my twin toddlers and a moisturizer for our skin.

I HIGHLY recommend. =)

This coconut oil is absolutely wonderful. I ordered it so that I can make low cholesterol baked goods for my dad, but now i'm using it for myself as well, it's so delicious. I love the subtle coconut flavor!
Hey , this is some great tasting stuff ! Also love to cook with it , and it's way healthier than margarine or butter ! Will be using from now on .

This oil is a solid at room temp but quickly melts over low heat and cooks at a low temp better than olive oil.  The flavor is also somewhat sweet and very different from olive oil.  We like it!  We purchased two packs of 2.

Summary: Coconut oil is the healthy option
Text: Coconut oil is the healthiest oil you can cook with.  This brand tastes great and has a light flavor that doesn't obscure the taste of the food that's being cooked.  Highly recommended.

Love using this coconut oil as a replacement for butter on toast, pancakes, sweetpotatoes, in oatmeal, cream of wheat, and a lot of other foods. I keep extra tub in bathroom to use on skin. It's a great product that's also good for you.

Very satisfied with this product,use it a lot in place of butter, it adds a very different flavor but taste great. A friend tried it the other day on her toast and loved it so she wants to get some too.

Summary: Tastes great and excellent for cooking
Text: I use this coconut oil for cooking and I love it! Great coconut taste that enhances all my dishes. Love that it comes in a 2-pack so I always have a backup. A++

I was buying this exact product at my local GNC for what I'm paying here for 2 of them. Can't beat that great deal! This stuff is so healthy, and helps me tons with my weight loss after having my baby. I'll be a customer for life!

I have tried several brands of coconut oil, and this is so far my favorite.  It has a delightful flavor and consistency.  I like it for cooking, baking, skin lotion, and straight from the jar on a spoon.  It is a great quality as well, and a great price.  I will definitely continue to buy this product!

Besides being just plain tasty, a small addition of Nutiva coconut oil to my daily diet lowered my triglycerides and "bad" cholesterol. It also ended nightly coughing from what my doctor diagnosed as gastric reflux. Better coconut oil than prescription proton inhibitors that leach calcium from your bones!

I've used Nutiva coconut oil to cook with for a couple of years now. Their prices are hard to beat when on sale and make this wonderful healthy oil a staple in our house now. I have decided that I like this smaller size over the larger tubs (jar-like) of theirs I've bought in the past since it makes getting the oil out easier. This 2-tub package is a great deal, especially when combined with subscribe and save.
I ordered the Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil and love it!  I use it on my skin and hair as a daily moisturizer. It's not greasy and it feels great for massages.

I've recently become a fan of coconut oil and think this is one of the best kinds I've tried. Love to use it on homemade popcorn and in baking. I appreciate that it is organic and cold-pressed as well. Highly recommend.
I liked the price and the oil is better quality than the organic store-bought oil. It seems to be lighter and the wide opening is superior to a narrower jar.

I use this coconut oil on a daily basis and currently do the subscribe and save option so I never run out. I use it to cook all of my meals. It has a very subtle coconut flavor and coats the pan better than olive oil ever could. It does burn and can withstand the highest of temperatures. It is great because it can also be used as a moisturizer, it make my skin very soft. There are so many health benefits to using coconut oil. I am loyal to Nutiva!

I love, love, love this product. I use it for my hair, skin, cook with it and even use for massages.  Its organic, cold pressed, virgin which is the best grade you can get.  The price is very reasonable.  I bought the two container option. I keep one in the bathroom and one in the kitchen. I put a little in a small, reusable container so I can keep in my purse.  Don't want to be without it.

Summary: Nutiva Coconut Oil is a Multi-purpose product!
Text: Nutiva is the cleanest Coconut Oil I have ever purchased... It is the best for top of the stove cooking, and greasing or oiling cookie sheets and pie pans... Adds an excellent taste to chicken stir fry... or cooking pancakes, the flavor is great....  The best part is that get some on your hands?  Don't wipe it off, put it on your hands, face, arms or legs, or a treatment for your hair, just prior to washing... what a little container for a versatile product.. buy it,  you will be amazed!

I've been using this brand of coconut oil for over a year and I love it.  I've tried other brands but none of them were as good. I like this 15 ounce size better because you can use it up before it gets rancid. I had a much larger container before but it turned before I used it all up, we live in a hot climate so this is a great size to insure it stays fresh. I use one jar as a cosmetic on my skin and hair and we cook and bake with the other jar and use it in smoothies. It tastes great and is wonderful for baking when you want a little coconut flavor substitute it for the oil in the recipe. Great for curry and sambal recipes. Just know that it solidifies if it gets cold so as a salad oil it's not good because it gets hard when it hits cold food. It will do this when used as a marinade on cold seafood or meat but thats a good thing in that case because it stays hardened on the food till you get it on the grill and then it melts into it making it really tasty! There are too many uses to list and now that we know that coconut oil is a healthy oil there is no more guilt. I highly recommend this great oil.

This coconut oil is amazing. I use it for cooking, making homemade deodorant, making homemade body wash, as a butter substitute, on popcorn, on bread.... its just amazing. It smells delicious and tastes SO good. And the subscribe and save price makes it a really great deal :)
PS for those who havent used coconut oil, it is solid at below 75 degrees (so pretty much room temperature). It is super easy to melt tho... even just putting it between your fingers will turn it into liquid :)
An excellent product.  I bought this as a trial item to see whether this will be good. Nutiva is really good. Since we make Virgin coconut oil at home, its for sure the oil is good.

ProfileName: Donna's Reviews "I Love Shopping on Amazon!"
Text: I like cooking with different flavors...this is great...Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 15-Ounce Tubs (Pack of 2)....I now have found it in my local grocery....
I use this stuff for my hair and skin.  It makes my hair shiny and soft.  Makes my skin smooth and soft, but a little sticky.  Smells good, but I haven't tried eating it yet.

Summary: Great for eczema lotion and cooking oil!
Text: I've been using coconut oil to soothe my baby's eczema, as well as using it as my primary cooking oil! Wonderful, healthy, healing fat!
Convenient packaging!  Easy to use as coconut oil has to be heated (in warm water) to be in a liquid state and I just put this container in a bowl of hot tap water.  Stores well too!

I love this coconut oil.  I use it for popping popcorn.  It has a wonderful subtle coconut flavor and stands up to the high heat needed for popping corn - or any other high heat cooking.  It is solid at room temperature.  It also works well as a body oil.  I cut off a chunk and use it to rub on my skin before a shower.

Coconut oil is really great for my skin, especially on my eczema.
I am just disappointed that one of the tubs was opened and exposed.

Not sure if I am buying this product from Amazon again...

I love to use this as a butter replacement in many baked goods such as banana bread and pancakes. Some other goods the coconut taste is more powerful, so I don't usually use it for those. For some reason, we don't care for it in scrambled eggs because we can taste it, but it is perfect for omelets. Not sure why, but you can't taste it there. In baked goods, it lends a perfect crunchy texture to the outside. And you can't go wrong in the health department with this stuff. It's one of the "good" fats, and is full of healthy stuff. I add it to smoothies, too.

Summary: Could use a better dispensing system
Text: I like the taste and health benefits of this product, my only beef is that it is really messy to get out of the package. I cannot pour it due to the round jar shape. Regardless of how careful I am spooning it out there always seems to be a greasy mess on the countertop and in the pantry on the shelf where it is stored. I'd love to see this coconut oil packaged in a bottle that is easier to pour from, then I'd totally buy it again. So all in all, good product, poor packaging.

The coconut oil smells so fresh and good.  I like to use a tbsp or so and lightly pan fry whatever and it adds a light coconut flavor (which i love)!!  Another reviewer recommended frying up a peanutbutter and jelly sandwich by using a tbsp or so per side of the sandwich until golden brown.  It is SOOO good.  I also like how it usually stays solid at room temp.

I mix this with my oatmeal after it has been cooked. The possible medicinal benefit goes away if this oil is heated. The taste is minimal which is good. The texture is viscous as almost not to be there. much better product than I expected.

Summary: Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 15-Ounce Tubs (Pack of 2)
Text: used it to bake some cookies instead of butter. nice result. coconut oil is always a little pricey tho, and i wonder if over-use of tropical oils is bad for the tropical habitats...

I just loved this product. It is healthy and a delicious (best) substitute for any type of bread spread. French toast cooked with this oil are just heavenly. Has zero cholesterol and delicious flavor, what else can you ask for? Kids will love it too.
Great product, light coconut taste. Although, I was a little disappointed with the size of the container for the price.
I like the product.  I have used it a few times.  No coconut taste to the foods cooked in it.  Received the product as described in a timely manner.
I use it mainly to bake, in waffles & for popcorn.  Give a *great* light flavor to anything I've tried so far.  Excess is wonderful for dry skin/hands.

I bought this product but found similar product at half the price in the local asian store. (Not same brand).

If you leave the price alone, then the product is every good. The quality , purity and freshness are excellent.
What a great product available for such a great price.  At the time of my purchase it was only 0.40/oz!

Summary: Extra Virgin at good auto purchaseprice then wasn't available on that program
Text: Too bad right after I bought the first pack of 2 they discontinued the automatic purchase program for this item. Was good price. Guessing they will allow the automatic purchase with higher price in the future?
I use it as a hair moisturizer and prepoo! I also use it to help with my daughter's eczema. I love it!!! Leaves a nice shine on my hair.
I've been using this product for years on my hair, skin and to cook. This oil is very versatile and is a good buy.
I love this stuff!  I enjoy using it in baking, and also in my hair and on my skin.

this is a MUST BUY for anyone wanting the great medicinal properties of coconut oil! This one is great and my husband and I take it by the spoonful every morning. My husband also puts it in his orange juice to add a great coconut flavor!

Summary: great stuff so far (newbie to the product)
Text: Just started using the product last week. I have cooked with it and love the subtle flavor it brings to food. I have used it in my daughters hair to add shine, she is mixed. I have used it as a body oil as well..covers well on the skin and I dont use lotion anymore. Love the way it makes my skin feel soft and smooth. I love this product so far! No compliants from me! It is packaged well too! Recommend this to anyone!

This has an amazing, light flavor.  I have tried others, and they tasted and smelled very offensive.  I add Nutiva's Coconut oil to everything from oatmeal to peas.  I also use it in virtually all my cooking on the stove.  It does NOT make food taste like coconut at all; just a healthier oil to use.  I highly recommend it to anyone!!

I try to use this as much as I can due to low cholesterol: toasts, baking pastries, pancakes (yum).
It is also a great hair mask (yes! but warm it up first) and skin moisturiser.
Only one complaint: it doesnt spread like regular butter. But the taste, smell and health benefits make it up for me.

I have nothing but great things to say for this oil. I use it in two ways, for cooking (it adds a slight coconut essence) and for my hair. I created a bar of it using my tupperware, as it is solid at room temperature and I use this after I wash my hair. It leaves my hair soft and shiny and isn't greasy. I rub it on my hands and run it through my wet hair and let it air dry. I also sometimes use it on my skin. It absorbs well and does not leave it greasy like baby oil. Highly recommended.

After hearing a lot of good things about this product in the way of hair-care, I decided to give it a go. I got the two because it was cheapest, and if all else failed, I could cook with it, right?

Well, I never got to the cooking phase. This oil is a WONDERFUL moisturizer, and I use it every time I wash my hair - sometimes between washes, if it's an extended time. My hair has never felt so healthy and... not-dry. And after this, I began to wonder what else it was good for. I also discovered it's good as a low-cost additive in paint (oil or acrylic) that keeps the application smooth and elegant.

So! Two fun uses that have nothing to do with food. I suppose when I use it correctly, it won't disappoint me there, either.

I buy 2 of these at least twice a month and I use the coconut oil for everything. I have been losing weight and my skin has never been better. I never had a problem with the oil leaking out of the packaging and is very disappointed Amazon will no longer carry this item. Amazon had the best deal on this item anywhere. I will pray that they find a way to bring it back. More people should research the amazing benefits of using this oil. 5 stars *****.

Best quality coconut oil I have found. It smells faintly of coconut without being overwhelming. And since I use cloth diapers for my son, I use it in the cloth wipe solution and as a diaper rash preventative. Also use it for eczema and chapped lips. I imagine it works well for cooking, but I haven't even tried that, yet!  haha

The Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is simply, one of the best products out there. If you have not tried cooking with coconut oil, at least give it a try. Fried eggs, fried potatoes fried in coconut oil is delicious. I'm 58 yrs old and just recently tried cooking with cocnut oil.. I've been missing out on something wonderful for years. If you are a popcorn fan, you should eat popcorn cooked in cocconut oil. It is excellent. I also use this on my dry skin. Just put some on your finger and rub it in. Again, this is a great product. Try it, I think you will agree.

Tony
I've been wanting to try Coconut Oil for it's health benefits but have been hesitant due to the price.  Finally gave it a try because of Amazons Subscribe & Save offer.  I love this product!

I first ordered this coconut oil about a month ago, and have placed another order. Not only does it smell good but it is easy to melt and work with.  I use this coconut oil to make chocolate bark, in my coffee, for my hair, and on our skin as a lotion.  I am very happy with the scent and quality. Will continue to buy this brand. I've tried 2 other brands that were not only more expensive but just did not have the scent or quality of this brand.  And one of the best parts of Nutiva is that you can have it sent free of shipping charge with the super saver shipping!!!
Raw, cold-pressed, sealed from the factory. Good deal. Good delivery. I store mine in the refrigerator (even though they say you don't need to). Been using it for all of my cooking.

Summary: Coconut oil at a great price
Text: I have been using coconut oil as a substitute for butter and vegetable oils for the past few years.  I had never tried Nutiva but I saw it offered in convenient 15 ounce tubs which I prefer due to using it just a few times a week.

I have compared many prices of the coconut oil and spent many hours reading reviews of various types/brands.  This one seemed to have many wonderful reviews and hardly any bad ones so I thought I'd try it.  The process used to produce this product keeps it as close to the real thing as possible. Although it seems to be unwise to purchase them in a small container, it actually adds up to less per oz than purchasing the larger ones.  It is excellent on popcorn and once you try it you will never stop using it as the health benefits are awesome.  I also use this on my face as a moisturizer for my face and hair.  It's healthy inside and out...I suggest getting this right away and incorporating it in your diet today!!!!

I have psoriasis of the scalp and this product works beautifully at moisturizing my hair. It barely has a taste and it doesn't irritate the skin. I have used it on my hair and face without problem. Haven't tried it for cooking but i may take the leap since I have a two pack. Its worth the price for the quality of the product.

this is simply the best alternative to butter ever!!! I use it when i bake, and the aroma is so nice~~~

I've ordered multiple times, and my only gripe is sometimes amazon doesnt do a great job packing it and a container may get cracked, but they are the best when it comes to returns so no problem!!!

MUST BUY! if looking for coconut oil!
Looking forward to cooking with this as well. Really seems smooth and pure white as advertised. Really pleased with this one.
I friend of mine told me at this organic extra virgin coconut oil and I absolutely LOOOOVE it!!! Its amazing to cook with!!!
This product is great for skin and hair...I use it in a shea butter mixture and absolutely love the way my skin and hair feels.

This is my first introduction to extra virgin coconut oil.  I find it to be every bit as good as other folks have said it is here.  Even spreading a little bit on an English muffin tastes good.  It does have a mild, but very good flavor.  I use it to cook eggs.

This item has many many ways to improve your way of life and I am so happy that I purchased this item. It helps when cooking and has even helped my son's wart come off his wrist when his doctor wouldn't do anything. Thank you so much!!!! This item is great!!!

I have never used coconut oil before and wasn't sure what to expect but this is a great product. I've used it in a lot of recipes. The taste bakes out of most baked goods although it does have a slight coconut-y taste in some some foods. I like it!

I had heard about the wonders of coconut oil not only for cooking but also as body lotion, conditioner, hair gel, and intimate lube. I've been using this for a couple of weeks now and love it! It has a nice, mild coconut smell and works very well for all of the above, though I haven't cooked with it yet. It's solid at room temperature, but melts when you warm it in your hands. I'm glad to use this instead of other products with artificially manufactured chemicals and preservatives in them. I'm very satisfied and plan to use this long term.
I live abroad most of the year, but found this product when back in the States.  It smells great, tastes great, the price was great, and the ingredients are all natural

Summary: Coconut Oil is great addition to your healthy lifestyle
Text: Coconut oil has many, many uses.  This Nutiva product is great; price is best I've found anywhere for its quality.  Size of jar perfect to give to someone you want to introduce its benefits to.  I LOVE coconut oil; look it up on Internet for extensive uses/suggestions/benefits.

I'm not writing to say this is not a good product. It unfortunately did not agree with me or my daughter. I have tried several brands, this one gave me and my daughter strong stomach cramps and diarrhea. Despite the early onset of this I kept using it hoping it would eventually stop. We had to finally stop and use another. We are both in good health and eat well. Even though the issues with this brand ceased after not using it, we still have a vague sick feeling all over much of the day. We are both disappointed because we are juicers and loved the idea of adding this to our daily regimen. We have been using coconut oil for a couple months....thinking this would be ample time for our bodies to become adjusted. We also never exceeded 3 tbls in a day. Bottom line, we believe this is a great product, just not for us and feel left out from all the wonderful benefits of coconut oil. However, we do continue to use it on our hair and skin.

I brought this EVCO to use as a part of my hair regimen. I havent cooked with it or used it on my skin. It moisturizes my hair very well, i use it as a daily moisturizer, i have created an oil mix with Jamaican Black Castor oil and Peppermint oil, and i also use it as a pre-poo. It has helped with growth. this will be a staple product for me.
I can't believe I've taken so long to jump on the coconut oil bandwagon. This stuff tastes AMAZING. Great for high heat frying and adds a wonderful dimension of flavor to anything you cook wit it.
I've only cooked with coconut oil a few time.  But I like that it a very light oil and give off a great coconut aroma.  There's nothing that you can not do with respect to pan frying or stir frying.
This product is very good. Not only smells good but you do not have to use very much of it. A good buy.
I love this product, I have been using it topically for my dry skin and it works wonders, I am sure it tastes amazing in food also!

This is an awesome and distinctive product. It provides a very different and delicate flavor to you saute'd vegetables. My family absolutely loves it. You don't need very much and it doesn't burn like butter. Try it! Go half and half or go all the way. It is very versaltile.

I have been using it for three months. It's perfect for cooking! A special aroma of coconut arises while cooking. The nutrition value can't be stressed more. Also no toxic substance produced when heated. Once you start to use it, you'll not want cheap vegetable oil anymore. .

tastes good. i mostly use as body moisturizer - and its easier to use if transfered to a different container (my fav is wide mouth glass Ball jars), the smell is nutty and not too sweet - i enjoy the smell.

light flavor, strong aroma

I love this coconut oil. It adds a great coconut flavor to baked goods. I love the coconut smell when I use it as lotion or hair conditioner. Tastes good and so healthy for you too! Good bargain when you get free shipping through Amazon.

I use this product to moisturize my natural, 4c textured hair. It makes my hair soft and manageable. Plus, the light coconut scent smells good in my hair. I haven't used for cooking yet, but I plan to.
I use it in my smoothies, oatmeal, and saute chicken & veges in it.  It has such a light flavor; it is yummy!

Summary: Nutiva Organic - great for dry hair
Text: I found a suggestion for this product in a beauty magazine and since I have VERY dry hair, I decided to give it a go.  I use the coconut oil as a leave-in conditioner for my dry ends.  My hair feels softer and I have received many compliments on it since I started using the product.  I also use it as a lip balm.

This is a fabulous coconut oil.  It smells divine.  I use it as a skin moisturizer, and in cooking.  I will definitely stick with purchasing this brand from Amazon, since the price is good and the quality is great.

This was my first time purchasing this oil. I loved the smell of it and I really enjoyed cooking with it. I just wish that I could buy this product in a larger quantity for the same price per ounce and I can with the 2 pack so I don't have so many empty containers.
I was surprised how much I like this product and coconut oil in general. I use it in place of butter and oil for everything.
Wonderful product, convenient size, and delicious.  Buy a twin pack and share with a friend.  Coconut oil is so good for the body.  Melts quickly, wonderful stir-fry flavoring.

I was very happy when I found I could get two tubs for a small price! A really great deal. (: I haven't had a chance to cook anything in the oil because I'm at school but I bring it with me to the university caf. and always have it on toast. It's pretty good and melts very quickly. I would love to prepare some sort of tofu stir-fry with coconut oil. I love the way the oil tastes, very clean, much better than butter.

Great in food, great moisturizer!!!!

When cooking, you may get a slight hint of coconut in the food but I love it, coconut shrimp :)

It is also a wonderful moisturizer.

i have tried a few different coconut oils.  i tried this one after a friend recommended it to me.  It is my families favorite.  i love to bake with it.  it has a sweet taste. i make things like cookies, granola, coffee cake, and graham crackers with this.  it has a similar consistency to shortening.  It is hard when cold, and melts easily when heated.

This was my first experience with coconut oil. So far, I have used it to make homemade flour tortillas and to replace the oil in my granola recipe. It has a light coconut flavor that my family has really enjoyed.
I love this product. The smell, the texture, the benefits. I use it for hair and skin best oil I have found that is pure enough for my children's skin and hair.

Summary: yummy asa butter or oil replacement
Text: This product is so yummy in pancakes or as a replacement for any butter or oil you use (maybe not in salads though because it gets solid at about 78 degrees F). I've been very happy with it for cooking. I actually bought it as a moisturizer, but decided it smells not so tasty after a few hours because it reacts to the oils on my baby's skin. Buy it to eat.

Summary: Convenient size containers of coconut oil
Text: We have purchased organic extra virgin coconut oil before in a five gallon tub, which was a large expense and challenging to work with.  We have found these 15-ounce tubs to be very much easier to work with, and the quality is good as well!

Summary: Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil
Text: Great product with consistent quality all the time.  This brand has wonderful flavor.  It's addition to a green smoothie gives you an added flavor and the little added fat you need nutritionally. The pack of 2 is an added bonus and well worth the purchase price.

I have been using this product for several months now, and am really pleased with it.  It smells very much of coconut when first opening it, but it does not flavor the food much if any - perhaps just the faintest hint of coconut.  I use it in place of olive oil as this has a higher smoking point than olive oil and so it does well when using higher heat.  I bake with it, roast red peppers, use it for sauteing veggies, anything that one would regularly use olive or canola oil for.  My only complaint is that the jars though sealed, always arrive greasy, surely a better packaging system can be used...this is why I gave it four stars instead of five.
I absolutely love this coconut oil.  Great product.  We use it as a replacement for butter in rolls.  We also use it as a spread on toast.

The coconut oil has the most amazing fragrance and consistency. I use it as a moisturizer and also in cooking. It tastes awesome with oatmeal and mixed with flaxseeds and I can't wait to try it when I'm cooking chicken coconut curry in the very new future.
Perfect for hair and skin (not so sure about cooking)! It smells great but not too strong.

Great speed! Got here exactly when promised, but the coconut oil seemed to have leaked maybe due to altitude pressure (?). Nevertheless, they had it bagged, so the box wasn't all oily. I just had to wash the containers with soap and water. Really good coconut oil though!

I have tried other brands, but this is the best tasting coconut oil on the market!  I use it anything from stir fries, to chicken dishes.  I also use it in oatmeal instead of butter.  It makes cakes,cookies brownies, etc.. taste better when greasing the pans before baking.  Do your research on coconut oil.  You will discover something good and healthy to add to your diet.  This is one of the good fats that are being recommended by doctors.  It is worth the price.

Lovely coconut oil. I bought the pack of two 15 ounce jars, one for cooking and one for the cat's food, my own body, and my hair, and it's just heavenly. It smells brilliant on, but the smell fades after awhile so it doesn't totally overpower you and everything around you, my cat likes it so much that he licks it off my legs--he needs a bit of extra fat since the raw meat you get at the grocery is generally lean--and my incredibly picky boyfriend tried some teriyaki pork I sautéed in coconut butter and he loved it--huge surprise, since I was ready to go overboard apologizing to him for the coconut flavor. I've made raw truffles with this, carob powder, almond extract, agave, and crushed almonds, and they turned out so yummy that SAD eaters loved them. But--warning!--if you live in the South, and especially in the summer, be really, really careful peeling the protective bit of plastic on the top off! Mine is permanently liquid, but especially so when it sat outside in a box waiting for me to come home.

Another bit of advice: buy the 54 ounces; it's a better buy, and you'll use it!

To whoever hated the plastic jars: yeah, you're right, but I'd still buy this coconut oil again. No, plastic isn't ideal, but I just transfer the oil to my old glass olive oil bottles and add one of the metal dispensers on the top--easy to use and it's glass.

The oil itself is wonderful. It has only a subtle coconut scent, which is excellent for low-heat cooking. Although it is recommended for slightly higher heat, the risk of burning the oil is high, yielding an awful synthetic taste and smell.

I use coconut oil in my raw vegan desserts. Unfortunately, I live in Florida, which means that the coconut oil itself is always in a liquid state when kept at room temperature. Be forewarned that in the warmer months, you will have a liquid oil, since it "melts" at 73 degrees Fahrenheit (23 C). If I make a raw cheesecake, it needs to be refrigerated immediately and cannot sit on the counter for very long, But it still does an excellent job! It is also great for the hair and skin; I keep a separate bottle in the bathroom for such uses. I have sensitive skin that is prone to breaking out, and the gentle moisturizing properties of the coconut oil do not irritate my skin or pores at all.

The only problem I had with this product, after months of receiving it, was that it was shipped to me once with an open lid. When I received the box, it was coated in oil with a sticker from the post office that it had been received damaged by them (the postal carrier would not even carry it up for me), and damaged a box of books I had shipped separately. However, Amazon was very quick to rectify the issue.

A few other reviewers have complained that the oil "sweats" and no matter what they do, the outside of the jar becomes oily. I've been through about 6 bottles of oil over the years and have only had this problem when I didn't wipe the bottle off after use. Scoop the oil out with a spoon (don't pour it from the bottle!) and you won't have a problem.

Summary: Worth the money and so great for everything!
Text:
I tried some cooking with this but my kids didn't care for it, but just because the cooking thing didn't work out I surely did not throw this away! This is by far the best coconut oil I have been able to find and cooking is the very least important thing on my list!

Our 3 year old son suffers from Eczema and this stuff is like a wonder oil!! I cover him from head to toe when he gets out of the bath. He smells lovely and it keeps his Eczema under control much better than any other (including perscription) lotions and meds ever have!!! That is a reason to have it forever right there.

I use it for shaving my legs! It is amazing for this. I apply it to my legs before I get in the shower, get in, shave them and ohhh la la! No razor burn, no bumps, and oh so soft! It works so wonderful.
I also use it as hand cream when my hands are dry, eye makeup remover, and lip balm.

There are so many uses! I highly recommend this product to everyone!!!

I bought this product a couple weeks ago and wanted to provide some feedback on my usage of the extra virgin coconut oil.  I am a brown-skinned lovely and I have used this product on my naturally loc'd hair, my skin as well as use as a health supplement.  My hair & skin have more sheen and luster and is much softer overall. I also use this coconut oil in my green tea and it is decadent!  I love this product and will absolutely buy again.  Give it a try and you will not be disappointed.

My doctor recommended using coconut oil for cooking. He said it's better than olive oil at high temperatures and it's good for you.
I couldn't find coconut oil anywhere, but purchased on Amazon and this particular one based on the reviews.
It does smell good. It's very easy to use in cooking. I have used it mostly for scrambled eggs so far. It melts easily and doesn't taste like coconut eggs!

This product is awesome.  It has a wonderful taste and gives baked goods a tender texture.  It remains solid at room temperature, so I scrape what I want out of the jar into a plastic container, then microwave it for 30 seconds and pour it into my batter.  It will lend a slight coconut flavor to baked items, which works with just about any kind of muffin, cookie, or bread.  It looks promising as a skin moisturizer, as well, though I haven't yet tried it for that purpose.  Smaller jars in the grocery store are quite expensive, so buying it from Amazon in the larger jars is more economical.

A little disappointed that this quality product came in a cheap, plastic container. Do the words leaching, BPA, wasteland, etc. come to mind? Nonetheless, I'm still happy with my purchase. I may continue to purchase these. I just hope this container is recyclable.

I've cooked with coconut oil for a while but I've recently started using it on my skin. I was using another brand of coconut oil and a friend gave me a jar of Nutvia organic coconut oil. The effect it has has on my skin is amazing! I'm over 50 but I'm frequently told how good my skin looks and the skin on my body is so soft and smooth! I use it from head to toe and it has replaced all other moisturizers for me. No more expensive face creams or body lotions! I enjoy the light scent of coconut and I still cook with it as well. I love this product

Summary: Wonderful Product - So Many Benefits - Tastes GREAT
Text:
Just a note to my existing review below. There was a piece of day old Rosemary Bread on the counter. I remembered so many people saying this tastes good on bread so I decided to try it. I admit I stood my the garbage pail because I was expecting to throw the piece of bread with coconut oil spread on it away. I love this stuff but didn't think I'd go so far as to eat it straight out of the jar. Wow. It had a nice smooth buttery taste. Ate it all. By the way, Subscribe and Save is the way to go. Doing it for a year now. Very satisified with the service.

Besides the cooking benefits of coconut oil I've discovered other benefits that make this a must have in my house. For more years than I can remember I had a wart on one of my fingers. It would come and go but finally got to the point that when it flaired up it would split, bleed, and get infected. It was getting very hard to keep under control so had decided that I would finally have to go to a specialist and have it removed. The last time I had an episode with it I decided to try one last thing...coconut oil. I had read coconut oil had anti-bacterial and anti-viral properties. Within 2 days the infection had started to clear up. In less than 10 days the wart had shrunk to practically nothing. It's been months now. I use coconut oil on my hands every day...several times a day and haven't had a single new flair up. After dealing with this for more than 15 years, I can barely feel where the wart was. I've used coconut oil on burns, cold sores, and callused feet (smooth as can be now). It's also wonderful for keeping my gray hair very soft and manageable. I had read an article about "oil pulling" and tryed it with coconut oil. I won't go into that here. Just go to Bing or EHow and check it out. It has really improved my oral health. The articles I read suggested oil pulling with sesame oil but I used coconut oil because of it's anti-bacterial qualities. This is a product I wouldn't be without now.
I love using coconut oil in smoothies, baking, and cooking. It is healthy fat and this brand is delicious and high quality.

I read the reviews before ordering this product and agreed this would be a better product than the one bought in a health food store earlier. I was surprised at the improvement over the one I just finished. It has very little odor and the taste is smooth. Highly recommend this product.

This product works very well, especially when frying foods. It does not saturate whatever you are frying and does not have that greasy, oily, taste. It is nice knowing I am using something healthy too, as there is no animal fat in this product. It actually has a good taste and therefor enhances the flavor of things like, cookies, cakes, and pies. I highly recommend it!
Wonderful product! Has a mild coconut flavor and is wonderful in baked goods as well as a substitute for other oils in recipes.  Will definitely purchase again.
Love this product!. I used it instead of butter in some cookies and they tasted amazing!. Great deal!

Summary: I can't eat popcorn without it anymore
Text: I use this for popping popcorn. It adds a great little flavor to it. WAY better than corn oil. I just add a little salt. I tried using it as a rub as well. It is one of the best rubs I've ever made. I had to heat the mixture 1st though because the oil gets hard when cooled. It's tough to work with in the beginning, but it's worth it!
I really like this. I used it to fry chicken in, fry my green beans in and for other stuff too. It smells so wonderful, like a tropical oasis, and this is a really great deal.
We use this oil for cooking, baking, and even just spreading on some toast.  It is a great product with a great taste. Will never buy anything else!
This coconut oil is fantastic - high quality, and it smells really great.  Amazon had the best prices for anything similar, and we will definitely get this again.

Definitely the best coconut oil I've found. Light, pleasant smell and great taste! Absorbs into the skin immediately without leaving a greasy residue. Try this mixed with raw shea butter-best moisturizer ever!
I don't use much oil at home, so when I do it has to be packed nutritionally. I did some research before I decided to buy this. This is so healthy. It's totally yummy, too!

Love this! Cooked carrots and celery with just a dab of this oil and it was delicious! Nice light coconut taste - plus great health benefits. Also use it all over my toddlers body. He has eczema and in two days (after putting the oil on in the eve after a shower) his skin was silky smooth. The price is great too (2 for $12) - get this you will NOT regret it.

I am a avid user of the WF Extra Virgin Organic Coconut Oil. Based on the reviews, I decided to try this particular brand of coconut oil and I'm in love. I use it as pre-poo (Pre-conditioning treatment) for my hair,  and to bake and cook. Since I use scented oils as a fragrance, I pour a lil of the scented oil in a hand full of coconut oil and moisture my whole body. It has a light coconut scent which doesn't overpower the food or the fragrance I use with it. There is no staining on your clothes. My boyfriend even uses it daily and it has minimized the blemises on his acne-proned skin. Amazon offers the best price for the quantity.  This is the best yet!
Great stuff, and much more healthy than the cheap polyunsaturated vegetable oils at your grocery store.  I only use olive oil and coconut oil now on the advice of my nutritionist.

Summary: Excellent quality oil at a great price!
Text: I decided to order this oil because so far I've had positive experiences with several other Nutiva products. I was grateful that it arrived so quickly because we had run out.  Thank you Amazon for your fast shipping! Well, I used it recently and I am very pleased for the quality of oil I purchased versus the price. I was disappointed that it comes in a plastic jar, but so do numerous things we buy these days. Besides you can always transfer your oil to glass jars if you like as well.  I would definitely order this item again from Amazon because it is a great price for the quantity that you receive.

Although I like the product, one of the tubs was almost 6 months past the use by date. I certainly did not like the fact that an oil product was old. I would not order this from Amazon again and I would reconsider any food purchases as quality control obviously is not the best.

This coconut oil is excellent!  We have been using raw coconut oil for about 3 months now and I think they are right!  It may have cholesterol in it, but it must have other properties that are more beneficial, because my husband's cholesterol levels are in check for the first time in 10 years!  This brand of raw coconut oil is a very good one and we enjoy it a lot - it smells faintly of coconut, but it doesn't have a strong coconut flavor... we use it for frying eggs, in sautes, stir fry, even as a butter replacement on toast with raw honey (yum!)  The only reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is that the containers had oil on the outside, which I was able to clean off fairly easy, but it was kind of a mess.

Just got this brand for the first time. I gave been using the "Lou-Ana" brand from
a local store that is refined. From my understanding, Organic Extra Virgin Coconut
oil has a more cocount taste, smell and more nutritious. From what I see, there's
no difference in taste and smell. Is this the real Extra Virgin or is it refined
coconut oil?
WE LOVE COCONUT OIL.  THIS ONE FROM NUTIVA IS GREAT.  WELL WORTH THE PRICE.  mY HUSBAND LIKES COOKING WITH IT.

When I was thinking about adopting a little rescue dog, I was told the dog was very under weight. But they had started using a little extra virgin coconut oil on her food and she liked it. Then they sent me a link to an article on how coconut oil can be used with pets. I was so intrigued, I looked up more articles and saw how it can be used in a variety of ways with people.

I ended up getting the dog - and the coconut oil. It appeared that the "organic, extra virgin" was the best choice. I bought 2 jars and have been using it successfully in these ways:

A few drops on my rescue's dry food, and she loves it
Use it to make popcorn and it really does taste like theater popcorn
I use it on my dry hands , body and even my face - of course I am prepared to get a lot of licks from my rescue
Put it on my grandson's diaper rash - it cleared it up better than diaper rash ointment
I have put it on my own bruises and scrapes, hard to tell if it works better than anything else, but I like that it is natural

I know there are many other uses for it, like using it on your hair, and I am going to keep researching. I am so happy with this particular coconut oil that I signed up for the subscription services. It is worth a try!

I HAVE SEARCHED EVERY WHERE FOR THIS PRODUCT & FINALLY FOUND IT AT AMAZON.  FROM WHAT I HAVE LEARNED, THIS PRODUCT IS SO USEFUL AND ABLE TO TREAT SO MANY DIFFERENT ISSUES.  I AM COOKING WITH IT & USING IT ON MY ECZEMA RASH ON MY ARMS.  GREAT PRODUCT.  I THANK YOU, AMAZON FOR SUPPLYING ME WITH THIS GREAT PRODUCT.
Love this coconut oil - such a great deal for such an awesome product!  Definitely worth the purchase.  So much better than any other cooking oil out there!

Coconut oil is the best thing ever. I have an ugly scar on my arm from a burn and I have been using coconut oil on it for only a few weeks and it has started to fade already. I love it. I can't wait to see what the benefits are in the long run, I am going to use this for the rest of my life!

Summary: I can make excellent dark chocolate bars out of this oil!!!
Text:
This Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is not only beneficial but it is also very tasty. I got this 15oz tubs (pack of 2) for $12.97 with free shipping through Amazon's subscription service and special offer. This is probably the reason why Amazon's supply of this 15oz tubs (pack of 2) oil is gone and is now only available through 3rd party suppliers. The special offer increased the demand more and depleted Amazon's supply in short amount of time.

I use this oil to make honey-sweetened raw dark chocolate bars...

Coconut oil (extra-virgin organic) has become the only oil I will use for cooking. It gives food a tropical kick of flavor & aroma, but not overpoweringly so. Nutiva is a major brand you can trust, though I've tried & used other brands from local healthfood stores as well. It annoys me that some books & health professionals still knock coconut oil as a fat to avoid on the premise that it's a naturally saturated fat, when in fact it's a tremendously healthy product. Don't believe the nay-sayers.

Summary: Great product, but the package not good, all wet, leaking all over...
Text:
The quality of this product is very good, but the plastic bottles were not tightly closed. When I received my Nutiva Coconut Oil, the bottles were packed lying on their sides soaking wet all over. About 1/3 of each bottle were leaking out. I bought other brand ,like Tropical Tradition,and received it all dry no leaking problem.
My advice is : When putting the bottles in the box, please don't lay the bottles on their sides. Let the bottles stand up, that will help the leaking problem, because coconut oil melt below 72 degree. Thanks for letting me write the review.

I love it!  It definitely smells like coconut, and has a SLIGHT flavor of coconut, so if you are looking for something that has no smell or taste, this is not it.  It's a great product, perfect consistency, I love it.

This is such a great and healthy item!  My kids LOVE this on warmed or toasted home made banana bread.  Wonderful compliment!  Also, I researched and Amazon sells this for the most reasonable price.  This is a better deal than our local Natural Foods Store.

I got this to stave of Alzheimer's (which I hope I do not have). In any case, it is really yummy- I made cookies with it, and the flavor is wonderful!  I will be buying more! It is solid at normal room temperature but gets a bit oily when the temperature rises (we live in Florida).

I have been exposed to coconut oil for several years and no product matches this in terms of quality and purity. It's great both for edible as well as topical use. The benefits of EVCO are well known so I won't belabor the point. This is a "must-try" for any health (and perhaps beauty) conscious person.

THIS THE BEST OIL YOU CAN BUY
I RECOMEND READ THE BOOK THE COCONUT OIL MIRACLE

Summary: Recommanded it to my hair salon customers.

I have tried several coconut oils and Nutiva is wonderful. I use it as a moisturizer, on my kids for any kind of skin rash; dry skin and also to cook with. It has numerous uses; too many to list.
Coconut oil is I believe after much research the superior cooking oil.  Organic cold-pressed is the best form of it, and I find Nutiva is the best brand.  There is definitely a difference.

Summary: Not as Healthy as I had Hoped
Text:
I wrote a review of this product detailing my own experience with this product and coconut oil in general. It generated a good discussion spanning 97 comments, however it was not very concise and I wished I had made my points more clearly. This is a rewrite of my initial review.

I purchased this product because I had heard stories in the popular media about how coconut oil contains a healthy form of saturated fat. I welcomed this news because coconut oil is a fun ingredient. It has a high smoke point, a great taste, and does not go rancid.

As a chemist, the hypothesis for why it may be healthier made sense to me. Coconut oil contains medium chain saturated fats, which differ from the long chain saturated fats found in red meat. I studied lipid transport during my PhD and I think it is totally possible the body does different things with these two different chemicals.

However it is also totally possible that the two types of saturated fat both increase one's risk of cardiovascular disease. To figure this out, I looked through the literature and spoke with people to see what proof there was.

What I found was that the arguments that suggest medium chain saturated fats are health appeared flawed to me. Here are the arguments I have heard:

Some people reference studies of island dwelling-people who eat diets rich in coconut fats. These people have low rates of heart disease. The problems with these studies are significant. First, these people often die earlier than Westerners, and that is why they have lower cardiovascular disease. They have lower rates of Alzheimer's disease too. This is because of the second, larger problem: there are MANY things about the life of an island-dwelling person that is different than that of a Westerner. Maybe the diet is the cause of an observed effect, maybe it is the increased exercise or different sleep pattern. You just can't draw conclusions when so many variables have changed. Islanders are just too different to use as a model.

Some people trust books written about the subject like "The Coconut Oil Miracle" or "The Healing Miracle of Coconut Oil". The problem with these books is that they are books, not studies. To prove something, you have to perform a study. To make their arguments, they often cite studies, but the studies are like the one above, typically flawed. There isn't a paper published that shows medium chain saturated fats do not increase the risk of cardiovascular disease the way saturated fats do.

There have also been citations from doctors such as Dr. Mercola. It is best to take advice from leaders in the field, rather than doctors trying to sell a book or treatement. Specifically Dr. Mercola has been admonished by the FDA for making misleading claims: [...] Be careful who you trust.

Ultimately, there is no evidence that medium chain saturated fats have different health effects than saturated fats. The most convincing argument in favor of coconut oil is that saturated fats themselves are not dangerous. There is controversy on this subject (just like with most medical subjects) but the vast majority of the data supports the idea that saturated fat increases your risk of cardiovascular disease. To support this, here are some sources.

1) Harvard University School of Public Health published this easy guide to fats and cholesterol:
[...]
Here they recommend that you should not decrease fat intake overall, just replace saturated fats with unsaturated, the less saturated the better.
2) The most convincing paper on this subject says this:
"Based on consistent evidence from human studies, replacing saturated fat with polyunsaturated fat modestly lowers coronary heart disease risk, with ~10% risk reduction for a 5% energy substitution; whereas replacing saturated fat with carbohydrate has no benefit and replacing saturated fat with monounsaturated fat has uncertain effects. "
To restate this, if you replace saturated fat with polysaturated fat, you will reduce your risk of heard disease. The authors say a 10% risk reduction is modest, but consider that you are most likely to die for a heart attack so a 10% risk reduction is quite welcome in my opinion.
Further research has shown "The meta-analysis of the trials showed that increasing polyunsaturated fat consumption as a replacement for saturated fat reduced the risk of coronary heart disease events by 19%." That is a huge effect.
Citation is here:
Lipids. 2010 Oct;45(10):893-905. Epub 2010 Mar 31.
Saturated fat and cardiometabolic risk factors, coronary heart disease, stroke, and diabetes: a fresh look at the evidence.
Micha R, Mozaffarian D.
Department of Epidemiology, Harvard School of Public Health, Boston, MA 02115, USA.
3) Finally here is a list of all the studies done on the subject, what you will find is that, while the topic is controversial, it is not a 50/50 toss-up. The majority of studies find saturated fat to increase the risk of cardiovascular disease.
[...]

To summarize what I learned from these conversations and articles, I now know that there is no proof that medium chain saturated fats behave differently than long chain saturated fats, and I know saturated fats likely increase your risk of cardiovascular disease as much as 19%.

I decided to take the more conservative path and I sold the coconut oil I bought, hopefully to someone who plans on using it in some other way besides eating it. I hope to realize the health benefits associated with replacing saturated fats in my diet with polyunsaturated fats.

Summary: Alive, Ageless, Gourmet and Gathering Years
Text:
Length:: 9:15 Mins

Some say the COCONUT palm is the Tree of Life. They say Life is honored and perpetuated through its meat, its water, its oil, its presence. Purchased from Swanson, my favorite purveyor of health products, this coconut oil is one of the highest qualities of life healing offerings available from this sacred gift of a tree. I had sensed this cold pressed oil's uncanny value as soon as I saw a picture of the jar on Swanson's product list on Amazon. I had come to trust this company [as much as I continue to trust Amazon] from purchases of several types of magnesium supplements including Magnesium Oil 8 fl oz (237 ml) Spray. From reading Bruce Fife's The Coconut Oil Miracle I clarified my belief in the healing nutrition in coconut oil and in this brand's production purity. My experience of using this product for only 24 hours had shown results which have made me feel blessed... finally!

I've been slowly and steadily rectifying a serious magnesium deficiency while searching for what felt like a missing catalyst or synergistic essence which would cause magnesium supplementation to be accepted by the body, and then ultimately seated into the cellular level of life enhancing operations. Dr. Carolyn Dean's book, The Magnesium Miracle is an excellent guide to Magnesium's magic in healing, normalizing, and strengthening the embodied human soul. I've been thinking that coconut, in its several forms of use, can work as magnesium's ultimate catalyst. What a team!!

To understand the vital message in what I'm trying to say here, please be cajoled or even coerced (jokingly) into reading some of my reviews on magnesium products along with the two books linked above... as a start on a journey to understanding, appreciating, and relishing LIFE. Other great books and products of Magnesium and Coconut are available on Amazon, found easily using the search capacity.

According to experts, the most important thing to know about oils and coconut products is that they should be gently, minimally, and carefully processed by cold pressing, preferably labeled ANH (absolutely no heat used in processing); the reasons for this are detailed clearly in Fife's book.

Also according to experts, the most important thing to know about magnesium is that it needs to be held in highest priority and percentage in the minerals taken into the body, and that certain foods and additives defeat bio-availability of magnesium. Especially calcium needs to be taken in much lower amounts than Mg, and in current food market and habits is usually supplied in quantities much too large, causing many illnesses related to calcification or deposits, and contributing to magnesium deficiency. This is clearly detailed in Dr. Dean's book.

My main concern with coconut usage for persons severely deficient in magnesium [like I am] is that in its current state that fruit holds more potassium than magnesium, which could upset the balance and primary necessity of magnesium. In my non-professional opinion magnesium is the INDEX nutritional substance; the A-Priori for Life. Maybe even the Tree of Life needs magnesium as its priority nutrient. With adequate magnesium held within the cell structures... [some books say cells need to retain 10,000 times more magnesium than any other mineral]... the body can adequately and correctly utilize other minerals and necessary foods, in order to live strong and disease free. [More details on this in my review of Bruce Fife's book hyperlinked above.]

Magnesium seats life, coconut's the cozy catalyst, taste buds rule!

Linda Shelnutt

Other excellent coconut oils available on Amazon:

EFAGold Coconut Oil, Extra Virgin, Organic, 16 oz.
[The link above goes to a brand which has the most fantastic taste and quality of any coconut oil I've used.]

Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 54-Ounce Jar
[The link above goes to the large size, the one I showed in my review on Bruce Fife's book]

I am a Big fan of coconut Oil. This is great tasting Coconut Oil. Does not have a strong flavor of coconut, it is very light. I use it in everything. My husband doesn't like coconut and he likes this.

Summary: Excellent book - very interesting and thorough. Highly recommend!
Text: Just read a book on how amazing this is by Bruce Fife and now we are implementing it into our lives. This oil is really nice! Tastes really good and not too strong.  Great product. Very happy with it and will buy it again.

Summary: Great for cooking AND oil pulling!
Text: This coconut oil is even better than I expected! Very smooth and nice, with a beautiful, light taste you can detect in the food you cook it with (I love using it to "pan-fry" the rice I cook it with first). Oil pulling with it is a real blast - it melts in your mouth and feels so clean afterwards. It's cold-pressed and organic - you can taste and see the purity! I love this stuff!

I love this deal from Amazon subscription! Coconut oil is one of the healthiest oils to use/cook with. The price is very reasonable and i love that it has become easy to switch to this healthier cooking choice. It smells coconutty, but there is no coconut flavor in your cooked foods. Yay for not having to pick something else up from the grocery store! I could get used to all grocery items being delivered at such great prices.

High caloric dietary supplement that works great either taken by the spoonful or incorporated into dishes.  This complemented vegetable stir fry very well, imparting an almost curry like flavor.  Excellent and would highly recommend!

This is the highest quality of coconut oil on the market and the price can't be beat.  Coconut oil is a high heat oil so it won't burn your food like lower heat oils. Use freely for sauteing, frying and anywhere the coconut flavor is a plus. It's not overwhelming in flavor, just subtle. I've used it to deep fry battered fish and yum, so tasty. Also use it to make popcorn. Your popcorn won't burn and you'll get a really nice flavor. And, of course, you can use it on your skin, hair, etc. There are many benefits to coconut oil.
I've tried several coconut oils and this one is my favorite.  The coconut smell and taste is wonderful.  Very good price on Amazon.

We found this product good, but it does have a slight flavor and aroma of coconut which we have not found in another product we purchased.  There are some uses where I would prefer not to have that but others where it adds value.

This oil has a smooth feel and a strong coconut scent and flavor. I use it for cooking and also for hair and body. It's a very good replacement for hand/ body lotion, it works really well in cold/dry climates. It has a much better texture and flavor than Spectrum. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it's packaged in plastic - I much prefer glass.

I have purchased coconut oil in the past and have HATED it.  It has invariably been bad-tasting. I read that when coconut oil goes bad, it can leave a soapy aftertaste.  When I saw this product, I thought, okay, I'll give it ONE MORE TRY.  When the oil arrived, I checked the packed on/use by date and saw that the product was quite recently packed and should have a long shelf life.  I've used about half a jar now and am amazed at the difference!  This stuff is GREAT!  I use it several times a week and the food comes out delicious, and no nasty after-taste!

I got this to use on my hair. And so far it has made my hair really soft :)
And this oil smells amazing!

The oil was stiff when i first opened the bottle, however you can warm it up between your hands or even put some in a cup and warm it in the microwave.

I have also used it to bake a cake with and it turned out better then usual, and since the only difference is me including this oil. I must say this oil makes all the difference.

This stuff is awesome ! I guess the main use is for cooking but I heard it was great for your hair and scalp , and that info was very accurate. I have a problem with dry scalp , and using this stuff after showing really helps my scalp and hair look great. Also , it smells really good !
A very good product. The entire family uses and likes this product. Very well satisfied

You know I would have given this item 5 stars except for the fact that when my package arrived, one of the bottles was opened. The coconut oil is very easily turned into a liquid, and because of this, my package was all slippery and slimy. Now I should have returned it but I was too lazy to return so I kept it. The bottle that was not opened was fine and was exactly what I wanted. So besides one of my coconut oil bottles being opened and leaking a little which lead to me throwing it away, all else was fine.

I got this because I had read on another website that this product was great for using in place of butter and for skin care. Well, I don't like using it in place of butter. It is very tasty with no phony aftertaste or anything. I have used it when making certain things on the stove where I would use butter. Mostly I use it for items that are on the sweeter side. It's very good on toast too. Almost like having dessert!

In the winter, I get very dry elbows. I have one of the jars in my bedroom so I can just apply to my skin whenever I want. It's not greasy which surprised me. I thought it would be everywhere. It soaks right into your skin. In the reviews on QVC (I believe), there are women using this exact product on their face. That's just not my thing. I think the sweetness of the smell would bother my nose due to sensitivities to smells. Anyway, it fixes my elbows up with a couple of days; I only apply it in the morning and at bedtime. I also use it on my arms & legs whenever they seem to be getting a little dry. Wonderful product!!

I love this product. My mom is in a nursing home, and I think I may have gotten scabies there. Anyway, I had quite a rash, and did not know at the time this was it. I tried medicated powders, diaper rash cream - thinking it may be heat rash. One night the itch was so bad, I decided to put coconut oil on it. Wow- the itch stopped and I slept through the night. Since then, two relatives came down with scabies. They went the chemical route via their doctor. I never did. As I researched this I think one of the reasons coconut oil works for me is that the oil smothers the little critters. Instead of chemically killing them, I am drowning them in coconut oil. Plus so what if the oil gets into my blood stream! My rashes healed, my skin is soft. Now the scabies take a while to leave your body, but I just kept a small container of coconut oil and if I feel an itch, I apply it there. I also read that if you put TEA TREE Oil or Clove oil ( a few drops) and use coconut oil as a carrier it may really kill scabies. So I am using a bit of Tea Tree Oil just in case, but I feel I was being cured just by using the coconut oil.
I gave it four stars because of the plastic container. However, I read this plastic is the safe kind. BUt it still makes me a bit concerned.....

This is some very good extra virgin olive oil. I am very impressed. I am really liking the fact that its organic as well, bravo to this company.

Summary: Probably Great for Food, The Smell, Not So Much for Body or Hair
