I will likely get the raw version of this because I feel like I walk around smelling like food (HORRIBLE!!). My brother bought the raw version and it smells like paradise compared to the cooking oil version. If you want to spread this over bread or use it as a cooking aid, then this is the product for you. Summary: Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil
Text: The smoke temperature is very low and it is difficult to get out of the canister as it crumbles when trying to spoon some. It also evaporates quickly.Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 15-Ounce Tubs (Pack of 2)

It comes in a plastic jar. The toasty taste and smell are to over powering for me. Leaves me feeling a little queasy. Otherwise its a nice oil and I can buy it at the local Martians grocery store. I can't eat it alone and even in my morning oatmeal its still to much. If you love an over powering taste and smell of coconut you will probably love this product if you don't then pass on this one.

Summary: OK stuff if used within reason.
Text:
First, I'm not sure why it's called "oil": it's butter, not oil; it's solid w/o refrigeration. The consistency is translucent sorta clunky white, sorta like grated candle would look. Just like butter, it immediately melts in your hand or mouth, to say nothing of the frying pan. Smells great, tastes also nice: like, well, coconut. Supposedly it's great for cooking due to its supposedly higher heat-resistance something: it's supposed to keep its nutritional qualities when heated better than other common cooking oils. There's a rub though: with many foods you can mix and match and achieve some sort of mixed flavour -- not with this stuff! It's irrepressible: whatever you add it to -- veggies, cakes, meat, cardboard, or motor oil -- will then smell/taste like coconut and nothing beside. It overpowers every other flavour. So the only cooking variables you have left when using it is texture and sweetness (and looks, I guess). It goes very well with something that's sweet (probably because we're used to coconut being used in sweets). From what I've tried, it goes well with carrots, apples, sunflower seeds (anything nutty-tasting), stuff like that. Real good with sweet potatoes. But I would not recommed using it for cooking meat (unless you like your pork chops smelling and tasting like coconut). You can't kill this flavour, that's what I'm getting at. I'm using it carefully (not too much and in suitable combinations) and I'm happy with it so far. The product seems good, and so is the price (Added on 12/18/2010: that was the price at the time of purchase, $13.54 on Dec 2, 2010 -- and now, only two weeks later, the price on this page is $18.46, amazing, no? A 30% increase in two weeks, wow, these guys sure are optimistic about the value of their product).

A bit of a warning: there's a megaton of unsubstantiated semi-literate BS online about miraculous powers of coconut oil. Be careful about it: coconut oil is pure saturated fat (a serving consists of 14 grams of fat, 13 of them saturated) -- and I've found no acceptable medical/scientific info in support of the healthfulness of saturated fat (while there's a lot on the opposite). What I did find was that it's not openly harmful when used in small doses: a healthy 200-lbs 40-sh male, not overweight and exercising regularly, is allowed 200 saturated-fat calories a day. A serving of coconut oil is 130 calories, but of course, you'll get saturated fats from other foods too. Another thing is that coconut oil contains no appreciable amounts of vitamins/minerals (unlike butter, which is _loaded_ with all kinds of goodies). So be careful: despite the squall of shilling on the net and in print, it's not health food. But it's tasty and not like lethally bad, so...
-------
Added on 12/18/2010: I'm half-way through the first jar, and I find myself using it less and less. It's too smelly, and I just don't have that much opportunity to use it for stuff where it's OK. Besides being food, it is supposedly also good for external use, for skin and hair; I haven't tried it this way (yet; maybe I will). But I have a feeling that _as food_ it doesn't have much of a future in this household: it's too overpowering, too particular.
-----
01/01/2011: Tried it for skin lotion: well, um, yes and no. No: it doesn't get absorbed into the skin, and the area of application stays greasy forever, so you can't do it before going out (even wiping with, say, paper towel, doesn't remove enough of it, so you'll stain the clothes with oil). Yes: it has a terrific staying power, hours and several hand washes after application there's still something remaining on the skin. And I work with my hands a lot, with the result that they tend to get real dirty, so I wash hands frequently and rather severely, the surgical way: very hot water, several soap-ups, brush. This causes severe dehydration of the skin, so I've always used hand lotion immediately after, but with coconut oil the skin remains slightly oiled, soft and moisturised even after a couple of such washes.

So, finally: I'm not sure how (and whether) I'll continue to use coconut oil: I have definitely ceased to use it as food; as moisturiser we'll see... at least it's marginally cheaper than dry-skin cream so I'll give it a longer try. But the cream dries up in a minute, so it's more practicable, I must say. Doesn't smell of coconut either! :-) I must say I did not find the product as useful as it's hyped, so I'm taking one star off right now. I'll revisit in a month or two: if I discover by then that I've stopped using this thing altogether, I'll update the review to this effect.
--------
02/20/2011: Bottom line: I think I've settled into a two-sided routine with this oil: I use it, first, for light-frying/sauteing veggies (with yams or sweet potatoes as a basis; adding greens, like spinach, in the mix later on). I don't do this often though, 'cause I prefer to steam or eat raw, rather than fry anything; sauteing is quicker though, so when I'm pressed for time, this is workable. The other use is for skin: skin really loves this oil -- in addition to staying hydrated forever, it becomes very even in texture and colour; after shower I grease myself up, literally from head to toe, and it's just lovely (except for the clothes who get stained :-).

I have ordered this product before and have always been happy. However I was very disappointed with this order as one of the tubs was NOT extra virgin. The product was yellow and had a burnt smell which means it was not cold pressed extra virgin, even though it was labelledcas such  Very deceptive and dishonest business practice.

Well they didn't even ship this product to my house so they returned my money so at least they returned my money but I never got this so I can't really write a review about something I have never used but they have sent me like 5 e-mails and wont leave me alone until I write one so here it is

ordered this - upon delivery it was melted in/all over the box, even outside of the plastic bag it was sealed into.
(unsure of how a sealed product could have leaked out of its container when it was sealed under the lid)

felt like it wasn't sealed well enough to have been safe or healthy to use.
no expiration date either.

Ordered this in Mid-March. 2 plastic jars in a plastic bag. Although the jars were sealed, they had leaked. A lot. Not sure if they had been exposed to heat or air pressure - but it was such a gunky mess, I tossed them. In addition to mess, was concerned potentially contaminated

I got this when it was on sale in the gold box. I like cooking with a lot of oil, so i thought I would try this coconut oil out. It seems to be a good brand, but I have learned that cooking with coconut oil is not for me. I can not appreciate the coconut flavor in my whole meal. I like drinking coconut water and eating coconut ice cream, but i think I will stick with olive oil for my cooking. I just use this oil for my skin after sunburns or if i want to wrestle with my wife.

Summary: Coconut Oil ... not what I expected
Text:
I don't know what I was expecting from coconut oil in general but I guess I thought it would have a real sweet almost tropical smell but when I opened up the jar, I didn't get that at all. After doing some research after I received the product I found out that the Nutiva brand has more of a nutty smell than some others. So maybe next time I may try a different brand.

For the good stuff, I do like the consistancy and the way it instantly liquifies in my hands before putting it on my hair. I will continue to use this oil, but will just mix it with something else with a stronger smell to over power the nutty oil smell.

Just got my Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 15-Ounce Tubs (Pack of 2)and I was delighted! I was tired of those old, loose, worn out and dried up Coconut oils that i had grown accustom to. This jar was sooo tight! Even with the natural lubrication qualities of the oil. I must say, it was a good thing they package this product in what some of you are calling "cheap plastic", it allowed the container to stretch just that little extra bit. Had it been a more rigid container like glass, there is no way I could have enjoyed myself to completion. I LOVE THIS PRODUCT! It is also a good thing it comes in a pack of 2 because after the first time you crack the lid,... well, lets suffice to say that the product is now "Nutiva Organic Coconut Oil, 15-Ounce Tub (Pack of 2)" My pubic hair has never looked so radiant and soft and its hard to imagine a smoother johnson.

Also, cleanup is a snap with a little Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz

Summary: to use or not to use???????
Text: I haven't really used it too much yet.......  On the occasions that I have it's not really been what I wanted it to be, which has made me use it less -  I don't know - I need more time.......

Summary: I bought this for my hair
Text: I bought this for my hair after reading some reviews about how good it is for the hair - I think its really good for a pre-shampoo but not as a leave in.  One it makes my curly hair a bit frizzy if I use it as a leave in and two, bees are attracted to it...... not fun running to my car to get away............  but I hear its great for cooking with though :)

I ordered this product and just got my box today 4/21/2011.  When I opened the box there was another box, so I opened the next box and there is cocunut oil all over the 2 jars, bubble wrap and all over the box!  I will never order this again, as today I received my box and they already close the return date!  There is a major problem here and I do not recommend anyone ordering this product.  I want my money back.

I like the flavor of coconut in my favorite noodle soup. I used this coconut oil to prepare my pancakes as well. It gives nice flavor. However I felt that over time the flavor was not as strong as I first opened the package. Also the price seems to be a little more.

These just arrived and I was very disappointed to see that the jars are plastic. I thought Nutiva was a more "green" company than to cut corners like that. Sure, it's recyclable: once. Glass is a better choice, especially since this is an oil and every other day a new study comes out showing how much plastic packaging leaches into food. I wish the product description on Amazon would mention how it's packaged.

This product may be great for tanning (over your sunscreen of course), but it is not good for cooking unless you are making a coconut pie, cake or cookies (GF of course) because it tastes and smells like coconut.

I should have been tipped off by the plastic container and by what appears to be a lower than I expected melting point, but I admit that I was looking for an economical solution to Subscribe & Save for my adult children as I do all that I can to help them eat right. I am telling them to use this as body oil and I will buy them some Spectrum Naturals Coconut Oil.

This was a 2 pack.  One of the jars had obviously been opened before.  The shipping box was slimy from whatever amount of oil seeped out.  So my great deal on a 2 pack turned into an OK deal for a one pack.  I will not purchase a Nutiva product again.  Beware that all grocery items are not able to be returned.

The Nutiva coconut oil was not moisturizing, which wasn't a surprise since oil doesn't moisturize, it just coats whatever you put it on. As such, once you moisturize your skin then apply coconut oil, this can help slow down the evaporation of the moisture into the air. That is great if you are less than 30 years old.  At 50+ I actually want and need moisture. I used this product faithfully for 6 weeks and all it did was smooth my legs for about an hour and then they were parched and dried looking again because I hadn't actually added moisture. My legs also felt greasy and had a faint odor of coconut. I don't really want a 2-step process of using a moisturizer on my legs then coating them with coconut oil.  As a face moisturizer it just made my face break out (yuuuuck!). As for the taste, I'll just say that butter has nothing to fear from this stuff. I really can't believe I fell for the hype and wasted my money with this purchase.

I use this to put on my psoriasis to help keep the skin layers down and itching away. Has worked very well. I would recommend to anyone who is tired of all the prescription and over-the-counter endless, useless topicals that are out on the market today. I have had psoriasis for 20 years and have tried several chemotherapy treatments, one almost killed me. So, I'm going all natural. I also soak in Dead Sea salt baths three to four times each week to help keep the layers and itching down. It has changed my life!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I've tried several different brands of coconut oil (including one relatively pricey, self-publishing, industrial-tasting brand) and keep coming back to this brand. When making a dish that really calls for coconut flavor, this one holds up very well either after heating or by itself. The coconut flavor is not overwhelming when cooking, and tastes like coconut (and nothing else!) by itself. If you're going to be trying to up your healthy fat intake with coconut oil or use it to treat one of the many things coconut oil is supposed to be good for, this is by far the most palatable one I've tasted.

My only complaint is that ordering on Amazon can be problematic in warmer months. My jar leaked all over the inside of the box, though the jar wasn't cracked and didn't appear to be previously opened. There needs to be a better seal or the product needs to be stabilized upright during shipping.

Summary: Great for Skincare. Great for Health. Good Stong Smell.
Text:
Add Vitamin E to help with wrinkles and stretch marks. Only moisturizer that does not break out my Ultra sensitive skin, no clogged pores. Really after thirty years of searching countless products this actually helps my face look way way better. The sking on my hands, neck, chest, and lips love it too. Use it all over, makes skin almost as soft as skin so soft does. :)

Better price on Amazon with auto-delivery than at Earth-fare, which carries tons of this stuff. Any product that is carried in such quantity at a health food store always catches my attention.

Strong smell with cooking, use limited amounts for introducing taste to family members. Butter replacement. When I have kids it will be my go-to oil for adding full fat flavor to veggies, muffins, and toast.

Great in the bedroom too. ;)

Look up health benefits and uses with an online search.

At first I was a little worried that my eggs would taste like coconut, but I really don't notice.  I use it instead of butter on my toast and it goes great with jam or cinnamon sugar!  Melts easier than cold butter also.

This is the second time I've ordered this product. I am very pleased with the way it melts and cooks. We use it to "fry" about all of our foods at our house. It gives a slight flavor to the foods we cook, but it's very mild. We'll certainly be buying this oil again.

Summary: Highly Recommend Using as a Moisturizer
Text: This double pack was a terrific deal (~$10) compared to local stores. I bought this product mainly to moisturize my very dry skin and it works wonders! It does not leave the skin feeling greasy compared to other products (e.g. jojoba oil) and is much more economical. I enjoy the very natural smell of coconut when I first use it on the skin, but the smell dissipates shortly afterwards. Cooking with it is like cooking with canola oil - it does not impart a coconut taste to the final dish. Use oils in moderation, including coconut. One jar is used for cooking and the other is kept in the bathroom as part of my beauty routine. As other reviews have noted, I wished it was in a glass jar.
Great oil for cooking. Moisturizing skin and hair. Adds great flavor to fish, veggies....whatever you're cooking. Something healthy that tastes great.

I purchased the two pack of this thinking that I would keep one in the bathroom and use it for skin and haircare, and the other in the kitchen for cooking.  I haven't yet had a chance to use the oil for cooking, but I have been using it on my hair and skin, and it has a very nice, light, but very moisturizing feel.  It sinks right in to the hair, and keeps it moist without making it too greasy.  It's a solid at room temperature, but it softens right in your hands, so you don't have to use any effort to get it soft.  It has a light coconut scent that is not too sweet smelling.  I haven't tried it for this purpose yet, but I imagine it would be perfect for removing eye makeup.  Again, I can't attest to how it works as a cooking oil, but for skin and hair care, I highly recommend it.

Summary: Wonderful but very strong coconut flavor
Text: VERY nice coconut oil.  I've been using it exclusively in my cooking lately b/c I wanted to see how it performed for everything from baking to using in savory recipes.  It definitely lends a coconut flavor to all foods.  If you love coconut, that might be acceptable.  I love coconut but coconut flavored biscuits and coconut flavored sausage gravy is a bit off-putting.  Just to give you some warning.  I'm going to hunt for some more mild-tasting oil to use in my savory dishes.
We use this coconut oil for everything! I make deodorant with it, bake with it use it to make popcorn, clean wounds with it, moisturize with it, and more and more.

I use this oil as a sealant for my hair, and I love it! Not only does it soften the hair, but it really seeps into the strands, so it doesn't have a greasy, heavy feeling.

The scent is very pleasant--not overpowering at all, and smells like REAL coconut, unlike the overly sweetened smell of hair products at most stores (obviously because it's the real, edible kind).

I absolutely love this product. I have very curly African-American hair (no chemicals), and I was searching for something all-natural to add to my hair care regimen. After some careful research, I decided to try this.

I would recommend extra virgin coconut oil to anyone who may have dry hair, or is looking for something 100% natural to use for their hair.

:)

I love this coconut oil. I've seen many reviews on this product with customers who raved over this product. And I must admitted this is a great product. Mostly used on my hair as a deep conditoner, moisturizer, for shine and health of the hair. It's light enough to use everyday. Used as deep conditioner for hot oil treatment. Nourish and condition the scalp and hair without build up. Best Coconut oil ever used. Will fouth time purchasing this product....5 stars!

ProfileName: L. S. Thomas "book devourer & trinket horder ;)"
Text: So I got this because I go through an UNBELIEVABLE amount of beauty products...lotion being one...and I had yet to find one that left me feeling moisturized from shower to shower without feeling overly greasy, overtly fragranced, etc... so a friend recommended Coconut oil... and since I haven't quite yet used it for cooking (it came with two tubs)...I can only state that it smells like coconut cookies initially and then once rubbed in and after a few minutes it's a barely there scent but solid at room temp and melts when rubbed into your hands so needless to say I love it.

I had heard about the benefits of coconut oil from a friend (who swears by coconut water, which is quite possible the nastiest drink ever made). I decided to give it a try.

I first used it in my hair. I am an African-American female, with natural hair, and I use the coconut oil to seal in the moisture in my hair after I condition my hair in the mornings. It gave my hair a beautiful sheen, and kept it soft throughout the day, so I definitely love its hair benefits.

Then I also used it on a patch of really dry skin that I have, right on my leg. I suffer with eczema, and it tends to get worse over the dry winter months. I've been rubbing it in every morning after my shower, and I can see a significant improvement. So two thumbs up for the skin benefits as well.

As far as cooking goes, I'm considering using it to sautee some fish and make this coconut-lime tilapia dish I saw a recipe for. If anyone has any other suggestions for how to use it in my cooking, I would love to know. Can it be used in place of any oil? I know different oils have different heat capacities, and didn't know if you could fry with this type of oil.

Thanks!!

The main reason I purchased this oil was to use as a conditioning treatment and daily oil for my hair. And for that it was great--soft, moisturized hair that wasn't weighed down. I then began to mix it with some cheap lotion and glycerin and voila! I now have the most moisturized skin. My feet, which generally take a beating since I wear flip flops a lot, look the best the have in years (even though I'm only 21 lol). The cracks in my heels have disappeared after applying nightly (not consistent) and wearing cotton socks.

Using tips from other customers, I also put a little of the oil in my unflavored oatmeal. It was delicious! This way I am able to get a lot of flavor without having a lot of sugar like the pre-flavored packets. I can say that this oil is great and I will definitely repurchase. The two bottles came bound together in plastic so that they would not spill on anything. Also, having two bottles allows for cosmetic use for one and food use for the other. And you can't beat the price for the product's quality and numerous uses.

I used to order this in the larger containers from another vendor, but I found that I had a hard time keeping it clean (contamination from scooping it out so much). And, I was just too lazy to repackage it into smaller containers, so I started buying the two 15 ounce containers.

I order this every month or so, and place one in my bathroom (hair, skin, etc) and one in my kitchen (cooking). Works out wonderfully, although I think castor oil is more hydrating. I've only used a few other types of coconut oil, but I find this one pleasing in taste (no weird or artificial taste) and consistency (not lumpy or grainy). It is also the most affordable one I've found.

I use it to make popcorn (yummy) frequently, and eat a scoop or two each week unheated. I just let it melt in my mouth. I know about the risks of using plastic for storage, but at some point, a person has the draw the line. My line has been drawn, and I've decided that coconut oil in plastic containers is A-OK by me. If you have major concerns, I suppose that you could transfer it into a glass jar. I scoop it out with a plastic utensil - something just tells me dipping metal in the jar is counter-productive, but I could be wrong.

This oil is well-regarded in general, I believe, by many.

We have been using Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil for several years now and the results we have experienced are excellent. Taking 2 tablespoons of oil daily greatly helped in raising low body temperature, enabling a sluggish metabolism to be stabilized and facilitating weight loss. We have also used it topically on acne with great success - both in healing the blemishes and removing the scars. It is not a panacea, but in combination with healthy diet and exercise it is a wonderful supplement.
Before we had been buying this in the 54 oz jars, but these 15 oz tubs are so much more convenient to use and for travel -- and the price was lower! Unbeatable combination!
The first shipment was damaged in transit, but one phone call to Amazon resolved the problem and they sent out the replacement shipment express at no charge.

Coconut oil is one of my favorite oils for cooking.  This particular brand has a mild flavor, at least compared to other brands I've tried, and is very reasonably priced.  It is also very stable (keeps well) and is cold pressed virgin.  I used to get this at Wild Oats in Denver, CO to use for stir fries and sautees.  It makes an INCREDIBLE Thai style curry -- you use this oil to fry the spices and vegetables, then simmer everything in coconut milk.  You get several layers of coconut flavor this way.  Plus, this is one of the best oils you can consume *period*.  It is so rich in HDL and other good fats it'll scrub your arteries clean in a month.  The coconut is a magical thing...there's a reason that coconut water can be used in an IV in place of saline for dehydration-- it's meant to be in your blood!

Summary: So moisturizing it made my skin RUB OFF!
Text:
This stuff is incredible. I had been using almond oil, jojoba oil, all different kinds of body lotions, and castor/olive oil. NONE came close to being as brilliant as coconut oil!

About me:

*I am 20 yrs old, white/half-russian. My skin is acne-prone and a BIT on the dry-side. My skin doesn't tan or burn easily, and I am obsessed with anti-aging (I want to write a book on what worked and what didn't when I am older :D). I live in California, so the weather is rather neutral year-round.

*What coconut oil has done for me:

Coconut oil smells sooo nice and has a great texture -- depending on the weather it is either creamy and solid or silky and liquid. Being as affordable as it is, I can smear this all-over my body after showers and it will absorb within 30 minutes to an hour. My skin feels sooo soft and hydrated afterwards and it even helps my sunless tanners last longer! This stuff made my skin so soft that one day I wore cotton shorts from Hollister (so you can imagine, slightly baggy). It was a hot day, and after walking around outside for only around 45 minutes my upper thighs/bikini line were KILLING ME. When I went home I noticed the first layer of skin had rubbed off because it was SO soft!!! This was a bit annoying, so I cut-down on the amount of coconut oil I use...but that was like *Wow*
Also, my boyfriend constantly tells me how soft my skin is when I am using it *waiting for three more to arrive tomorrow!*

Coconut oil is the best moisturizer EVER! I absolutely love this stuff and will continue using it forever! I still use castor oil every few weeks just for the healing properties (I think) and for my eyes/teeth/gums, but this stuff is sooo nice for my skin (and hair in small portions)!

If you want a moisturizer that FINALLY gives the results you want, THIS IS IT!!! Five stars! :D

I've tried coconut oil before, but it was usually refined and unscented. In other words, horrible! Nutiva is great! It smells like fresh coconuts and has a very subtle coconut flavor. I use it to cook and as a body moisturizer. I don't do much deep frying, but I've sauteed shrimp and pan fried fish in this oil. Both turned out wonderfully with a slight coconut flavor which just made it all better for me. I have to agree with everyone that the plastic container is a let down, but I bought some small mason jars and put my oil in them. Works perfectly. That way I have a jar for the kitchen and one for the bath. Definitely try Nutiva if you're even a little curious about coconut oil. You won't be disappointed.

Summary: Gives new meaning to:  eat it or wear it!
Text:
While I ordered the Coconut Oil to cook with, I have found that it is absolutely incredible for other uses! I suffer from psoriasis, and have been known to try anything to relieve it....well, you guessed it, the Coconut Oil was my next victim, and wow was I thrilled with the results. It was soothing, moisturizing, and as a bonus, wonderfully aromatic. After a couple weeks of continued use on my elbows, the results were really impressive.

In addition to that, I have used it on my face, feet and hands as an overnight moisturizer, and it's doing wonders to my skin. I also put some in a tiny tub to put on underneath lipstick (which can be so drying!).

Finally, and perhaps most obviously, it is delicious and healthy for cooking. The only caveat I'll put here is that you definitely have to know ahead of time that the coconut smell is there. There are some meals I just don't want to smell like coconut, so those I use my good old canola oil on. But for chicken, with a little soy sauce, it is downright tropical, and I love it! Very very pleased with this purchase, and delighted with Amazon's pricing on it as well.

This coconut oil was great. I have been using it on my face every night after I wash. My skin tone is evening out and my pores look nice. I convinced my fiance to try it where he was chafing...ding! magic! no more chafing. :D he's pumped i'm pumped. This is good quality coconut oil. I do recommend it. It absorbs well, has a nice smell, and last a long time.

Don't even get me started on coconut oil!!! I love it so much. Great for baking, spreading, moisturizing, stirfry, has awesome cleansing properties and clears up baby's diaper rash!!! It's amazing! If you are new to coconut oil you will be intrigued as soon as you start experimenting too!! The taste is great and on the skin it goes along way. It smells nice too! Try it!!!!

This coconut oil (unrefined) is GREAT for baking.  Everyone loves my gluten-free, dairy-free brownies.  The oil is hard when refridgerated (cold brownies), but liquifies above 78 degrees F., so it literally melts in your mouth.  It also gives brownies a great extra sweetness.  You can use it in place of butter or lard in most baking recipes.  I also use it in the pancake pan and egg pan and to grease pans before baking.  This two-bottle version is actually less expensive per oz. than the large bottle version using the subsribe and save option.

Read so many reviews about this product that I just had to try it.  So far, I have used it in place of oil and butter, on toast, mixed in oatmeal, and on pancakes/waffles.  I sneak it into anything I can for my kids. It is great on my face, not greasy like I expected, it absorbs and really makes my skin glow.  I put it on my daughter's forehead where she was beginning to get little bumps, and they were gone in 2 days.  Let's see, what else?  I am happy to find a natural product that has so many uses.  I wish I had know about this last year when I had to go through Chemotherapy for breast cancer.  I have read all kinds of studies where coconut oil has been used to help patients after chemo.  I had terrible memory loss and "chemo fog".  Will definitely re-order, and send some to my Dad who has always worried about the possibility of getting Alzheimers.  (Google has great information about this.)  Hope this helps!

This product worked very good. I use it on my natural hair as a conditioner and a moisturizer and it has worked excellent for both of them. My niece who has very course kinky hair has used it and it has made her hair noticeably smoother and softer.
High quality product! I just wish that it didn't come in a cheap plastic container.. It was delivered to me on a hot day so the liquefied oil was all over my package! Eck.

Summary: LOVE the Oil; Wish the Jar were Glass
Text:
I love this coconut oil and I continue to order it regularly, but for health purposes, I wish it came in a glass jar. If it did, I'd give it 5 stars. I also wish it were cold pressed.

Please consider glass?

I use the EVCO for a lot of things...I put a tablespoon in with my coffee, I have used a mixed of baking soda and the EVCO to brush my teeth and my teeth are whiter than they have ever been and they feel much cleaner after brushing, I also use it for my nightly moisturizer on my face and it helps get rid of any pimples I may have. I've also used it for cooking eggs,seasoning my veggies instead of butter.

Summary: Smells great and so many uses
Text: Coconut oil is amazing, and a very versatile product.  This particular brand has a wonderful smell/taste to it.  Its way better than the LouAna brand from WalMart.  I've also noticed that this product stays liquid better than the LouAna brand.  There are also no granules or impurities.  And if you don't know, this can also be used as massage oil and personal lubricant.  I can't recommend this product highly enough.

I buy a half gallon of this every 6 months or so. I don't worry about it spoiling because it has a much longer shelf life than other oils and a very high heat tolerance. I use it for cooking mostly. It is great on popcorn with sea salt, freshly baked bread, in stir frys and you can often use it in place of butter in many dishes. I have a fabulous raw chocolate recipe that I make with it and give out as gifts. After reading The Coconut Oil Miracle book by Bruce Fife I try to use coconut oil as much as I can. It is anti-viral, anti-bacterial and anti-fungal. Truly a miracle food that is so healthy for you.

I also use it on my hair when it needs a deep conditioning treatment. Just leave it in overnight and wash out the next day and my hair is so shiny and soft afterwards and even feels a bit thicker. It is great for your skin, especially if you feel like you are getting sick. Just slather it on and let its amazing healing properties absorb into your blood stream via your skin. I use it in smoothies to help my immune system as well. And if I feel like I am coming down with something I will mix it with orange juice like is recommended in the Coconut Oil Miracle book.

I also oil pull with it. If you haven't read about oil pulling with coconut oil, you should. It is a great teeth whitener among many other things including healing mouth sores.

I really like the Nutiva brand because it tastes fresher than most. Very clean coconut flavor. I like that it is organic and doesn't have any thing funky in it nor is it processed unhealthily like so many other brands.

I've been using this product for a week now and I cannot believe the difference in my skin. I have seborrheic dermatitis on my scalp, ears and near my eyebrows and I have put the coconut oil on and left it on overnight (using a towel on my pillow because it is greasy) and the difference is amazing! I was given an Rx from my dermatologist (Luxiq Mouse - which is a steroid), but I don't like the idea of putting that on daily, as it thins out your skin.
I've tried lotions (cetaphil, eucerine, etc.) but I have never had an improvement like this.

In addition to the seborrheic dermatitis, I have very dry skin. At the end of the day, if I'm wearing a dark-colored shirt, upon removal, the shirt is lined with skin flakes (gross, I know). But, since using this coconut oil, the flakes are GONE! It's truly unbelievable! Prior to receiving the coconut oil, I was washing with Cerave and using their lotion as well. While I noticed my skin didn't feel as "tight", I still had flakes. It wasn't until I mixed the coconut oil with the Cerave that the flakes disappeared.

I also take 1 tbsp of coconut oil daily, with my breakfast. The flavor is amazing!

I would 100% recommend this to anyone with dry skin or seborrheic dermatitis!

Use this for my very dry, scaly skin specially during winter time. Feels really great! Not a dry spot and it lingers for days i noticed.

Use it on my face as well during night time. Use sparingly, a little goes a lot.

I have tried three different brands of coconut oil: Barlean's, Nutiva, and Tropical Traditions. The VIRGIN coconut oil has a nice, light coconut flavor. The EXPELLER pressed coconut oil has no flavor. So, if you a buying virgin coconut oil here's my tip: Barlean's had the best flavor and smell...I wanted to eat it right out of the jar it smelled so good, tasted phenomenal!! Barlean's was the most expensive of the three but for the flavor worth it. Nutiva was a close second in taste & smell and is more economical. Tropical Traditional (which I have always loved their products in the past) did not measure up in flavor. In fact it had a strange, burnt taste and smell...something was off about it. If you want no coconut flavor at all, get the expeller pressed coconut oil. It is less expensive than virgin coconut oil...all three companies use proper, healthy, non-chemical practices to extract the oil, so I would go with the best buy for the expeller cold pressed oil but pay a little more for the flavored version.Barlean's Organic Oils Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 16-Ounce JarNutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 15-Ounce Tubs (Pack of 2)32-oz glass - Gold Label Organic Virgin Coconut Oil - 1 quart

If you are going to eat this kind of stuff, then you might as well do it right. THIS is the only brand I buy for my cold pressed, extra virgin coconut oil. This is fantastic and at this price, I'm even happier. You will love this product.
fyi - it can solidify pretty easily at temperatures below 65 degrees Fahrenheit. Just use your butter knife and kind of scrape a bit at a time. Enjoy. :)

Just started using coconut oil at home a few weeks ago. I started with a brand I purchased a local Hy-Vee because I wanted to try it out before I bought a more substantial amount. THe first buy was a refined coconut oil made by Spectrum. It worked well for what I used it for - nightly oil cleansing on my face, moisturizer and as an addition to my weekly deep conditioner for my hair...occasionally I'd spread some on toast. It worked out well, so i purchased ther Nutiva and was expecting a much better product than the Spectrum....it arrived yesterday and I was not disappointed. As soon as I opened it I could smell it - it smells and tastes AMAZING - just like fresh coconut. If you're not a fan of coconut, remember that this is not the smell/taste of sweetened, dried coconut or coconut fragrance...it smalls like actual coconut. I did my first oil cleanse with it last night and it seems slightly gritty at times, but nothing that is concerning to me. This is definitely a staple from now on!!

This is the only Coconut oil I have ever used so I can't compare it to others. But the fact that I love it so much that I've never considered switching should tell you about the quality of this oil. It's creamy, fragrant and tasty. I use it to cook and bake a variety of items from Thai, Indian foods, and Mexican foods to cookies and cakes. The subscribe and save price is excellent as well. I had previously purchased this brand of coconut oil from a local health food store and I'm now getting twice the oil for only a few dollars more from Amazon.

I've tried many different brands of coconut oil. So far, Nutiva beats all the other ones. I use it as an oil/shortening substitute for everything from frying to baking. It is also great to simply spread on toasted bagels or bread. If I'm not using in foods, then I'll eat a couple tablespoons daily as suggested by my doctor, the health/nutritional benefits are finally and increasingly being recognized and praised. You won't regret trying this product, and you'll be hooked on it!

Uses:
-drizzle on toast, green salad
-after bath oil to retain skin moisture
-massage oil
Pros:
-tub as pictured
-pleasant, fresh coconut aroma
-smooth, clean taste
-pure white color
-solid at room temperature below ~75 F
Cons:
-one out of six tubs leaked during shipping
-awkward container for pouring if room temp above ~80 F

Summary: Great Stuff for a Number of Things
Text:
I was almost put off using coconut oil entirely, after purchasing another brand (I think NOW was it, but different packaging). It came hard as a rock, yellow-looking and smelled pretty foul (almost sickly-sweet) - certainly nothing like coconut. I literally was chipping it out of the jar, and melting it was near impossible. Eventually, I realized that I was dealing with rancid oil, so it's pretty fortunate that I didn't use it all that often. Yuck.

After watching a view Youtube videos for hair care, I noticed everyone's was white, creamy and you could easily scoop it out of the jar, so I decided to give it another shot and purchased Nutiva in February 2011. I'm so glad I did, too, because this stuff is great and for a number of things, some of which caught me off guard.

- Cooking -
I enjoy cooking with it now and then, especially with my quick-fix quesadillas when I don't have time to cook anything else. However, it doesn't work on everything due to the subtle yet nutty flavor it can give, but I do like it for frying. Your place will smell like coconut when you fry with it, as a warning. I do love how fast it heats up, though.

- Hair -
I originally intended to use this for hair and as a deep conditioning mask. I am biracial, with 3A/3b and a tinge of 3C hair. While I usually prefer to have it relaxed, I decided to give it a break due to lack of funds. The hard water we have here has been wreaking havoc on my hair and it's been in need of a trim for a while, but this stuff has greatly improved things, and it even can be used (lightly) to help tame frizz to some degree as a leave-in. My ringlets are back and the best-looking they've been since I can remember, and all I've been using since then is just Aphogee Green Tea spray, coconut oil and occasional argan oil.

- Skin -
I consistently use this on my body and at night as skin cream. For the face, you only need a tiny, tiny amount. It also helps to tame down blemishes, which is a bonus, and leaves skin glowy. Last year or the year before, I also developed what looked like flesh-colored moles, which I thought were blemishes at first, but I can't be certain. Nothing I did would get rid of them though, until I started using the oil, which I found odd, but at least it worked! All in all, my skin has dramatically improved using this, with the help of some other products, and I don't feel I have to wear foundation.

- Pets -
I give 1/2 tbls. to my cats and 1 tbls. to my dog a few times a week to help maintain their coats and keep their skin nice. It seems to be doing great and they've stopped driving me mental with scratching. I also tried it in hopes of helping my dog with her seizures. While it's not a drastic improvement, they have been fewer in between, which may or may not have a connection. I just mix it in their food maybe 2-3 days a week (ask your vet about how often, especially if they have health problems), and they love it. Even my female cat, who's picky about what she'll eat licks at the oil before she munches away.

- Warts -
Short of the suspicious-looking things on my face at one point, I don't get moles, warts, or even freckles. However, I did get one whopping wart on the top of my big toe last year, which nothing would get rid of. I tried apple cider vinegar, wart patches and gels - you name it; I tried it. Not only did it hurt like crazy and work slowly, but it never got rid of it. All I did get was a scar and a lot of grief, only for it to return a few weeks later.

When I started using coconut oil on the skin, I realized one day, like with my face, that my wart that had grown back was getting smaller. I kept watching it and finally realized the connection. I started using bandaids and applied a glob of oil on the spot before bed and then really started noticing results. This wart was the size of a chick pea (sorry to be gross lol), but now you can't see anything.

I finally looked things up and realized that it was the acid in the oil that attacks lipid-coated virus cells, such as what's associated with HPV (warts), so I guess it makes sense. I was surprised though! I can tell due to the texture of the skin that it's not 100% gone (roots), but it still getting better and I'm not embarrassed anymore. It took about a month, but the more painful options took just as long and this is pain-free. So, it's something to try!

Love this stuff and can't stop raving about it. I'm going to purchase more soon in this size to keep one in my kitchen and one in my bathroom again, plus a larger one for the mutts. The bathroom one still has plenty in it, despite me using it near-daily.

I have had coconut oil before but none that compares to this.  It is sooooo good!  It looks good, smells good, and tastes good.  It is well worth the price.  It is very smooth and has a slightly sweet taste.  I use it in place of butter and shortening.  It is really good on toasted bread. I suppose it would be a really good skin moisturizer also.

I'd seen many suggestions for coconut products, including coconut oil, on the healthy living blogs I subscribe to, so I figured I'd see what the buzz was all about. We searched at the local natural foods stores and weren't able to find it, so I turned to Amazon. I swapped it in for the canola oil in a boxed brownie mix - delicious! It had a slight coconut flavor (likely because of the amount it calls for), and the oil stays solid at room temperature, thus minimizing spillage. Next, I'll be testing it with savory foods to see if the coconut flavor comes through in eggs/veggies/etc. But for baked goods, I'd totally suggest the swap.

(Oh yeah, and this product was eligible for Prime, so I had it within 3 days...nothing beats that!)

I use the small container strictly for my skin.  I never fear a heat rash or break outs.  This is great for Athletes Foot.  Any type fungus.  My son has dandruff and he rubs it in his scalp, no more dandruff.  This brand is the creamiest that I have found.  Good for skin and hair makes skin extremely soft. Melts good in the bath.

This is great stuff... it confers an open, airy flavor to things that calls out to be used (and eaten).

Really makes me want to come up with more ways to integrate it and cook with it... I'm impressed.

Mixes well with other oils (I keep a garlic-oil concoction at the ready at all times in case there are french loaves that need toasting or eggs that need scrambling)

Very very good.

This is the best coconut oil around!
--"Extra virgin" means it actually smells of coconut and is far less processed than the refined coconut oil that is next to it on the shelf.
--It's a solid when left at room temperature but takes seconds to melt down in a pan and measure accurately into measuring spoons and cups if you're put off by its solid state. It should also be melted down before going into baked goods to be most effective, unless mixing it into something heated.
--I use this coconut oil to toast pecans for my morning steel-cut oats as well as substituting all oils and butter for most of my baked goods!
--It adds a subtle sweetness when replacing butter and any other oil.
--If ever I happen to get this oil on my fingers, I simply rub it in as a moisturizer since it smells heavenly and trumps any other moisturizer I've used.
--The wonderful thing about this oil is that, while high in saturated fat, it is broken down differently in the body and thus is not the bad sort of saturated fat you might normally be weary of (This is as I understand from my own personal research and there is still some debate on the topic).
--So while you shouldn't go overboard and use this by the barral because it's healthier than butter, you can feel better about using it as a substitution.
--I recommend Artisana Organic Raw Coconut Butter 16oz also if you like Nutiva's extra virgin coconut oil that can be added to steel-cut oats and any other food you can sneak it into if you're like me and need to force fat into your diet because you're an active vegetarian lacking consistent source of fat and don't want to have to plan it into meals each day

You can read all the reviews for coconut oil, so there's no need to say it again, but this product has improved my life and the lives of my pets many times, many ways. I have tried several brands, and the Nutiva brand is my favorite for flavor, cost and effectivness.  I love it!  I would recommend this product for everyone, as it offers benefits for every type of problem, and for improvements in energy levels, weight loss, better skin and hair, fighting infections....the list is endless. Bravo Nutiva for offering a product that is reasonably priced of the highest quality, and bravo Amazon for offering this superior product at such a good price point.

I have been having problems with my skin. The moisturizer I was using felt kind of scummy on my face after I added my foundation and I was having troubles with facial redness and dry patches. I was also having heat rash problems in my underarm area. I started using just a little of the coconut oil on my face in place of my moisturizer, then applying my foundation and wow! What a difference! My skin has cleared up and I love the soft smooth way my face feels. My foundation spreads and blends much better. Also, the coconut oil really helps with the heat rash, immediately soothing the discomfort. I like using this as a hand cream too. I look forward to seeing how well it works this winter when the air is much drier.

I have done a little cooking with it, but not enough yet to have an opinion.

Other folks have mentioned that the oil leaked during shipment. I was concerned about this since I ordered it during the summer. I ordered 4 tubs (2 pks of 2 tubs). The plastic containers arrived packed in plastic bags, 2 tubs/bag, within the box. Even though the lids felt pretty tight on the tubs, both of the plastic bags had some coconut oil that had leaked, but not enough to feel cheated. A little oil leaked out of the plastic bags into the box, but they were the only things packed in the box so nothing was ruined. I can see that if the lids had been any looser though, there would have been a mess. Oil is hard to keep in a container with a wide mouth like this.

One more thing...I absolutely love the smell of this stuff. It has a light roasted coconut essence which isn't too strong and doesn't linger overly long, but long enough to enjoy for a short while while it is being absorbed by the skin. Yum!

Summary: Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Cocunut Oil
Text: I purchased this product to use with my other hair products.  I love the results!  After using it for just two days I noticed instant thickness in my hair.  I have it mixed with 3 parts EVCO, 2 parts EVOO, 1.5 part Vitamin E and 1.5 part hari oil with almond oils. I use it as a pre-shampoo treatment and twice daily.

Excellent! I use this in EVERYTHING I cook, I use it in plain rice, fried rice, pasta, frying eggs anything. The flavoring is great and my house is always filled with the delicious aroma. Will try using it in my oil burner and on my skin but its perfect for my hair and leaves it shiny and silky. I have been using this for a few months and I am only halfway through one jar so a little goes a long long way! Excellent product!!
Not just food, but creates soft, healthy coat on dogs.  Just rub in while petting.

I LOVE this cereal. It's so much better than the one that has wheat in it. You get a nice corn grits flavor, along with all of the other delicious grains, and I like the grainy texture.
Plus it's fast and easy to make. I just pour some about 1/3 way into a big mug, I use CorningWare 1035985 French White 20-Ounce Mug (without the lid) add water to about an inch over the top of the cereal, stir, and nuke for about 2:30 min. in the microwave. Don't worry, there are directions on the bag for measurements, and cooking times...

My current favorite way to eat it is to add a heaping Tbsp of (Not Dutch Process) Cocoa Powder (I usually get it at Trader Joes), a small handful of Traverse Bay Fruit Co. Dried Cherries, 4-Pound Box, a small handful of sliced almonds, some cinnamon, a pinch of salt (and/or anything else that sounds good at the time). Cook, stir, and top with some Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 15-Ounce Tubs (Pack of 2), and any kind of milk (cow, soy, almond, hemp...). You'd think you were eating a decadent dessert instead of something healthy!

Enjoy - you won't be disappointed!
